story:
Et si on changeait notre cuisine ?

D’une simple question, j’ai vite découvert les méandres de la conception de cuisine aménagée.

Il existe tant de choix, de qualité et de prix, qu’on ne sait jamais si notre achat est le meilleur.

De ce constat, j’ai parcouru le monde de la conception de cuisine durant des années, de livreur de meubles de cuisine, à la pose de cuisines, en passant par des postes de vendeurs en magasin de grandes enseignes à la direction d’un magasin. J’ai découvert aussi les différences de politique commerciale entre les différentes marques avec les fameuses remises commerciales qui ne veulent plus rien dire car elles sont systématiques voir malhonnêtes.

Parce que je crois sincèrement que cette époque est dépassée, et qu’aujourd’hui nous sommes dans une époque de grande transparence avec la clientèle, j’ai décidé de créer un concept où le client aura toujours la certitude d’obtenir le meilleur prix et cela dès la première présentation de tarif.

Toujours le prix le plus bas et en direct, c’est ainsi que j’ai décidé de mettre en place pour la première fois dans ce métier le ‘’meilleur prix garanti ou remboursement de la différence’’.

J’ai aussi compris qu’avant d’arriver chez les clients, les cuisines passaient par plusieurs intermédiaires. Des plateformes d’assemblage, des intermédiaires de stockage, des agents distributeurs, des enseignes, et tout cela peut représenter jusqu’à 15 % du prix de la cuisine. Après cela, il existe des charges structurelles comme la location du magasin et le coût des expositions qui représentent 20 % du prix de vente de la cuisine.

En éliminant ces deux grandes dépenses, nous arrivons à des offres bien inférieures à celles du marché et cela permets de proposer des produits de qualité très abordable. L’idée de la vente à domicile se profile doucement.

Mon objectif unique : proposer des cuisines sur mesure et uniquement de qualité, à des prix abordables, conçu en fonction des besoins et des habitudes du client.

Pour arriver à cet objectif, plusieurs challenges à gagner. Premièrement, trouver un fabricant proposant des produits de très grande qualité qui accepte de produire nos cuisines. Après plusieurs portes fermées ou produits de mauvaises qualités, après avoir refusé tous les fabricants de cuisine en kit synonyme de mauvaise résistance dans le temps, une usine allemande accepte de produire nos cuisines. Ce sera la plus grosse usine européenne de fabrication de cuisine connue sous le nom de NOBILIA. Et pour varier le choix, le plus gros fabricant Italien de cuisine, spécialisé dans les portes sans poignées et dans les laques, ce sera ARMONY CUCINE.

Reste un point, aussi important que la qualité et que le prix, c’est le service. Pour permettre de bien comprendre les besoins des clients, rien de mieux que de voir  le projet sur place. C’est pourquoi tous nos concepteurs qui conseilleront les clients dans leur choix, feront leur rendez-vous directement chez les clients, pour bien comprendre leurs habitudes et aussi pour bien découvrir les contraintes liées à l’habitation.

C’est ainsi que le concept de vente de cuisine à domicile s’est construit.

Et maintenant qu’on a un concept … que fait-on ?

La grande interrogation, comment trouver des clients sans même avoir un magasin ! Et bien il existe aujourd’hui de nombreux canaux de communication, de réseaux de rencontre et de mise en avant de concept, mais surtout les réseaux sociaux et relationnels. Et c’est là que je vais avoir besoin de l’aide du plus grand nombre d’entre vous.

Premièrement, pour faire parler de ce concept il faut un support pour montrer ce que l’on sait faire. Le site internet est aujourd’hui un moyen de faire parler de nous facilement et à petit prix. Mais il faut que les clients puissent toucher des exemples, et pour cela il va nous falloir des catalogues pour présenter notre concept mais aussi nos produits. Des conceptions de cuisines sur mesure et de très grande qualité avec des exemples de prix pour prouver que nous avons des  tarifs attractifs.

Dans le financement d’une entreprise standard, les financiers proposent des milliers d’€uros pour financer des magasins ou des aménagements, mais pas pour des catalogues et des visites à domicile. Même si le projet est réfléchi pour ne pas avoir de dépenses importantes, il faut tout de même des liquidités.

Le Crowdfunding va nous permettre plusieurs choses :

·  Un tremplin financier pour montrer aux Banques que notre projet est soutenu

·  De se faire connaitre indirectement par le relais des contributeurs ou des sponsors

C’est ainsi que notre projet de financement du Crowdfunding s’est préparé pour trouver un financement qui permettra à ce concept d’être lancé.

Le projet sera lancé à partir de Décembre 2015, nous débuterons par les premiers rendez-vous de conception chez les clients en Belgique avec une équipe actuellement en formation. Puis en Janvier 2016 pour tout le département du 45 le Loiret avec 3 concepteurs, Puis en Février 2016 pour le département du 18 le Cher avec 2 concepteurs, puis en mars pour tout le département du 41 avec 2 concepteurs aussi. Objectif à 18 mois, la vente de 20  cuisines par mois sur les départements du Loiret, du Loir et Cher et du Cher. Objectif à plus long terme, déployer le concept dans les départements à fort potentiel d’achat de cuisine (soit 40 départements en France)

Pour que ce projet se réalise, c’est un budget de 100.000 € qu’il faut lever.

En priorité, ce sont les moyens de communication et les outils de conception avec des ordinateurs puissants, ainsi qu’un logiciel professionnel adapté qui vont devoir demander le plus de financement dans ce budget. Un autre poste de dépense important, le budget de la rémunération et salaires des concepteurs. Le chiffre d’affaire avec une vision pessimiste mais réaliste sera de 150.000 € la première année. Les associés du projet apporteront 15.000 € et toutes les sommes obtenues par le Crowdfunding seront multipliée par 10 par le financement bancaire. Si nous obtenons 1.000 € nous arriverons facilement à emprunter 10.000 € aux banques, si nous obtenons 2.000 € ce sera 20.000 € de prêt. Des prêts cautionnés seront aussi demandés à hauteur de 50.000 €. Des prêts à taux zéro de la région et d’associations qui aident les porteurs de projets innovant pour un montant de 20.000 € clôturera le budget nécessaire à ce projet si nous arrivons à obtenir un soutien massif par le Crowdfunding. Le montant obtenu par les dons du Crowdfunding sera utilisé pour la création et la production du catalogue 2016 et parallèlement servira d’effet de levier pour obtenir des prêts.

Pour les contributeurs ayant fait des dons, des contreparties unique seront proposées débutant de notre catalogue jusqu’à des cuisines sur mesure et uniques.

Qualité du produit rime avec qualité des conceptions et donc avec le professionnalisme du concepteur

C’est dans ce sens que nous lancerons le projet de l’école de formation de conception de cuisines. Pour garantir le maintien de la qualité des conceptions et du service que nous allons proposer à notre clientèle, une filiale de formation sera créée en Mai 2016. Cette école de la conception de cuisine sera orientée pour permettre à des novices de pouvoir accéder à une formation de qualité puis à un emploi directement à la fin de cette formation dans notre entreprise.

Le plus grand challenge … nous faire connaitre

Que vous soyez contributeur ou non, vous pouvez croire en notre concept. Pour nous aider, nous croyons beaucoup dans le pouvoir des réseaux relationnels et sociaux.

Intéressé par la conception de votre cuisine aménagée ? Faites le test en demandant une visite gratuite, recevez notre devis et découvrez nos tarifs avantageux, contactez-nous via notre site internet www.cycocuisine.com  et tout cela sans engagement, c’est la base de notre concept.

Nous avons besoin de vous, mettez nous en avant, parlez de notre projet avec notre concept de vente de cuisine à domicile,  et de notre équipe dynamique et professionnelle.

L’équipe CyCo Cuisine

story:
U-NITE Gathering starts now!

Hi,

My name is Steve . With a bunch of passionate people we want to realise  a Happening taking place next Summer.

The main vision of this event is to unite people from the different linguistic regions of Belgium for a weekend of unity and creativity.


UNITY (synonyms: consensus, harmony, identity, solidarity)

A 4-day event where people come from all over Belgium and beyond to camp, eat, dance, do workshops, party and have a good time together.


CREATIVITY (synonyms: imagination, inspiration, originality)

A place for every form of artistic expression, people actively participating in shaping the event. Providing different workshops where talents can be discovered and improved.


INTEGRITY (synonyms: character, honesty, goodness, righteousness)

We want to create a non-judgmental, community-focused event open to people from different backgrounds, beliefs and lifestyles. We are open about our faith in Jesus Christ.

We need:

To start organising an event like this, money is needed. We are currently looking for 5000€. This money will be used for office expenses, travel expenses, print work, website and a publicity campaign.

What is it for?

We strongly believe that an event like this could have a big impact on Belgium, as this country suffers from division. A long weekend where people from different backgrounds and language groups are creative together, will break down walls. Creativity is the main "language" of our culture.  

Other Festivals like Greenbelt in the UK or Freakstock in Germany create a unique community feeling, where everybody is welcome, no matter what believe.

A unique platform to meet new people and give birth to new relations and creative projects.

Challenges.

Of course a big project like this needs a lot of help. Volunteers, finances, know-how...

We are happy that we have support from people who have knowledge in organising big events like this, f.ex. Freakstock. But we are also confident that this is just the right time for an event like this. In a world where we are more and more exposed to fear, war and disunity, an event like this goes strictly in the opposite spirit. 

We see more and more people getting excited about it, be part of it!

Other Ways You Can Help

You might just have no money, or feel like contributing in another way. Please let us know,  we are sure that you have talent! We need volunteers in every area you can imagine. 

Please get in touch with us: info@u-nite.be

story:
Riparty è una festa artistico-culturale che anima le piazze di Roccabianca da ormai 5 anni.
Nella meravigliosa e suggestiva cornice delle piazze di Roccabianca si svolgeranno manifestazione artistiche di vario genere in un continuo susseguirsi di eventi ed emozioni. 
Riparty ormai è il sentirsi parte di un tutto più ampio che va al di là dell'immaginazione è uno stile di vita.
Concerti musicali di band emergenti, performance di gruppi più affermati provenienti da palcoscenici lontani, presentazione di libri e “chiacchierate” con importanti esponenti culturali anche di livello nazionale, spettacoli e giochi per bambini, esibizione di artisti di strada, pittura dal vivo, esposizione di opere artistiche (quadri, fotografie e installazioni).
Tutto questo contornato da stand di opere d'ingegno, birra artigianale e cucina tipica.

Vieni a vivere con noi questa atmosfera magica che ti riempirà il cuore, la mente e lo spirito.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Alicia Smith and I am the owner of Quarter Kid Hand made dolls.

I have made dolls for many rock stars, TV personalities, and actors over the years and this time I want to to do something a bit different. I have contacted The Guiness book of world records and they have accepted my challenge to make the world's largest Voodoo doll.

the current record is held at 22 ft 8 inches with an 8 ft arm span.

 

I intend to make my doll 25+ft  tall with an 11 ft arm span. I will make it bigger if I exceed my goal funding :)

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

At this point I am in need of not only the world record specific materials which consist of the same thing I make my normal dolls out of, but I will also need a place to make the doll and a place to store it afterwards.

Guiness needs $7500+ to get them to send somebody to record the happenings and determine rather the doll meets the requirements. Also the $7500 includes them to contact local media and other marketing for me.
 
 

Even if you can't contribute monitarily, you can help in many other ways by posting this to your facebook wall or sending this to somebody that would like to be part of the awesome endevor :)

I have made dolls for many rock stars, TV personalities, and actors over the years and this time I want to to do something a bit different. I have contacted The Guiness book of world records and they have accepted my challenge to make the world's largest Voodoo doll.
the current record is held at 22 ft 8 inches with an 8 ft arm span.
 
I intend to make my doll 25+ft  tall with an 11 ft arm span. I will make it bigger if I exceed my goal funding :)
 


What We Need & What You Get
Break it down for folks in more detail:
At this point I am in need of not only the world record specific materials which consist of the same thing I make my normal dolls out of, but I will also need a place to make the doll and a place to store it afterwards.
Guiness needs $7500+ to get them to send somebody to record the happenings and determine rather the doll meets the requirements. Also the $7500 includes them to contact local media and other marketing for me.
 
 
Even if you can't contribute monitarily, you can help in many other ways by posting this to your facebook wall or sending this to somebody that would like to be part of the awesome endevor :)

story:
Hi, my name is Allison, but a lot of people know me by my nickname, Sylus. I have been going to CONvergence for many years now and have helped participate in a number of party rooms. This year some friends and I are venturing out and trying to throw our own party room.

Our party room's theme is the Prancing Pony, based off of the Lord of the Rings trilogy. As this is a first year party the start up costs are rather high. We need to come up with decorations, food, drink, places for people to sit. The whole shibang to really bring this party to life. That is were you fine folks come in.

Our wallets are at their breaking point but we still want this part to happen. Any help you guys can provide would be absolutely awesome.Just a dollar would be appreciated, more then a dollar would be appreciated. We have a goal of $600 so that we can provide rootbeer and ginger ale to our guests. We are also building a custom bar to help create the atmosphere. We are building a bunch of wooden benches, a fake fireplace and possibly small tables if we have enough time. We would love to throw this party and know many people are looking forward to it. Please help make this a reality. You can also follow us on facebook. our group is here: https://www.facebook.com/groups/166268086873199/

story: My mother was born in Genoa, Italy and I have had a life-long passion for Italy and a long held dream of going some day. Come hell or high water - I'm going this Spring! Instead of a traditional birthday gift this year, it would mean so very much to me if you would be willing to contribute to my Dream Trip to Italy fund. Any amount will be greatly appreciated! Even five bucks! That's at least one cannoli, no?

story:
"EDUCATE to ACTIVATE" Get This Book "21st Century - The Age Of Protection" Into Schools & Libraries!

ARTIST for the OCEAN

Facebook 

Twitter

I am an artist that has been building a book of my "Awareness" Paintings the past 6 years. I feel very deeply about the information that I have compiled regarding the ocean and the voice of the animals in each chapter of the book. I created this book to further share their voice from a visual voice I painted to allow more individuals to hear/view the ocean voice and make well informed choices in their lives. These choices can create a better life for the animals, their community, and the earth.
 
I am an advocate for improving the educational system to allow us as individuals to evolve with the changes that are occurring around the world. Today is the time for "PROTECTION" of what is still alive on this planet.
"EDUCATE to ACTIVATE" is the objective so why not donate books to the school system and public libraries. If they are on the shelves then they can be shared immensely!

There are at least 60 art photos shared in the book including the individual paintings that have a strong story to expose in each chapter. The chapters speak about an animal and their background, then how this story was painted as a visual voice, finishing with the positive impacts that have happened the past 6 years that have impacted this species life.
 
This book not only educates with awareness of what is happening in the ocean and its inhabitants it also INSPIRES people that change does occur with perserverance when you can look back over a set amount of time.
 
Sharing this campaign via the Facebook, Twitter, Email links helps this campaign get noticed on Indiegogo and can push it further into the eye of more compassionate and inspire more individuals!
 
Schools are teaching the children so let's help give them more tools, the world depends on them to "PROTECT". I want this book to be in every school around the world!
 

ENDORSEMENTS

 

“21st Century, Age of Protection” is a personal and passionate journey of author Bob Timmons as he recounts his own  journey as an animal activist.  From sharks to seals, turtles to tuna, each chapter descriptively highlights the pain and suffering inflicted by mankind against the ocean’s creatures in the name of competition, greed, entertainment and ignorance - and the shocking lengths the perpetrators will go to hide or justify their actions.

 

Shocking as they may be, each tale of travesty also brings with it a message of hope, with concrete examples of progress made as a result of activist campaigns. Indeed, Bob provides ample evidence that activism is effective, and shows how individual actions – from making informed consumer choices, to writing to a company that may seem indirectly involved in an issue, to raising an issue with politicians – can translate into positive change for the planet.

 

Bob’s paintbrush has become his “personal weapon” in his crusade to protect ocean life, and this is evident from the beautiful and haunting images of ocean life and the insightful stories or their inspiration and creation.  Each brings a message of awareness, which will hopefully serve to inspire further self-education and action.  By informing ourselves, educating others, leading by example and taking positive actions, change is possible: by becoming more aware of our actions and their consequences, each of us can make better decisions to protect the planet and the LIFE that depends on it."

~Sheryl Fink, Director, Canadian Seal Campaign

 

 

 

"My sister and I are big Sea Shepherd supporters, and Bob Timmons has created a great reflection of SSCS in this book with their campaigns that contain interesting and factual, detailed, information, with his incredible hands-on research of positive actions for the ocean. My sis and I give our  "green tea party" thumbs up for this book!"

~Shane and Sia Barbi, The Barbi Twins

 

 

"The effects of climate change, deforestation, species extinction and deoxygenation of the world's ocean, to name a few 21st century threats, are not insular. What affects one species inevitably alters the path of another. We are all connected in this biosphere and all live on one planet. With marine animals assaulted, as they have never been before, with an end result - mass species decimation - the time is NOW to wake up and acknowledge that our fate is inexorably linked to those creatures that lack a voice on the world's stage. Bob Timmons has recreated these threats in the form of visual art, a language understood via the world, and in a way that communicates this harm humans have done. With raw and often emotional text, this is a must-read for anyone who is passionate about survival, not just of the fittest, but also of the web of life, as a whole."

Cara Sands, Friends of the Dolphins

 

 

OBJECTIVE


The objective of this campaign is to get this book into schools and libraries for FREE! I will donate a paperback book while quantities last to schools of all levels and public libraries globally. The more books we can make the better the outreach will be for this campaign.

On completion of this campaign we hope to have enough funds raised to buy soft paper back books. From there we will take:
 
50% will be distributed to schools/libraries around the world
 
The remaining 50% of the books will be sold having 25% of the profits going to a charity like "Sea Shepherd", "The Dolphin Project", "Refuge RR for Horses", on a quarterly basis.
 
Below are the quotes I have received from a local Toronto Book Binding Business:

$1365 for 50 copies,
$2388 for 100 copies,
$3408 for 150 copies
ETC ETC ETC ETC
plus applicable taxes
 
I set my goal for $4000 due to this fundraising platform will take 9% if I do not reach my goal and paypal and bank fees will take an additional 3% from the goal. Their will be taxes on the book too when I put in the order. So let's make this happen for the children to have the knowledge for change "Educate to Activate"!
 
The more money raised means more books and more information shared in the schools and libraries. Leaving even more money to go to charities as well from the remaining 75% of paper back books.
 

If you reach your goal, expect to receive:
Goal – Fees = Your Take-away
C$4,250 - Fees = C$3,952

 

PERKS

 
So ways to support this campaign are to first choose one of the perks!
 
$25 - First perk is a "PRE-ORDER" of the EBook that is being launched on WORLD OCEAN DAY - JUNE 8th, 2013!
 
$50 - Second perk is for the Ebook ONE WEEK EARLY before its RELEASE!
 
$100 - Third Perk is for anyone that feels this is a great opportunity to get Ocean Awareness into the schools and libraries and will receive an EARLY EBOOK Copy along with Six 8.5"x11" of all of the Chapters showcased Art Pieces!
 
$150 - Adding a personal gift of a signed paperback book of the project with an early release of the Ebook. The paperback delivery will take some time to be delivered. This includes delivery as well.
 -
$250 - Fourth Perk this Warrior will receive a Signed Paperback of the book and an Early Release of the Ebook ONE WEEK Before the OFFICIAL BOOK LAUNCH on WORLD OCEAN DAY - June 8th PLUS an EARTH WARRIOR Signed Certificate PLUS an 8.5"x11" print of EACH Art Piece of the 6 Chapters making that 6 signed prints in Total.
 
Last but Not LEAST! Anyone can SHARE this campaign by using the above Indiegogo links for "Twitter", "Facebook", and "Email" so this campaign can receive the "INDIEGOGO GOGOFACTOR!!"

story:
Hi! I'm FiveseveN, a designer and occasional artist from Romania. About 7 years ago I started to work on a series of illustrated thoughts or captioned drawings, whichever way you'd like to see them.
Six years and many issues later what emerged was a diary, one young man's journey to epistemological skepticism. The story touches on all the usual concerns: love, hate, society, religion, sanity and purpose.
The idea of publishing the series in a book came fairly naturally and although the narrative is disjointed, there is an observable evolution of both visual style and rhetoric which lends itself to this format.
And now, the rise of crowd funding platforms has provided the opportunity to offer this book directly to the people who would enjoy it: lovers of art and human stories.

Your support provides funding for a limited print run of fifty copies. Each book features high quality digital print on 200 gsm glossy paper in 8 x 10 inch (20 x 25 cm) format, 46 pages hand-bound in hard covers. Each copy is personally numbered and signed. If this goal is not met I will print whatever number of copies are funded, so contributors will still recieve their perks.

This campaign also offers the opportunity to acquire one of ten original illustrations from the book. These are color drawings on A4 paper, professionally framed.
Go to http://xonedesign.ro/dobs to see which drawings are available.

Shipping through standard mail is included. Please add the appropriate sum to your pledge if you prefer a premium shipping method.

story:
What is Capoeira?

Capoeira. The first martial art actually developed in the America’s.  Capoeira is described as a Brazilian martial art that was developed around the 16th century by African slaves in Brazil to effect their liberation from slavery.  Developed in secret, it was disguised as a dance so the slaves could openly practice it in front of their masters on their Sunday day of rest. 

Capoeira, in spite of its challenging looks, is suitable for men, women, and children of all ages.  It is common for people with physical disabilities to excel at Capoeira because its form is tailored to the abilities of each person, allowing it to benefit a greater audience than more commonly known Asian based martial arts.

Capoeira incorporates more than just “martial arts”.  It is truly a cultural experience, combining music, dance, acrobatics, and martial arts skills to promote health, knowledge, and self-confidence in people of all different walks of life and physical abilities.

While Capoeira is an American martial art, it is still new and relatively unknown here in the United States. We at West Michigan Capoeira seek to promote the appreciation, awareness, and benefits of Capoeira to our Region and beyond, to demonstrate to others that their lives are not bound by their perceived limitations.

Centuries ago, Capoeira helped to liberate its founders from slavery. Today, West Michigan Capoeira students can experience that Capo continues to liberate; unshackling us to achieve far beyond our expectations, not only in our martial art, but in every facet of our lives.

Who is West Michigan Capoeira?

West Michigan Capoeira, was founded in 2007 by Capoeira instructor Show Grande, and is based in Kalamazoo and Lansing, Michigan. We are an independent, unfunded organization that trains primarily at Western Michigan University, Michigan State University, or on the street, as traditional Capoeiristas.

We are a relatively small group, and as an independent organization have to fund all of our activities from our own limited means.

Our 2013 Batizado Project:

We are making plans for our 3rd annual Batizado which will take place on September 6 - 8, which is a festival that initiates all new Capoeira students into the international Capoeira community.  Batizado simply means “Baptism” in Portuguese, and is when Capoeirista’s from all over come together to celebrate the initiation of the new students and more advanced students are promoted to higher ranks.

It is a centuries-old tradition to invite some of the few Capoeira Masters from all over the world to come to regional Batizado’s to evaluate, instruct, and inspire all students and their instructors to excel, and to honor both the students and the Masters by presenting them with their new ranks.

We hope that in 2013 we can host one of the largest Batizado’s in Michigan, inviting other Capoeira groups to participate, as well as invite several Capoeira Masters from Brazil, Israel, and all around the United States to participate in this celebration.  The event will be free to the public to allow maximum outreach by our organization to educate people about the art of Capoeira, the only actual martial art founded in America.

Thank you for any type of support that you show us! <3

story:
My project, Dreams of Patoot, features more than 400 of my illustrations in an Interactive Visual Narrative specifically made for the iPhone and iPad.

These painted images touch on just about all of the full range of human (and Plafundian) emotions and activities – and manage to be funny, heartfelt, and erotic too!

 

Why am I asking for money? 

I’ve come up with this new way of telling a very cool story through words and pictures. I also think Dreams of Patoot is some kind of category-breaker. Much progress has already been made in the areas of software development and interactive design, but these services do not come cheaply. 

I need your financial contribution to complete this project. Will you help?

 

Some background

As an editorial illustrator, I produced images for some of North America’s finest magazines. My originals have been exhibited in Japan, Italy and France, as well as the United States and Canada. Currently my professional interests lie in the areas of painting, and the writing and illustration of books.

My visual work is represented on my website. You can also friend me on Facebook and follow Patoot on Twitter.

 

Who is Patoot?

Patoot is a young citizen of Plafunda. Like young citizens everywhere, he has friends and relations, and they all have their own distinct storyline separate from, and parallel to, the main narrative. That’s the interactive part of the app. 

 

What is Plafunda?

It is a distant benevolent planet, similar to our own in many ways, yet significantly different in others. The text for Dreams of Patoot is in a form of Plafundatongue, channeled by me through email messages from the Plafundans themselves. They have asked that Patoot’s adventurous story be shared with all of Terra. 

 

You can help enable that mission!  By contributing you will help me pay publishing, software development, and interactive design service costs.

 

*Check out the Gallery for images from the app!

 

Rewards

iPhone & Desktop Wallpapers

 

11"x17" Signed & Numbered Prints

  

13"x19" Signed & Numbered Prints

 

Your choice of one 3-Colour Stone-pulled Lithograph (20"x27")

  

The full set of 13 Candy Apple Prints (17.75"x24")

story:
Art is a wonderful and important part of our lives, and Jeni Cottrell, local artist and tireless volunteer for the arts, is behind the planning and fund-raising efforts for this and previous group purchases.  She matches artwork and potential sites, and then raises money for the artist to be paid in full. The artist will receive 100% of the money raised and the chosen site will own a piece of artwork to enhance their space.  The goal is both to support working artists and to enrich the lives of people, especially those not commonly exposed to art.  Lots of small donations can go a long way, so thank you for anything that you can give!

Previous artwork placed by Jeni Cottrell through group purchases:

  • 2 Paintings by Nancy Canyon for Dorothy Place, a non-profit Whatcom County organization supporting women and children fleeing domestic violence
  • Painting by Sharon Kingston for Lydia Place, a non-profit Whatcom County organization providing transitional housing for homeless women and children
  • 2 Paintings by Randy Clark and Tom Wood for the Sean Humphrey House, a non-profit Whatcom County residence for low-income individuals with HIV/AIDS
  • Sculpture by Shirley Erickson for the Fairhaven Library of Whatcom County
  • Painting, by Amy Armitage, placed in the Northwest Youth Services Skagit County office

Most often Jeni funds the art purchases by soliciting money from the local community through grass-roots talking and hand-shaking. By starting a fundraising campaign on Indiegogo, I hope to help reach more people and make it very easy to make a donation in a quick and safe format, especially if you are not in Bellingham and still wish to donate.  All money pledged will go to the purchase of this professionally framed painting, which is priced at $750.  The painting, which depicts the ‘Ladies of the Lake’ property acquired by WLT, will be placed in the Whatcom Land Trust office to be shown for an opening night Artwalk event on Friday, April 3rd, 2015, and will remain there permanently.  The fundraiser will not end until April 30th. 

“The Mission of the Whatcom Land Trust is to preserve and protect wildlife habitat, scenic, agricultural, and open space lands in Whatcom County for future generations by securing interests in land and promoting land stewardship.”

Thank you for your support!

(and thanks to those who have donated in the past too!)

story:
Hi, my name is Robert Knafo.  I'm a photographer, documentary filmmaker and writer on art, and I live in New York. The idea of the Artists At Work (AAW) project is to create a major photo-documentary record of contemporary art-making; the work processes, practices, work spaces, and portraits of over 150 leading, established and emerging visual artists based in the US.  The major goal is to publish a book and create an online archive.

Part curatorial project, part photo essay, part documentary archive, AAW is also related to and a continuation of an online video project that I produced from 2006-2012, newarttv.com, comprising about 200 videos and films on contemporary artists.  Some fifty AAW shoots have been completed to date, and there are another 120-150 shoots  projected through 2015-16, mainly in the New York and Los Angeles areas, and elsewhere as circumstances allow.  The gallery images  are a selection from shoots of the last year.

I think of AAW as following in the footsteps of Hans Namuth, Rudy Burckhardt, and other photographers who left an important documentary record of many of the leading artists of the 20th century. The interest, support,  participation that artists have given AAW has been amazing.  Funds are needed to advance and complete production, publish a book, and build an AAW web site and online archive. The contributor rewards  include editioned prints of  photos from the current AAW series and a projected AAW book. And every contributor from $10 on up gets the monthly AAW e-newsletter, with project news and images of current shoots, which should be fun. So consider supporting the Artists At Work project with a contribution.  Thanks!

photo: Kathy Butterly, NYC 2014.

story:
Short Summary

  • Dripped on the Road is a traveling artist residency program based out of an RV.
  • The program will be bringing two resident artists on the road for one month, Trasher from Mexico City, and McMonster from Portland OR.
  • These artist have never been to this part of the US or painted in any of these cities before!!
  • We will also be documenting the entire project for Season 4 of our online documentary series - where we will speak with community members and invited artists about the impact of public art and traveling. 

 

         

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are looking to raise $3000 to help cover the costs of our resident artists.
  • This funding will help us also purchase paint and materials for our collaborating community artists in Cincinnati.
  • Perks - DOTR Gear, stickers, Custom Collaboration print by the two resident artists.....VERY SPECIAL since they live in different countries!!

 

The Impact

Changing lives!!

  • This project is the only one of its kind.
  • It will bring together two artists from different cultures, who will travel together, and also interact with communities they have never been to!
  • This is our 5th residency project. 
  • Not only will you be able to assist this great adventure - but you will also be able to be part of it by following our documentary series here. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant contribute- heres how you can help!

  • Ask your friends to get the word out and make some noise about DOTR.
  • Do you have a wall we can paint???? Contact us!!!

story:
How MIDDAY Began

MIDDAY founder/curator Marissa Molinar was a late-comer to contemporary dance, starting her professional training in 2009. She left her role as Membership Coordinator at Boston Dance Alliance in 2015 ready to dive into her training by taking 15 dance classes a week, but she was saddened to see many established teachers in Boston retiring while new teachers' classes folded almost immediately due to high cost of space and underdeveloped teaching skills. Marissa created Midday Movement Series in response to this: MIDDAY was designed as a space for emerging contemporary dance teachers to find their voice and hone their teaching practice while offering affordable, innovative classes to advanced and professional dancers. MIDDAY currently offers classes Tuesday to Thursday from 12-2 PM at José Mateo Ballet Theatre.

For the last 3.5 years, MIDDAY has hosted weekly classes with three inaugural teachers, but we are ready to take it to the next level!

 

How MIDDAY Is Growing

We've grown a lot already in 2019. Since December 2018, we have:

  • established a new 6-person Midday Shuffle Cohort; 
  • established new Short Series offerings to include somatic methods; 
  • welcomed a new ongoing teacher, Ronnie Thomas, to hone his teaching practice while working with Marissa one-on-one to obtain organizational and administrative skills; and
  •  begun creating an internship program to support new arts administrative activists

But there's so much more we are still working on! This year, in response to feedback from artists in our community, we'll be creating an informal showing series; hosting workshops and master classes with guest artists; creating resources of support to emerging choreographers and company directors; hosting social gatherings and dance parties, and more.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Weekly dance classes are the core of what we do at MIDDAY - not only to work our artistic brains and bodies, but also because weekly in-person engagement is vital to nurturing the strong social bonds we are building in our community. Our $6000 goal is our annual cost of space rental for our classes. Your donation will not only let these classes continue, but will also allow MIDDAY to flourish even further!

As a Thank You, our perks include class cards and show tickets from MIDDAY teacher-choreographers to directly invite you to join our community. You are also welcome to gift any part of your "perk package" to a friend to keep the community growing!   

 

The Impact

What began merely as a class series is transforming into an initiative for broad impact:

  • MIDDAY has drawn hundreds of class-takers through its doors over the years, which not only raises visibility for professional-level dance in Boston but also gives our dance professionals a platform to connect directly to a wider public, helping them to find and train dancers, meet new collaborators, and grow their audiences for performances as well as for their classes;
     
  • MIDDAY teachers consult extensively with Marissa in areas including administration, development, marketing, social justice, and social capital to gain skills as holistic arts entrepreneurs;
     
  • MIDDAY is growing a name for dance in Boston by inviting and hosting emerging teachers from other dance cities, including New York, Philadelphia, and Brussels, Belgium.
     
  • MIDDAY is connecting Boston-area dance artists to create a growing, lasting network of professionals, increasing the viability of this art form in our city.

 

You Can Help

While donations at any level help immensely, MIDDAY also firmly believes in the power of people coming together, and we cannot do this without you! Please give what you can and be sure to tell others about MIDDAY. Share this campaign through email and social media, tag others in our posts on Instagram and Facebook, and come to our classes to become a part of the MIDDAY community. THANK YOU!

story:
On behalf of abused and neglected horses everywhere, thank you for taking a peek at my campaign.  I've been passionate about animal rescue since I was a young girl so as a Fine Artist I've been involved with many rescue organizations and have chosen to give a portion of my proceeds to help raise money for their care. 

My goal with this hardcover book is to create a visually appealing look at the beauty that still resides in the unwanted.  So many horses wind up at auction and are saved just in the nick of time by the many caring volunteers that have dedicated their lives to saving these poor innocent creatures. 

 

FAQs

  • When will the book come out?

I plan on having the book published in late October 2013 so they will be available for the upcoming 2014 Year of the Horse.

 

  • What's in the book?

Paintings of the various rescued horses and their stories that are from my contributors as well as showcasing horses from many of the rescue organizations this book will be supporting.  The more submissions/contributions I receive, the larger the book will be!

 

  • Who selects the art in the book?
I will be curating the book. But I won't be doing it alone. I will be reaching out to equine rescues and more importantly, YOU. All campaign contributors will be welcomed to join in on discussions pertaining to the contents of the book.

  • What does my money go towards?

The funds raised will go towards:

  1. The very high costs of producing hardcover books
  2. Additional perks ex: Year of the Horse Calendar
  3. Art Supplies
  4. The Rescue Organization of your choice

 

  • But I don't own a horse! What's in it for me?

You can choose any level of perk you want and we'll work out a solution involving an original painting of your choice or even an archival fine art print of an existing piece of artwork.  I also have functional items like ipad and iphone cases, there's something for everyone.

 

  • I have no money! How can I help?

Spread the word! Let everyone know about your love of horses and my campaign to help them! Mention it on Twitter or Facebook or any other social media site to help get the word out.

 

  • Will the books be available anywhere else?


They will be available in my Etsy Shop and on my Website and available for auction by various rescue organizations.

 

  • How much will shipping cost?

Shipping will be estimated to cost:

Canada                     $10-15

USA                          $10-20

Everywhere Else      $20-30

Expedited shipping will be available to all contributors and you will be informed of all your shipping options via email at the book's completion.

  • Are the example book cover and book pages subject to change???

Yes.

 

Risks and Challenges

• Funding the printing of the book is the biggest challenge to the project. A reliable printer has been chosen but I need to fill it with as many equine paintings as I can.  More paintings = more pages so I'm challenging myself to spend the next 9 months of my life painting, painting, painting.

• I have already devoted my art career to raising money for rescue, so I'm confident in seeing the project through to completion.  I have expenses and fees for using this platform but my plan is to give as much money back to the horse rescues as I can.

• I'm working closely with a few key rescues I've developed a relationship with, but the more exposure this art project recieves, the more horses that are ultimately helped with this venture.  I'm not a fundraiser, just an Artist wanting to help horses so please be patient, I will post any and all updates as quickly as I can.

story:
Well, hello there. Thank you so much for taking the time to visit my Indiegogo campaign. 

My name is Jean-Filipe Bergeron, but you can call me JF for short.

Did you ever have a little someone inside your head that's a part of you? Me too. Well in fact I have several, but there is one who is more vocal than the others. I named her Shell.

For... I don't know how long, years for sure, I wondered how to bring her to life. I wonder if it should be a novel, a movie, a comic, songs... I finally settled on a children's book a while ago. Shell supports that heartily, I have her in my head... I have a real gut feeling that it's the right way to go.

As for the story, the reason she's called Shell is that at the start of the book, she is found crawling out of a seashell by her soon-to-be adoptive parents. At that point, she's only 2 inches tall. Over the course of the book, she would grow to the size of a baby, a 5 year old and and 8 year old (which is normal size, since she is physically 8). Personality-wise, Shell is headstrong, a little bit reckless and somewhat rebellious. In a nutshell, the lesson of the book would be: It's okay to be headstrong, and rebellious, and even breaking the rules sometimes can be good, as long as you don't go too far - don't hurt yourself, don't hurt others.

I think this is a valuable lesson to teach - so often in kids book I have read as a kid, the lesson was basically "obey your parents and be nice." I think this is a really bad lesson to teach to kids, and it is much more important to teach them to THINK. Question the rules. Question what you're told.

Since I can't draw to save my life, I will need to hire an artist to illustrate the book, and since a kid's book is at least 50% visual (and I do plan for the book to be fairly long) it's not going to be cheap.

Now, if I got you interested - and I hope so! I'm going to tell you what you'll get for supporting me.

If you give 10$, you'll get your name in the "Special Thanks" section of the book.

If you give 25$, you'll also get your name in the "Special Thanks", plus you get a copy of the book when it's published.

If you choose the 60$ option, you get all of the above, plus you turn into an "Insider" - You'll get a signed sketch from the (undecided yet) artist and you will know about every step of the project, in real-time.

100$ or more? You get all of the above, plus... you get a cameo. You'll be in the background of one page in the book. What an honor! 

So, I guess that's it for now. I hope you'll contribute whatever you can. That book seeing the light of day would be a dream come true - for me and for Shell! Bye!

I also appreciate donations using Bitcoins: 1QHeTdz8F2LEJ3e4u1MeSFDGmKG4enrapN


Got any questions about this project? Feel free to send me a message or post in this topic from the CrowdFundingForum: http://crowdfundingforum.com/showthread.php/9868-(Indiegogo)-Children-s-Book-The-Girl-From-The-Seashell

story:
NMA will be painting a mural in Accra this March to celebrate Ghana’s Independence! For the first time, NMA looks to expand its work beyond Nima and link other communities into the creative development. The theme, “Imagine Accra”, captures the energy of a city buzzing with progress, just named by the New York Times as a Top 4 global travel destination, in the country with the fastest growing economy in the world. Yet the condition of many of the streets often fails to reflect the city’s growing international reputation. NMA aims to transform the city one mural at a time, using arts and culture as a tool for progress.

About us:

NMA is an organization founded by a collective of artists in Nima to empower youth in Accra to express themselves artistically. Through workshops and public painting programs, NMA gives aspiring young artists an active role in revitalizing urban areas of Accra.

Achievements:

  • 441 Welfare Center mural painting and exhibition - Nima, Accra - July 2011
  • GMGE Haverford College music recording - Philadelphia, USA - March 2012
  • Accra[dot]Alt Chale Wote street painting and workshop - Jamestown, Accra - April 2012
  • NMA 2012 - Kawukudi / Alliance Française Art Festival, Accra - July 2012
  • Sallahfest Painting for Peace - Village Garden Toilet, Nima, Accra - August 2012
  • Educating Hearts & Minds Mural / Storytelling - Nima Cluster of Schools - November 2012
  • Chapter O New Year’s Celebration - Nima, Accra - January 2013

What We Need & What You Get 

Funds for painting materials/supplies and basic costs of the event.

  • Paints
  • Wooden board
  • Canvas
  • Banners
  • Brushes and palette knive

If we reach above our goal, we will use the funds toward making the program bigger and better. If we really surpass the amount, we will put the funds toward continuing NMA workshops in the long-term!

*IF YOU DO NOT HAVE A CREDIT CARD, contact us at nimaart.gh@gmail.com if you would like to reserve a prize*

Other Ways You Can Help

  • LIKE NMA on Facebook: www.facebook.com/nimaart.gh
  • FOLLOW NMA on twitter: @NMAart (www.twitter.com/NMAart)
  • If you're in Accra, volunteer with us
  • If you're anywhere, tell all your friends!
  • And use the Indiegogo share tools!!

Nagode. (“Thank you” in Hausa.)
story_txt:
NMA will be painting a mural in Accra this March to celebrate Ghana’s Independence! For the first time, NMA looks to expand its work beyond Nima and link other communities into the creative development. The theme, “Imagine Accra”, captures the energy of a city buzzing with progress, just named by the New York Times as a Top 4 global travel destination, in the country with the fastest growing economy in the world. Yet the condition of many of the streets often fails to reflect the city’s growing international reputation. NMA aims to transform the city one mural at a time, using arts and culture as a tool for progress.
About us:
NMA is an organization founded by a collective of artists in Nima to empower youth in Accra to express themselves artistically. Through workshops and public painting programs, NMA gives aspiring young artists an active role in revitalizing urban areas of Accra.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Troy Couillard. I am an emerging theatre professional passionate about the future of theatre in this city. We are absolutely overflowing with brand new talent, eager and excited to get their work out in front of the eyes of the citizens. I have assembled twenty acts ranging from plays to dance pieces, poetry, social experiments, comedians, musicians and even an installation to showcase just what these artists have to offer. The festival will happen from July 22nd to August 2nd in the Motel in the Epcor Centre for the Performing Arts. 

What We Need & What You Get

What I need to make this work as smoothly as possible I need $3,000 dollars. This will be money used towards: rehearsal space, props, costumes and a small honorarium for the artists. Now ANY amount will be helpful and able to make this festival an enjoyable and successful experience. Additionally, extra funds will be used to fund next year's theatre season from Search Tower Company. 

Now, for your help there are perks. Perhaps free tickets might tickle your fancy. Nope? Your name in the program, maybe Well, if that doesn't float your boat, how about the chance to hop up on stage and introduce a night of performances? Any of these things are up for grabs. All it takes is a donation!!!!!

The Impact

This project is important because the world is slowly becoming digital, not that there is anything wrong with that. But these musicians, writers, directors and artists still have a strong, fierce beating heart and because of their strength and bravery to put their work out into the world, they deserve their day in the sun. With your help, their day in the sun could let to magnificent opportunities for them in the future. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Now, there is more ways to help than just money! By spreading the word and getting people excited and interested in the project is worth its weight in gold. In addition to spreading the word over the city, we will also need people to help put up posters and help out during the festival with set-ups and such. Any amount of help that we can get will be considered a win!

story: The Memorial Arts Scholarship is a dedication to two young people who were tragically killed in a car accident, Marquelle Miller and Malachi Bilson. Both were very active in the Arts community. We are raising funds to create Scholarships for Garden School and CRHS seniors planning to pursue the Arts, passing on their dreams and aspirations to future "Artists."

Both were very active in the Arts community. We are raising funds to create Scholarships for Garden School and CRHS seniors planning to pursue the Arts, passing on their dreams and aspirations to future "Artists."

story:
Take us to New Mexico!

Two internationally known choreographers, Christine Germain and Deirdre Morris, join forces to present an evening where they explore identity after a traumatic event. Corps Étranger explores some of the choices we make or attempt to make on the road to recovery.

We got a residency at Penasco Theatre (right outside Santa Fe), in New Mexico for Sept. 21-22. It's a last minute opportunity that we just can't miss. Help us shoulder the financial burden for this chance to share our work to a broader audience. 

  • Bringing art work on tour is important for the growth of a dance company, and to share our artistic vision. Now in its 7th year of operation, Christine Germain & Dancers is ready to keep  expanding and be inspired by, and to inspire new communities and environment.
  • "Corps Étranger” (Foreign Body) explores "otherness" and how one adapts to new environments, limitations, and ever-changing identities. This is a  very unique, experimental and ground breaking performance which is questioning assumptions about healthy bodies, which may have invisible limitations. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Your contribution will help us pay for 2 return flights to New Mexico for Deirdre & Christine, Extra luggage fees for material and props for the show, travel costs from the airport and back, and simple food for the performers.
  • If we do not reach our entire goal, we still get to keep most of the money, but will have to give 9% to Indigogo....Please tell your friends about our campaign so we can avoid paying this fee :)

Last year, our contributors helped us bring our show "Le Projet Migration" to the Montreal Fringe Festival, where we won the "Most Promising Choreographer" Award. We are so grateful to have had the chance to have such wonderful success. This couldn't have happened without your help. We hope to continue our success in this new endeavour.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can tell all the people you know in New Mexico that they should come see our shows at the Penasco Theater on 

  • Saturday September 21st at 7:30pm and 
  • Sunday September 22nd at 4:00pm    

You can also share our Indigogo campaing to your friends! 

Thank you in advance for your support!

Christine and Deirdre

Christine Germain & Dancers

www.cganddancer.org

www.theforgottenbody.com

story:
Short Summary

We are the 2014 graduating seniors of the media arts department working towards our undergraduate degrees in Hartford. We are raising money for our senior thesis exhibition which will be going up at the beginning of May with the donations submitted that will be used for tools and materials.

What We Need & What You Get

The money we receive will be divided appropriately for each cost. The money will go towards the tools and materials we need such as equipment rentals, printing costs of show cards, high quality prints, and catering for the show opening.

The two of us have unique projects that encompass the similar idea of interaction and response. We work in a variety of mediums from book arts to computer programing.

By donating to our show, you will receive documentation prints, Personalized Thank you notes, and your name on our list of special thanks printed in a booklet for the show.

The Impact

This show is very important to us. Our four years at this school comes down to this gallery show. It is the final end product where we can display our thesis works that have been in production for more then a year.

Even if our total is not reached, any funds will still help us with expenses.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us by spreading the word any way you can, sending this Indigogo through any social media sites and through friends and family. 

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT

story:
Purpose

Wenatchee Valley Museum & Cultural Center, a non-profit organization with a successful 75 year history, will open a comprehensive and beautiful exhibit honoring thirteen contemporary Native basket makers of the Columbia River, and the work of their ancestors who created baskets.  These artisans are preserving the enduring traditions of their people, and are held in high regard in their own communities.  They represent tribes from the headwaters to the mouth of the mighty Columbia River. 
We are seeking funding to ensure this exhibition is of the highest quality and pays proper respect to the Basketmakers, both contemporary and historical, who carry on this ancient craft.

The Campaign

Our fundraising goal for this campaign is $9,500 and is the final push toward the total budget needed to create this special exhibition and series of programs. Specific needs for the funding are to provide:

  • Educational programming for school groups and community members that includes demonstrations and hands-on learning from our Native participants.
  • Safe transportation and installation of baskets from individuals and organizations participating in the exhibition.
  • Creation of an accompanying video featuring participating artisans.
  • Hosting Native artisans who are participating in the exhibition and accompanying video.

As a contributor, you are entitled to recieve gifts for your participation and generosity including special invitations to associated events; free admission to the opening gala; a commemorative poster and/or photograph; a copy of the associated video featuring Native Basketmakers; a special guided tour for yourself and guests; a book on Columbia River history "A River of Memory." See the perks for a breakdown of giving levels and gifts.

The Exhibit & Participants

"River of Baskets" opens in Wenatchee, Washington, May 16, 2014, and will travel over the next two years to other cultural centers and museums along the Columbia River.  An Artisan Market, classes, demonstrations, tours of native sites, a basket identification and appraisal clinic all will take place during the exhibit.  A grand opening with singing, drumming, and storytelling is scheduled for May 16, 2014, 5 pm, at Wenatchee Valley Museum and Cultural Center, Wenatchee, Washington. 

Participating Artists and their Tribal affiliations are:

  • Dianne O’Neil- K’tunaxa, St. Mary’s Band
  • Rodney and Colleen Cawston- Arrow Lakes, Nez Perce,  Wenatchi, C’oeur D’Alene
  • Elaine Timentwa Emerson- Okanogan, Methow
  • Carol Allison- Okanogan, Similkameen Band
  • Bernadine Phillips-Okanogan, Wenatchi
  • Vera Best- Okanogan, Wenatchi
  • Randy Lewis - Wenatchi, P'squosa (Storyteller)
  • Vivian Harrison-Yakama
  • Lindsey Howtopat- Columbia River, Kah-milt-pah, Chum-na-pum
  • Wilson Wewa- Northern Paiute, Palouse, Nez Perce
  • Joey Lavadour-Confederated Tribes of the Umatilla
  • Pat Courtney Gold- Wasco, Warm Springs Confederated Tribes of
    Oregon
  • Ellen Fuller-Chinook

These basket makers are deeply respected in their own tribal communities and often are the language speakers, ritual keepers and practitioners of the unique lifeways of their tribes.  Please join us in honoring them by donating today.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily, there are others ways you can help!

  • Help us spread the word about the project and our fundraising request. Build awareness!
  • Volunteer to help with our educational needs or in host our Native participants (contact us to tell us how you are interested in helping).
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to build a buzz for "A River of Baskets"! We would love to have everyone know about this special exhibition.

Thank you for your interest in "A River of Baskets: Columbia River Tribal Basketmakers". We appreciate your support in whatever way you can give.

story:
Yes, the swords are a perk(wicked fun).  Watch the full intro here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=65TQDdUQwhc

Ok, by now you have probably gathered that I have some kind of sickness involving robots, now just what the heck is this maniac talking about?

Well, over the past few years I have had this desire to do a Gallery show and rather than campaign for funds to sit in an studio and paint by myself...I want to show what happens INSIDE the studio.

It was only until this year that the desire manifested itself into a serious compulsion...and only a crazy person would attempt it...a crazy person or someone who is haunted by Dr. Gordbort's Robot Factory. Did I do that apostrophe right? Damn apostrophes.

The Project:

"To intimately document the completion of a Gallery show from the early stage planning , painting and setup to the actual show itself.  When complete, the film should give you a front row seat into what it takes to take a dream, lots of gumption, and right platform to bring it to reality.

Really, this is my ode to Newark, the place that rekindled my passion for painting.  I want to bring these things to life here where it started and to bring my brand of fun into a city that would benefit most from a little levity."

Components:

Finish the large 8-10  acrylic on canvas series portraits
45" x 31.5"
114.3 cm x 80.1 cm
pieces in various stages of completion as well as 8 smaller study pieces 25" x 25"
63.5cm  x 63.5cm
to be entered into show.

Here is a mock up of framed pieces.(frames subject to change on indv. basis but overall the look is what is pictured here):

Main Series


This requires:  1-2 Months of studio space, painting materials/ framing (think chunky old timey museum frames), A/V equip, Videographer, Fabricator (for frames) Gallery space, Show budget, management and advertising.


TIMELINE


Gilosan Indiegogo Timeline

Chronicle entire process of paintings through a video documentary.
This will be an intimate look at how these painting are made. I will be talking in front of an small group 3-4 people (guest appearances will be scheduled in advance and if you are in applicable the rewards bracket, we will give you a heads up to who will be at taping).

This will serve as a POC (Proof of Concept) for future DVD and possible live shows highlighting different artists from Newark.


The DVD

Stage :

studio set up

The elements for the video are subject to change but will include these 4 core elements.

1 - What series of events led to this show and how you got to this point. 
This is where I will be talking on camera about the many decisions that eventually led to this event, including some of the setbacks and hardships along the way.  Topics which I will be discussing include but are not limited to: spending 6 mos. hanging around and performing the open mic scene in NYC, driving taxi cab in Tenafly, NJ to help fund this show (I have stories), my experiences in the illustration, design and digital asset management worlds.  (I delve into my experiences on the road to getting here, some good, some bad...most definitely not for minors.)

2 - How I paint
I paint at a fast pace on multiple easels at a time. I will be explaining  my process on how I tackle specific academic things like lighting, shadow, blending and composition.

3 - Guest Local Artists
Discuss themes ideas and techniques (shop talk). Currently scheduling interviews for local guest Newark artists (5 slots) slots and (3 slots) non local.

4 - Whats Next
Showcasing and preparing the groundwork for the next subject series. Currently : Dr. Gordbort's old timey robot boxing - my take on the fantastic promotional series of barefisted boxing from the turn of the century and 70's bollywood posters as my homage to my childhood influences.

** If this model proves to be successful, my plan is to eventually fold similar minded artists into a show tour.

You talk a lot about Robots.  What's this theme you're on about?

First off,I like painting robots. (Roooobot Affliction - ATHF). 

Secondly, and this is just my personal belief, Robots are the next evolutionary step of mankind. I say this (because I'm a huge geek) because this planet is a finite residence for humanity, meaning eventually billions of years from now the Sun will burn out...SCIENCE...look it up. This is my opinion here, the logical evolutionary step for continued existence is to be unshackled from the needs of a planet, any planet. To be able to exist in a vacuum and only require a single source of energy (not a combination of various gasses and chemical processes like breathing and eating). Robots already possess this ability and there are other geeks in lab coats trying desperately to give this things Artificial Intelligence...I'm pretty sure they'll figure it out sooner than later.*

Then what? We will be the outdated models of humanity? Now, I'm not equating artificial life with human life by saying that robots will be the future models of humanity.  It is just my belief that they are the same and rather than "painting" (see how I did that?) a bleak picture on  human beings as becoming extinct, I'm optimistic that no matter what shape humanity will become whatever form we happen to be Millions of years from now....

There will still be those who, in order to dispel the occasional "mundacity" of existence, will put on some goblin armor and LARP.

I wanted to compose these images; the robots look as if you were a casual observer at a Larping event taking candid pictures. 

It is this idea of escapism that I am exploring here. As an avid video game enthusiast I play a lot of Halo 4 (Yeah guys I'm the Jerk driving the Warthog, lol ) , so I "get" the human need for escapism. When doing research for this series (lurking on LARPING forums, watching some local campaigns in action) I have come to deeply respect and admire LARPers. The level of creativity, dedication and passion I have seen in this community has been a great source inspiration for me, not only for this series but for future projects.

This level of zealotry (generally found in those who engage in this kind of behavior, especially someone who custom fabricates every piece of their level 37 Paladin armor - Mike!) has my utmost admiration and respect. Escapism grants the ability to actively transcend into a reality that removes you from the boring. I NEED that from time to time (standing on line at the DMV playing Inotia4 on my smartphone) and if your still reading this I suppose you do too.

*If you see me at the show ask me about Occums Razor and I will tell you why I am convinced it is inevitable :)

Ah, enough high brow prattle. It boils down to this...these robots and exist in my head. I want them OUT. Bringing them to life is a fun experience I wish to share and..."I'm not STOP!"

You Love Newark? Really?

I know Newark has a reputation of being rough around the edges and almost torn up at spots ( lol ), but it is this environment that breeds inspiration. Don't believe me? Wait 'til we finish this project...this is just the beginning.

Newark has been my stomping grounds for the last couple of years. I have a lot of close friends and family here. I sleep at my apartment, office or random couches after too much partying,lol ...I LIVE in Newark.

Simply, Newark and more importantly the artists here...has a real put up or shut up mentality that I find different from other places I have been.  That is until I started getting involved in the Art Scene here. You'd better be able to back your talk up with skill or you are not worth the time.  I like that. It is that kind of vibe that gives me the pit of your stomach feel that I often find when I challenge and surprise myself...I live for that. It is in the air in Newark...that "raw and powerful" jazz I am talking about in the video is not inflated Art-speak. I have been to a number of cities and not once has anything moved me to get off my ass and commit to a passion - I see that here, at every show, with most everyone here. Its really quite startling at first, now it fuels my lust for painting.

You know sometimes you just get lucky, I feel lucky to have been exposed  to the kind of talent and skill that inspires creation, here in Newark.

It is this attitude that made me realize...I dont wanna do dull stuff anymore I want to push myself past easy and into DAMN! 

With your help I feel I can do just that.

I'm thinking this is a good disclaimer:

I am not insinuating from this project that I am anything other than an illustrator who enjoys painting, this is not intended as a fine arts show or an instructional video on how to.

This is a crazy dream of mine, that has a small chance to become reality...and possibly some colossal beast which consumes my every being(possibly) with your help.

I want to thank you for taking the time to check out my project.

I would like to take this time to thank my friends and family, without whom I couldn't have even gotten this far.

You guys have been patient and supportive throughout all this madness...I am lucky and blessed to have you guys in my life.

Well, over the past few years I have had this desire to do a Gallery show and rather than campaign for funds to sit in an studio and paint by myself...I want to show what happens INSIDE the studio. It was only until this year that the desire manifested itself into a serious compulsion...and only a crazy person would attempt it...a crazy person or someone who is haunted by Dr. Gordbort's Robot Factory. Did I do that apostrophe right? Damn apostrophes.
The Project:
"To intimately document the completion of a Gallery show from the early stage planning , painting and setup to the actual show itself.  When complete, the film should give you a front row seat into what it takes to take a dream, lots of gumption, and right platform to bring it to reality. Really, this is my ode to Newark, the place that rekindled my passion for painting.  I want to bring these things to life here where it started and to bring my brand of fun into a city that would benefit most from a little levity."
Components:
Finish the large 8-10  acrylic on canvas series portraits45" x 31.5"114.3 cm x 80.1 cmpieces in various stages of completion as well as 8 smaller study pieces 25" x 25" 63.5cm  x 63.5cmto be entered into show.
Here is a mock up of framed pieces.(frames subject to change on indv. basis but overall the look is what is pictured here):Main SeriesThis requires:  1-2 Months of studio space, painting materials/ framing (think chunky old timey museum frames), A/V equip, Videographer, Fabricator (for frames) Gallery space, Show budget, management and advertising.
TIMELINEGilosan Indiegogo Timeline
Chronicle entire process of paintings through a video documentary. This will be an intimate look at how these painting are made. I will be talking in front of an small group 3-4 people (guest appearances will be scheduled in advance and if you are in applicable the rewards bracket, we will give you a heads up to who will be at taping).
This will serve as a POC (Proof of Concept) for future DVD and possible live shows highlighting different artists from Newark.

The DVD
Stage :
studio set up
The elements for the video are subject to change but will include these 4 core elements.
1 - What series of events led to this show and how you got to this point.  This is where I will be talking on camera about the many decisions that eventually led to this event, including some of the setbacks and hardships along the way.  Topics which I will be discussing include but are not limited to: spending 6 mos. hanging around and performing the open mic scene in NYC, driving taxi cab in Tenafly, NJ to help fund this show (I have stories), my experiences in the illustration, design and digital asset management worlds.  (I delve into my experiences on the road to getting here, some good, some bad...most definitely not for minors.)
2 - How I paintI paint at a fast pace on multiple easels at a time. I will be explaining  my process on how I tackle specific academic things like lighting, shadow, blending and composition.
3 - Guest Local ArtistsDiscuss themes ideas and techniques (shop talk). Currently scheduling interviews for local guest Newark artists (5 slots) slots and (3 slots) non local.
4 - Whats NextShowcasing and preparing the groundwork for the next subject series. Currently : Dr. Gordbort's old timey robot boxing - my take on the fantastic promotional series of barefisted boxing from the turn of the century and 70's bollywood posters as my homage to my childhood influences.
** If this model proves to be successful, my plan is to eventually fold similar minded artists into a show tour.
You talk a lot about Robots.  What's this theme you're on about?First off,I like painting robots. (Roooobot Affliction - ATHF).  Secondly, and this is just my personal belief, Robots are the next evolutionary step of mankind. I say this (because I'm a huge geek) because this planet is a finite residence for humanity, meaning eventually billions of years from now the Sun will burn out...SCIENCE...look it up. This is my opinion here, the logical evolutionary step for continued existence is to be unshackled from the needs of a planet, any planet. To be able to exist in a vacuum and only require a single source of energy (not a combination of various gasses and chemical processes like breathing and eating). Robots already possess this ability and there are other geeks in lab coats trying desperately to give this things Artificial Intelligence...I'm pretty sure they'll figure it out sooner than later.*
Then what? We will be the outdated models of humanity? Now, I'm not equating artificial life with human life by saying that robots will be the future models of humanity.  It is just my belief that they are the same and rather than "painting" (see how I did that?) a bleak picture on  human beings as becoming extinct, I'm optimistic that no matter what shape humanity will become whatever form we happen to be Millions of years from now....
There will still be those who, in order to dispel the occasional "mundacity" of existence, will put on some goblin armor and LARP.
I wanted to compose these images; the robots look as if you were a casual observer at a Larping event taking candid pictures. 
It is this idea of escapism that I am exploring here. As an avid video game enthusiast I play a lot of Halo 4 (Yeah guys I'm the Jerk driving the Warthog, lol ) , so I "get" the human need for escapism. When doing research for this series (lurking on LARPING forums, watching some local campaigns in action) I have come to deeply respect and admire LARPers. The level of creativity, dedication and passion I have seen in this community has been a great source inspiration for me, not only for this series but for future projects. This level of zealotry (generally found in those who engage in this kind of behavior, especially someone who custom fabricates every piece of their level 37 Paladin armor - Mike!) has my utmost admiration and respect. Escapism grants the ability to actively transcend into a reality that removes you from the boring. I NEED that from time to time (standing on line at the DMV playing Inotia4 on my smartphone) and if your still reading this I suppose you do too.
*If you see me at the show ask me about Occums Razor and I will tell you why I am convinced it is inevitable :) Ah, enough high brow prattle. It boils down to this...these robots and exist in my head. I want them OUT. Bringing them to life is a fun experience I wish to share and..."I'm not STOP!"
You Love Newark? Really?
I know Newark has a reputation of being rough around the edges and almost torn up at spots ( lol ), but it is this environment that breeds inspiration. Don't believe me? Wait 'til we finish this project...this is just the beginning.
Newark has been my stomping grounds for the last couple of years. I have a lot of close friends and family here. I sleep at my apartment, office or random couches after too much partying,lol ...I LIVE in Newark.
Simply, Newark and more importantly the artists here...has a real put up or shut up mentality that I find different from other places I have been.  That is until I started getting involved in the Art Scene here. You'd better be able to back your talk up with skill or you are not worth the time.  I like that. It is that kind of vibe that gives me the pit of your stomach feel that I often find when I challenge and surprise myself...I live for that. It is in the air in Newark...that "raw and powerful" jazz I am talking about in the video is not inflated Art-speak. I have been to a number of cities and not once has anything moved me to get off my ass and commit to a passion - I see that here, at every show, with most everyone here. Its really quite startling at first, now it fuels my lust for painting.
You know sometimes you just get lucky, I feel lucky to have been exposed  to the kind of talent and skill that inspires creation, here in Newark.
It is this attitude that made me realize...I dont wanna do dull stuff anymore I want to push myself past easy and into DAMN! 
With your help I feel I can do just that.
I'm thinking this is a good disclaimer:
I am not insinuating from this project that I am anything other than an illustrator who enjoys painting, this is not intended as a fine arts show or an instructional video on how to.
This is a crazy dream of mine, that has a small chance to become reality...and possibly some colossal beast which consumes my every being(possibly) with your help.
I want to thank you for taking the time to check out my project.
I would like to take this time to thank my friends and family, without whom I couldn't have even gotten this far.
You guys have been patient and supportive throughout all this madness...I am lucky and blessed to have you guys in my life.

story:
Alia wants to make art in Mexico!

If you are here reading this, you probably know me as A.V. Phibes or Evilkid, an artist/illustrator/cartoonist.  Go check out some of my artworks here to get an idea of what sort of stuff you will be getting:  http://www.imagekind.com/artists/Evilkid/Evilkid/fine-art-prints  

Recently I was accepted into an artist's residency in Puebla Mexico during the Dia De Los Muertos season, which is a very exciting opportunity for me to be inspired and produce a lot of new art!  The only catch is...I have to pay for my ticket and room and board and not get kicked out of my apartment while I'm gone!  This is where you come in:

By donating, you are pre-ordering some of the hopefully awesome art I will make!

The amount I need is not much.  I can probably cover airfare myself.  The Room/board and program fees are $2970.  And I estimate that I'll need a few hundred for supplies, printing and shipping of the finished art.  (And you WILL get finished art... I know that a lot of fundraisers make promises they can't keep, but I would never do that to you, baby.)  

Help an Artist make Art!

We live in a crazy world where it can be hard to make ends meet and artists don't get taken all that seriously unless they make giant things out of diamonds.  I am not rich.  I eat a lot of rice and beans.  But I think it would be pretty awesome to spend six weeks in Mexico (WHICH YOU KNOW I LOVE) doing nothing but making art in an environment made specifically for that.  I'd like to see what comes out of it. Wouldn't you?  

Other Ways You Can Help

Or you can just kick me a few bucks to be nice.  I won't spend it on booze unless you specify that I should spend it on booze, in which case I totally will.
