story:
For Lorca the folkloric and surrealistic image of green is simply, a longed-for, indefinable state of mind...
                                                                           Christopher Maura.


My name is Susan Mowbray, I am an English artist living in Madrid. I have the wonderful opportunity to make an exhibition in El Museo Casa de los Tiros, Granada, in September this year. 

The exhibition is called Oh how I love You Green.  The words are from Lorca’s poemVerde que te quiero verde.  In the exhibition they refer to a particular feeling of exquisite loss that I connect with both Lorca and Granada, and to my relationship to colour itself. 

I need your help!

It’s going to cost a lot of money. Due to the the financial cutbacks the museum can no longer provide any financial help, although it is doing its best to help in other ways. 

Some estimated costs of the exhibition

Paint and materials and printing costs 1000€

Paint for walls 100€

Fabric/curtains for doorway Sala B and 64€ 

Framing 600€

Fixtures and fittings for putting up the work 50€

Travel to Granada 6 trips 600€

Staying in Granada 300€

Paying for a person to sit with the exhibition throughout September 800€

Cost of transporting the work from Madrid to Granada and back 300€

I will pay for the materials and costs of making and putting up the exhibition. What I am asking for your help with are some extra unavoidable costs:

  • Invigilation throughout September.
  • Transporting the work from Madrid to Granada.

Your collaboration would mean so much.  It means I can put all my energy and creativity into making a beautiful and meaningful exhibition.



Mi nombre es Susan Mowbray, soy una artista inglesa que vive en Madrid. Tengo la oportunidad increíble de hacer una exposición en El Museo Casa de los Tiros en Granada en septiembre. 

La exposición se titula Oh How I Love You Green. Hace referencia al poema de LorcaVerde Que te quiero verde. La exposición se refiere a un sentimiento de pérdida que me conecta con Lorca y Granada y a mi relación con el color.

Necesito tu ayuda!

Va a costar mucho dinero y aunque el museo está haciendo todo lo posible para ayudar, no dispone de dinero para los gastos de la exposición. 

Gastos estimados de la exposición 

Pintura, materiales y impresión de grabados 1.000 €

Pintura para paredes 100 € 

Cortinas de puerta Sala B y 64 €

Marcos 600 € 

Instalaciones y accesorios para la colocación de la obra 50 €

Viaje a Granada  6 viajes 600 €  

Alojamiento en Granada 300 €

La vigilancia de la salas 800 €

Coste de transporte de ida y vuelta de las pinturas a Granada 300 €

Voy a pagar por los materiales y los costes propios de la exposición, pero necesito tu ayuda para  otros gastos adicionales que no puedo evitar:

  • La vigilancia de la salas.
  • Coste de transporte de ida y vuelta de las pinturas a Granada.

Tu colaboración significaría mucho para mí y así podré emplear toda mi energía y creatividad en hacer una exposición hermosa y sincera.



What you will get

The first thing you will get is my heartfelt thanks! 

And some of my pictures...

Lo que conseguirás! 

Primero mi sincero agradecimiento!

Y mis cuadros...



       Or you can have a book made from some images from the exhibition

       O si prefieres puedes tener un libro de algunas imágenes de la exposición.


       

                                          You can see the pictures in the gallery  

                and in more detail on Oh how I love green in my website.               

                                                  www.susanmowbray.com                                                        

                                          

                                             Puedes ver los cuadros en la galería 

                y  más detalles en Oh how I love you green  en mi página web.  

                                                     www.susanmowbray.com

story:
Printing fee needed to launch "correspondence" (a "letterset" containing 1 CD, 6 postcards,  1 original drawing) by pencil tree project: tomotsugu nakamura x mayako nakamura


*日本語は下をご覧ください

Pencil Tree Project is a collaboration of 3 artists;  tomotsugu nakamura (sound artist/designer) mayako nakamura (painter) and Hiroshi Konnai (web designer/programmer.) 

pencil tree project　　　　　　http://www.penciltree.org/

Tomotsugu and Mayako exchanged their "Sounds" and "Drawings" by "Words" being the mediator.  The "Words" were posted by voluntary audience, who listened/viewed the  artworks. Since June 2013, 7 stages; 7 music and 7 drawings were created in this manner, growing into an image of a "tree." Now the "tree" is fully grown,  we are planning a show at cafe・gallery MODESTE / Hachioji, Tokyo during 2014.05.13-18. In addition, we wish to launch "correspondence;" a "letterset" containing 1 CD, 6 postcards,  1 piece of original drawing by Mayako, which is the very last drawing of this project.

pencil tree project FB page　　https://www.facebook.com/penciltreeproject

tomotsugu nakamura　　　　  http://tomotsugu.tumblr.com/

mayako nakamura　　　　　  http://mayakonakamura.jp/en/index.html

cafe・gallery MODESTE　　  http://www.modeste.info/


The funding will be used for printing 100 sets of CD/postcards. You'll receive your copy of "correspondence" which includes 1 CD, 6 postcards and 1 piece of original drawing (signed and numbered by Mayako ) in return! 


If you are unable to support us financially please feel free to share this project in any social network.

Thank you for your understanding and support! 

Mayako Nakamura


・・・・・・・・・・・・・・・・・・・・・・・・・・・・・・・・・・

みなさまに投稿していただいた数々の言葉のおかげで pencil tree project は 7つの絵画・7つの音楽からなる"連想の木"を育てることができました。ご協力いただきましたみなさま。こころからお礼申し上げます。ありがとうございました。

pencil tree project　　　　　　http://www.penciltree.org/

2014年5月13日から18日に八王子のgallery cafe MODESTEにて 八王子音楽祭2014 + AKITEN コラボレーションイベント pencil tree project "correspondence" を開催いたします。原画の展示販売と音楽の演奏によるご報告会です。

また、音楽7作品を収録したCD、絵画6作品のポストカードと最後の絵画作品のかけらを まとめました レターセット "correspondence" を制作・販売予定です。このレターセットをつくるためのクラウドファンディングをはじめました。ご協力いただければ幸いです。どうぞよろしくお願いいたします。 

pencil tree project FB page　　https://www.facebook.com/penciltreeproject

tomotsugu nakamura　　　　  http://tomotsugu.tumblr.com/

mayako nakamura　　　　　  http://mayakonakamura.jp/en/index.html

cafe・gallery MODESTE　　  http://www.modeste.info/

story:
Port Veritas

A non-profit organization focused on engaging, enlightening, educating, and entertaining the community through the art of spoken word and poetry. "A community creating artists, artists creating a community" is a saying that has been at the core of Port Veritas since its beginning nearly a decade ago. Everything the community has been able to accomplish through Port Veritas since then, has all been made possible by the support of people like you.

As Maine's longest running spoken word series, Port Veritas has used poetry as a tool to reach out to our surrounding communities by providing workshops to high schools, colleges, youth development centers, rehabilitation centers, and special education schools across the state. Through our extensive youth outreach program, we encourage teens to find their voice and tell their story enabling them to engage the audience and challenge themselves in their performance and writing. Our personal experience has shown that this type of work can have a lasting and profound effect on many lives.

For the past year, poets from around New England competed in monthly (sometimes weekly) slams; multiple qualifiers, two intense semi-final bouts, and one rousing final showdown hosted by Tatyana S. Brown, culminating in this years 2013 Port Veritas National Poetry Slam Team of Nate Amadon, William James, Ryan McLellan, Ellyn Touchette, and Beau Williams, with Wil Gibson, 5 time National Slam Team representative as their coach. This team now needs your help getting to this year’s National Poetry Slam in Cambridge Massachusetts. It’s not far, but hotels, gas, food and time out of work are expensive and, hey, they’re poets.

How You Can Help

Our projected expenses are $3000.

Your contributions will help them pay for travel expenses, lodging, registration, meals, and workshops. Any monies received above our goal of $3000 will be forwarded onto the 2014 Slam Team.

Port Veritas in 2013

Members of Port Veritas have taken part in leading performance poetry workshops and hosting student competitions at locations such as Lake Region High School, Central Maine Community College, Sweetser School, and more.

Ellyn Touchette
This March, Port Veritas was proud to be represented by Ellyn Touchette at the Women of the World Poetry Slam in Minneapolis, Minnesota, where she competed among 72 of the best female performance poets in the world. Ellyn is a graduate Gorham High School, the Grand Slam Champion of the first Port Veritas Youth Team, is currently a sophomore at the University of Maine in Orono majoring in Bioengineering, and now a member of this 2013 National Poetry Slam Team.

 

More about Port Veritas...

To find out more about us, please visit our website at portveritas.com, or contact us with any questions or encouragement at info@portveritas.com. Thank you so much for helping us continue to reach our goals.
story_txt:
Port Veritas
A non-profit organization focused on engaging, enlightening, educating, and entertaining the community through the art of spoken word and poetry. "A community creating artists, artists creating a community" is a saying that has been at the core of Port Veritas since its beginning nearly a decade ago. Everything the community has been able to accomplish through Port Veritas since then, has all been made possible by the support of people like you.
As Maine's longest running spoken word series, Port Veritas has used poetry as a tool to reach out to our surrounding communities by providing workshops to high schools, colleges, youth development centers, rehabilitation centers, and special education schools across the state. Through our extensive youth outreach program, we encourage teens to find their voice and tell their story enabling them to engage the audience and challenge themselves in their performance and writing. Our personal experience has shown that this type of work can have a lasting and profound effect on many lives.
For the past year, poets from around New England competed in monthly (sometimes weekly) slams; multiple qualifiers, two intense semi-final bouts, and one rousing final showdown hosted by Tatyana S. Brown, culminating in this years 2013 Port Veritas National Poetry Slam Team of Nate Amadon, William James, Ryan McLellan, Ellyn Touchette, and Beau Williams, with Wil Gibson, 5 time National Slam Team representative as their coach. This team now needs your help getting to this year’s National Poetry Slam in Cambridge Massachusetts. It’s not far, but hotels, gas, food and time out of work are expensive and, hey, they’re poets.


How You Can Help
Our projected expenses are $3000.
Your contributions will help them pay for travel expenses, lodging, registration, meals, and workshops. Any monies received above our goal of $3000 will be forwarded onto the 2014 Slam Team.


Port Veritas in 2013
Members of Port Veritas have taken part in leading performance poetry workshops and hosting student competitions at locations such as Lake Region High School, Central Maine Community College, Sweetser School, and more.
Ellyn TouchetteThis March, Port Veritas was proud to be represented by Ellyn Touchette at the Women of the World Poetry Slam in Minneapolis, Minnesota, where she competed among 72 of the best female performance poets in the world. Ellyn is a graduate Gorham High School, the Grand Slam Champion of the first Port Veritas Youth Team, is currently a sophomore at the University of Maine in Orono majoring in Bioengineering, and now a member of this 2013 National Poetry Slam Team.
 


More about Port Veritas...
To find out more about us, please visit our website at portveritas.com, or contact us with any questions or encouragement at info@portveritas.com. Thank you so much for helping us continue to reach our goals.

story:
Le Studio D

Nous sommes Andrea Nino et Carmen Ruiz, artistes du corps en  mouvement. 

Notre rêve depuis longtemps est d’ouvrir un Studio de danse et de musique, un lieu de rencontre, d’échange et de partage.

Notre rêve depuis longtemps est d’ouvrir un Studio qui hébergerait le Collectif Salsa Descalza, le groupe la Gypsy Kumbia Orchestra, les compagnies Entr'âmes et P'andanza ainsi que d'autres projets de création, de pédagogie et d'exploration artistique.

Ce rêve devient maintenant une réalité! Nous allons ouvrir le Studio D au coeur du Mile End, au 5445 Av du Gaspé #325.

Pour ce faire nous avons besoin de vous.

Un plancher de danse pour Le Studio D

Lors de cette campagne nous souhaitons atteindre 3000$, ce qui nous permettra d’acheter les matériaux du plancher de danse : le bois, le vernis, la laine isolante, les vises, les cousins en caoutchouc et les clous.

Ce montant ne représente que 14% du coût total de démarrage de notre studio, qui est au total 20.000$. Mais cette contribution nous donnera sans aucun doute un grand élan pour partir du bon pied le Studio D qui bénéficiera à une grande communauté d’artistes et d’amateurs de l'art en mouvement. 


Porcentage des coûts:

Sources de financement:

Pour quoi un plancher de danse? 

Un plancher de danse en bois rebondissant, souple mais tout de même ferme, nous permettra de pratiquer différentes de disciplines tout en garantissant une sécurité au corps en mouvement. Et ce, en protégeant les chevilles, les genoux et le dos en absorbant l'impact des sauts, chutes, glissades ou simplement, l'impact de la marche.

Un plancher de danse en bois protège aussi les pieds des blessures avec tendresse. Ce matériel garde la chaleur et nous permettra de pratiquer différentes disciplines qui se font nu pieds.

Nos chances pour atteindre l'objectif d'avoir un bon plancher de danse en bois :

Un beau plancher de danse c'est notre priorité. Les coûts de matériaux (3000$) ne correspondent qu’à 14% du coût total de démarrage, ce qui inclut également l’insonorisation, le travail acoustique du lieu, l'installation de miroirs, d’un système de son, de rideaux, ainsi que des espaces de rangement.

Cependant, cette somme est particulièrement importante afin de combler notre budget global et d’atténuer nos dettes personnelles. Cette campagne nous permettra aussi de créer un lien direct avec vous, la grande communauté qu'on espère accueillir et nourrir dans le Studio D.

D'avance, merci pour votre soutien!

Les Recompenses! 

Atelier Salsa Descalza: 

Obtenez un atelier Salsa Descalza: qui est un atelier de Salsa comme aucun autre! La Salsa Descalza est une invitation au mouvement solo et collectif où les jeux d'improvisation sont accompagnés par la rythmicité des tambours afro- latino-américains.

Le Collectif Salsa Descalza existe depuis 2009 et ses ateliers, despertaculos et interventions publiques ont créées des liens forts à Montréal ainsi que partout au Québec, aux États Unis, au Mexique, en Colombie et à Cuba.

Pour connaître plus: www.salsadescalza.blogspot.com

Atelier Afro Colombien

Obtenez un (1), deux(2) ou trois(3) séances d'ateliers pour découvrir la richesse des danses afro-colombiennes.

1e séance: Cumbia et Bullerengue (16 janvier)

2e séance: Tambora et Chandé (17 janvier)

3e séance: Puya et Mapale (18 janvier)

Chaque atelier sera composé de trois parties:

- le réchauffement pour préparer les corps au mouvement

- les rythmes à travailler

- exploration chorégraphique

Donnés par Carmen Ruiz (Danse Université Concordia) et Andrea Nino (Danse LADMMI), deux danseuses professionnelles, avec une grande expérience pédagogique et heureuses de partager leurs racines colombiennes ici à Montréal.

Heures de Studio

Avez vous besoin de temps en studio? Aidez- nous à travers cette campagne et recevez des superbes aubaines dans le coût de location! 

Pour nous aider...

Partagez cette campagne dans vos réseaux

Partagez aussi la nouvelle de l'ouverture du Studio D.

Si vous avez un cours ou une activité à nous proposer, n'hésitez pas à nous faire signe!

Pour connaître plus sur les projets qui nourrissent notre désir d'ouvrir Studio D visitez:

www.salsadescalza.blogspot.ca
www.gypsykumbia.com
www.entrames.wordpress.com
www.pandanza.com

Si vous avez un cours ou une activité à nous proposer, n'hésitez pas à nous faire signe!

story:
Canvas is a charitable foundation based in Ontario dedicated to assisting visual artists in times of financial distress.   Visual Artists create a wealth of cultural and social value in our communities yet the average artist earns less than $15,000 per year.  Financial distress can come quickly putting their professional careers, health and access to essential resources at risk.

Canvas exists as a safety net to assist artist with advice, links to services, and  financial aid.  

The idea of the 'starving artist' has existed for too long.  It's time we do our part to ensure no artist is starving.

What We Need & What You Get

Canvas has undergone a strategic review and we're now focused on creating a strong base for the Artist Relief Fund.  Funds dedicated in this campaign will be used to directly assist Ontario-based visual artists.  

Our goal is two-fold. 

(1) Raise awareness of the value artists create, and the challenges they face.

(2) Raise $10,000 to solidify our Artist Relief Fund, which will grow over time.

As contributors to this campaign we've created a number of perks that we hope connect you to the mission of Canvas, and engage you in learning more about the role of visual artists in Ontario.  Some perks are simple and meant for fellow artists, others are larger commitments intended to engage our art-loving corporate community.  

Every single contribution is valued and needed.

Everyone who contributes will be offered the opportunity to learn more about the Canvas Foundation as we launch our new website, newsletter to share our story and those of the artists we support over time.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Not everyone can contribute to a fundraising campaign.  A huge part of a successful online campaign is spreading the word corner to corner in this massive province.  We would encourage you to share this campaign page, the video created by Ontario-based filmmaker Amanda Buckiewicz, or to create your own testimonial video to share with your community and further the message.

    If you're interested in helping Canvas raise funds through a corporate contribution or with an idea beyond this campaign please reach out to Board Member Jeremy Freiburger via email at:  jeremy@cobaltconnects.ca

story:
WHY CHANGE SOMETHING THAT DATES BACK TO THE TIMES OF LOUIS XIV?


The same reason why we don't use mercury in dental fillings anymore: there are just better alternatives today! What is true for dentistry, is also true for business cards. They are in dire need of an upgrade, which is why we reinvented the business card by combining two unlikely themes: art & technology.

But if we were going to do this, it had to be done right. This is why we created Qruzzle using the following recipe: 

  1. Take a blank business card
  2. Add the features of leading contact management applications
  3. Now improve these applications by whipping in logic and consideration
  4. Finally cover everything with gorgeous and quirky art

Put in a blender, mix ferociously ... and voilà: Qruzzle was born!

So now that the recipe is ready and final thanks to the support of some amazing award winning artists and photographers, we need your help and support to bring things to the next level. We promise you this recipe is not only delicious, but it's insanely fun to make and will feed the talented artists of today!

The Founding Couple: Christian & Claudia also known as Iisbär and Raccoon


SO HOW ARE WE MORE EFFICIENT?


We wanted an address book that would update automatically both online and on our phones if :

  • our boss was caught cheating, got kicked out and had a new address
  • an ex-colleague had to change jobs (again)... for sleeping on the toilet (again!)
  • our friend changed her mobile number as her ex-boyfriend forwarded it to telemarketing companies in India

We also wanted to find a solution to the following irritating problems:

  • repeating our number 1000 times in a noisy bar
  • giving out business cards in social environments (boring!)
  • typing in contact details manually with loads of typos
  • searching a 'John Smith' on facebook, linkedin, twitter with 1000s of results

Finally, we thought wouldn't it be cool if we all had a purely image based card? We could all choose something that tells our story instead of a boring corporate title or introducing ourselves through a company we work for. In fact, current business cards say more about the companies we work for than they do about ourselves. Is that normal?

I mean what would you prefer handing out: a card that has a big, fat, raccoon on it stuffing it's face or an off white card with VP - Corporate Finance on it?


AND THIS IS HOW IT WORKS!



An example of a front of a card. Art done by Chow Hon Lam


The back of the card an individual QR code linked to your Qruzzle profile

The innovation isn't using a QR code on a contact card (many people are doing that already), the clever aspect of our card is that the QR is linked to a profile instead of static information. This means:

  1. It is dynamic, i.e. if you change your information it updates automatically across all your contacts
  2. We have centralized all the information in one place: personal, professional, facebook, twitter, linked in etc.

In other words 1 scan = never updating information again!


A SIMPLE 3 STEP PROCESS!


  1. Hand out your card to your contact
  2. They can scan the QR with any free QR reader for smartphones
  3. They either login and connect or for new users just input their email address (for a 'test drive') and get the following email where they can download the contact info to their phone and connect should they wish to.


So in short what we wanted to achieve with Qruzzle is:

  1. Make the exchange of contact information more efficient and easier
  2. Create a card for a social context rather than a business environment
  3. Bring visibility to talented artists we love and share our revenue with them


WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP!


Now that we completed everything we need to spread the word and for this we would need your help. The cash we are looking to raise will be therefore invested into marketing. Firstly we want to create a kick-ass tutorial video, which we have to develop with an external company and once we have achieved this we will invest remaining funds into publishing ads, sponsoring art events, getting more visibility on the web and basically getting the name of Qruzzle out there. 

The driver behing Qruzzle is simple, making people's life easier as well as funner when they exchange contact details and support artists we love that are clearly not getting the visibility they deserve.

We therefore offer 50% of our revenue (the Qruzzle Fee) to our artists, as they are those that truly make our cards unique. In the end we hope to become a unique platform for the quirky and talented artists of today without the snobbery often associated to the art world.

story:
Thanks to all our supporters, we made it!
 
Though you missed the bargains (we discounted them for the brave), some perks will be available at: http://www.kcymaerxthaere.com/index.php/cart
 
Questions? info@kcystories.com
 
PURPOSE:
 
What we are trying to is raise at least 6000 dollars (our target, naturally, is more--there is much more we will be able to do on this installation with these craftsmen when our resources expand) in order to create a beautiful and magical storytelling experience on a hillside in Armenia.  The money raised will be spent in Armenia on artisans and other workers to create the site and experience known as Crystals of Refrain.
 
 
INTRO:
 
For the past decade I have been traveling around the world installing bronze plaques and historic sites that honor events from a parallel world I call Kcymaerxthaere.  Kcymaerxthaere is a alternative universe--the project is like a novel with every page in a different place. Where you read such a page influences how you visualize that story. It may sound a bit unusual, but it is so rewarding to see how many people conjuring up another reality without a single digital enhancement--all by themselves in the real world with their mind.
 
And ultimately I think that is what Indiegogo is for: to connect people with beautiful and unexpected things that can help bring into the world.
 
Currently we are at 90 markers and sites in 20 countries so far.  We're very excited to add the story and installation Crystals of Refrain in the village of Aghtsk, Armenia this spring.
 
I was first invited to Armenia by my friend Al Eisaian and found it was even more magical than I imagined.  In particular, I was lucky enough to spend some time in Aghtsk where Al was working on establishing his yoga retreat.  Looking around there I realized it was the perfect spot for Crystals of Refrain.
 
There are so many things I could say about this project, I almost don't know where to start: the incredible experiences Kcymaerxthaereal followers have by searching for our sites in unfamiliar places or the experiences the local kids have when they realize they are connected through a fantastical story to kids like themselves all over our real world? And of course the rich experiences I am fortunate to have by working with the local community to realize my vision which becomes a part of the story of their place.  We are only at the beginning of the process of telling this story all around the world.  I have a feeling that the site in Armenia will be particularly special but it will also find itself connected to other remarkable places around what we call the earth.  With your support of this particular installation, this enchantment can continue to grow.
 
Eames Demetrios
Artist and Geographer-at-Large for Kcymaerxthaere
 
 
THIS STORY / INSTALLATION

With the installation Crystals of Refrain in Aghtsk, Armenia will be home of one of the key stories in Kcymaerxthaere, the story of Eliala Mei-Ning - the woman whose voice was too beautiful to be concealed - and her adventures crossing paths with a boy who is fleeing a flash flood caused by a wave on a beach by his home in what we call Northern Spain.  Eliala's beautiful voice crystalizes the water, allowing the boy to make his way to safety (there is much more to this story and feel free to ask us in comments!).

The landscape and locale in the village of Aghtsk is the perfect setting for this--and not just because it happened there in the parallel world.  We will be installing on a beautiful 4,000 (400 square meter) square foot area not far from the gorge through which the flash flood poured-- and with views over the village to Mount Ararat.  The story will be carved on many different stones and will be revealed to the visitor as they walk through this embedded narrative showcasing mathematics, numbers, mysteries, and explaining how Eliala Mei-Ning and the boy from the sea happened to cross paths so far away from their respective homes.  

ARE YOU REINTERPRETING LOCAL HISTORY?
Not really.  To me, local history is fantastic and Aghtsk has plenty of treasures.  It doesn't need me to make it special, it is special.  But what I do hope is that this project offers something totally different, but also valuable and affecting: the chance to look at the world fresh--not only this landscape in particular but the world in general.  Because that is what Kcymaerxthaere does in place after place, interestingly the result that all these stories and locations stitch together in the human mind, as result helping people see the things that aren't there.

WHO CARES WHAT'S NOT THERE?

People ask me that all the time. All I can say is that for most of us, some of the most important things in our lives are the things that were vivid in our minds but did not exist--though they eventually did: a relationship, a business, our families, a career, whatever.  Experiencing a parallel world viscerally engages that part of ourselves--and besides it turns out to be a great way to tell a story.

WHY HELP?

The perks are cool--Seriously check them out.
Expanding the story --One of the beauties of the Kcymaerxthaere project is that every time we add a new site it makes all the other sites a little bit richer.  By adding Armenia, we enhance a very interesting aspect of the project which is when you imagine the map of our world with the parallel world upon it that mental map in itself becomes an aesthetic object.  And you will have made that happen.
It helps Armenia--Although Armenia has no lack of cultural treasures this will add a unique destination for the cultural tourist.
It helps Armenia--In addition to the cultural tourism aspect, it is equally important to us that the project be inward facing as well.  And we find around the world that many of the sites become a source of local pride and that kids reimagine themselves as part of a global community.  
It helps Armenia--On a very practical level it helps Armenians because skilled laborers and artisans get work and an opportunity to showcase their gifts on an international platform 
 
It supports the project--There is nothing like Kcymaerxthaere, a unique expression of multidimensional storytelling. And it may seem a bit idealistic but we really do believe the world is a little bit better with each of our installations because it helps people to see the world fresh.   Folks who interact with this, encounter one of our installations, often begin to see possibilities.  Help us encourage that!

WHAT'S THE MONEY FOR?

The money raised is for the creation of the site and the perks made in Armenia.  The exciting part is that we plan to spend all the funds hiring local artisans, stone, stone carvers as well as other vendors in this one of a kind installation.
 
WHAT HAPPENS IF YOU DON'T RAISE ENOUGH?
Excellent question.  We will still make something cool but it will be smaller.  This is why we went for the flex-funding option-our vision for the site is so extensive that even a fragment will tell an important part of the story. We will still have the opportunity to hire local Armenian artisans and craftsmen but on a smaller scale.  
 
WHAT HAPPENS IF YOU RAISE TOO MUCH
We would love to have that problem and we are ready for it!  We would use it to extend the craft work (more stone for more stories) as well as for other costs of the project in Armenia, such as land and translation expenses.  In edition, we would love to commission other additional works in other media by Armenian craftspeople.  And beyond that it could support the continuation of the story in connected locations.   
 
We welcome any and all conversation and questions related to this vision.
WE HOPE YOU JOIN US IN KCYMAERXTHAERE!
story_txt:
Thanks to all our supporters, we made it!
 

Though you missed the bargains (we discounted them for the brave), some perks will be available at: http://www.kcymaerxthaere.com/index.php/cart

 
Questions? info@kcystories.com
 
PURPOSE:
 
What we are trying to is raise at least 6000 dollars (our target, naturally, is more--there is much more we will be able to do on this installation with these craftsmen when our resources expand) in order to create a beautiful and magical storytelling experience on a hillside in Armenia.  The money raised will be spent in Armenia on artisans and other workers to create the site and experience known as Crystals of Refrain.
 
 
INTRO:
 
For the past decade I have been traveling around the world installing bronze plaques and historic sites that honor events from a parallel world I call Kcymaerxthaere.  Kcymaerxthaere is a alternative universe--the project is like a novel with every page in a different place. Where you read such a page influences how you visualize that story. It may sound a bit unusual, but it is so rewarding to see how many people conjuring up another reality without a single digital enhancement--all by themselves in the real world with their mind.
 
And ultimately I think that is what Indiegogo is for: to connect people with beautiful and unexpected things that can help bring into the world.
 
Currently we are at 90 markers and sites in 20 countries so far.  We're very excited to add the story and installation Crystals of Refrain in the village of Aghtsk, Armenia this spring.
 
I was first invited to Armenia by my friend Al Eisaian and found it was even more magical than I imagined.  In particular, I was lucky enough to spend some time in Aghtsk where Al was working on establishing his yoga retreat.  Looking around there I realized it was the perfect spot for Crystals of Refrain.

 
There are so many things I could say about this project, I almost don't know where to start: the incredible experiences Kcymaerxthaereal followers have by searching for our sites in unfamiliar places or the experiences the local kids have when they realize they are connected through a fantastical story to kids like themselves all over our real world? And of course the rich experiences I am fortunate to have by working with the local community to realize my vision which becomes a part of the story of their place.  We are only at the beginning of the process of telling this story all around the world.  I have a feeling that the site in Armenia will be particularly special but it will also find itself connected to other remarkable places around what we call the earth.  With your support of this particular installation, this enchantment can continue to grow.
 
Eames Demetrios
Artist and Geographer-at-Large for Kcymaerxthaere
 
 
THIS STORY / INSTALLATION
With the installation Crystals of Refrain in Aghtsk, Armenia will be home of one of the key stories in Kcymaerxthaere, the story of Eliala Mei-Ning - the woman whose voice was too beautiful to be concealed - and her adventures crossing paths with a boy who is fleeing a flash flood caused by a wave on a beach by his home in what we call Northern Spain.  Eliala's beautiful voice crystalizes the water, allowing the boy to make his way to safety (there is much more to this story and feel free to ask us in comments!).
The landscape and locale in the village of Aghtsk is the perfect setting for this--and not just because it happened there in the parallel world.  We will be installing on a beautiful 4,000 (400 square meter) square foot area not far from the gorge through which the flash flood poured-- and with views over the village to Mount Ararat.  The story will be carved on many different stones and will be revealed to the visitor as they walk through this embedded narrative showcasing mathematics, numbers, mysteries, and explaining how Eliala Mei-Ning and the boy from the sea happened to cross paths so far away from their respective homes.  
ARE YOU REINTERPRETING LOCAL HISTORY?
Not really.  To me, local history is fantastic and Aghtsk has plenty of treasures.  It doesn't need me to make it special, it is special.  But what I do hope is that this project offers something totally different, but also valuable and affecting: the chance to look at the world fresh--not only this landscape in particular but the world in general.  Because that is what Kcymaerxthaere does in place after place, interestingly the result that all these stories and locations stitch together in the human mind, as result helping people see the things that aren't there.
WHO CARES WHAT'S NOT THERE?
People ask me that all the time. All I can say is that for most of us, some of the most important things in our lives are the things that were vivid in our minds but did not exist--though they eventually did: a relationship, a business, our families, a career, whatever.  Experiencing a parallel world viscerally engages that part of ourselves--and besides it turns out to be a great way to tell a story.
WHY HELP?

The perks are cool--Seriously check them out.

Expanding the story --One of the beauties of the Kcymaerxthaere project is that every time we add a new site it makes all the other sites a little bit richer.  By adding Armenia, we enhance a very interesting aspect of the project which is when you imagine the map of our world with the parallel world upon it that mental map in itself becomes an aesthetic object.  And you will have made that happen.

It helps Armenia--Although Armenia has no lack of cultural treasures this will add a unique destination for the cultural tourist.

It helps Armenia--In addition to the cultural tourism aspect, it is equally important to us that the project be inward facing as well.  And we find around the world that many of the sites become a source of local pride and that kids reimagine themselves as part of a global community.  

It helps Armenia--On a very practical level it helps Armenians because skilled laborers and artisans get work and an opportunity to showcase their gifts on an international platform 

 

It supports the project--There is nothing like Kcymaerxthaere, a unique expression of multidimensional storytelling. And it may seem a bit idealistic but we really do believe the world is a little bit better with each of our installations because it helps people to see the world fresh.   Folks who interact with this, encounter one of our installations, often begin to see possibilities.  Help us encourage that!
WHAT'S THE MONEY FOR?
The money raised is for the creation of the site and the perks made in Armenia.  The exciting part is that we plan to spend all the funds hiring local artisans, stone, stone carvers as well as other vendors in this one of a kind installation.
 
WHAT HAPPENS IF YOU DON'T RAISE ENOUGH?
Excellent question.  We will still make something cool but it will be smaller.  This is why we went for the flex-funding option-our vision for the site is so extensive that even a fragment will tell an important part of the story. We will still have the opportunity to hire local Armenian artisans and craftsmen but on a smaller scale.  
 
WHAT HAPPENS IF YOU RAISE TOO MUCH
We would love to have that problem and we are ready for it!  We would use it to extend the craft work (more stone for more stories) as well as for other costs of the project in Armenia, such as land and translation expenses.  In edition, we would love to commission other additional works in other media by Armenian craftspeople.  And beyond that it could support the continuation of the story in connected locations.   
 
We welcome any and all conversation and questions related to this vision.
WE HOPE YOU JOIN US IN KCYMAERXTHAERE!

story:
Our Goal

Crack'd Pot Ceramics is a Paint Your Own Pottery Studion in Charlotte, NC that wants to go mobile to reach out to those who cannot come to us. We'll provide you with a selection of ceramics and everything you need to decorate them. We then return the painted pottery back to you, which we glaze and fire within a week. We'll arrange to collect and deliver everything to you when and where you want it. For schools, hospitals, nursing homes, senior centers, home schoolers and other off-site events!

We mainly want to support the arts in the schools. Programs for music, film dance and art are in the crosshairs in most school districts. It's a familiar refrain for school art supporters, who believe they are often among the first areas to be cut when times get tough. This year, they acknowledge, new sources of money might be needed to keep school art programs viable in some communities.

Without art in public schools, students will potentially have less options including their time when school is not in session. Without these artistic pursuits, one effect could be an increase in home entertainment options such as computer use, video games and other such devices. While this could certainly lead to creative practices and hobbies, it risks doing so without proper learning or supervision.

We risk dampering our children's desire to experience and appreciate the arts later in life. This means fewer Americans visiting and supporting museums,  music and stage arts, or less demand for arts overall. Already, according to a report, fewer Americans between 18 and 24 years are attending fine arts performances or visiting museums.

Art is for all ages, support the art programs in your neighborhood!

What We Need & What You'll Get

My goal is to go mobile in my community. The things I need to make that happen:

  • To hire at least one employee, I run my business right now by myself
  • To make sure I have enough inventory for small and large classes
  • Trade small kiln for another large kiln to handle the extra incoming bisque
  • Plastic containers to transport bisque and painting supplies
  • Upfit 2006 Scion XB to make sure it's in good health for the task for the amount of miles it will be getting traveling across the great City of Charlotte

For making a donation to Crack'd Pot on Wheels you will receive a Paint Your Own or customized Perks of choice to you specifications. *There will be some limitations*

The Impact

Art is a basic part of a good education. Those skills are needed to make us innovative and diverse.

  • Creating art helps you discover the unexpcted possibilities of your creativity.
  • Art teaches critical thinking rather than getting the right answer
  • Art teaches to explore through and within possible responses
  • Art enables us to discover the range and variety of what we are capable of doing.
  • Art helps you become critical thinkers in todays society.

I have tried to make clear that art education is an essential part of the shifting landscape of American culture. It is itself an important mode of participation in the arts for children and for many adults, and evidence from surveys shows that it is also an engine that drives development and change in our landscape. Perhaps it is more appropriate to think of arts education as a particularly important dimension of the nation’s cultural "ecosystem", rather than a landscape. Over much of the 20th century, a rising rate of arts education for American children helped create the necessary conditions for robust development and growth.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign!
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help Crack'd Pot on Wheels go MOBILE!

story:
Our Story

Last week it was announced that one of the greatest attractions in Nebraska, Carhenge, is up for sale. Carhenge is a great piece of Americana and was named the #2 Wackiest attraction in America. I want to buy it and help make it profitable again!! The town fought hard to keep it, and I want to make sure it continues to live on for years to come.

I'm currently earning my Masters in Entrepreneurship from Bellevue University in Nebraska, and have previously run a tshirt printing business. I have a blog where I review books: http://authorjess.blogspot.com and can be found on Facebook: Jessica Buike. I have also written and published two ebooks on Smashwords. I have a passion for art, learning, and creativity and would love to be able to make Carhenge even greater!


The Impact

First of all, Carhenge helps bring tourism dollars to the town of Alliance, NE and to the greater state of Nebraska. It is an incredible piece of art that is unique and memorable, and has previously attracted visitors from all over the world! It is important to the community surrounding it to keep it alive and growing.

Second, it showcases art that is different in form and is a great way to share the talents of artists from Nebraska and surrounding areas.

If I don't reach my goal, all money will still be donated to the current owners, Friends of Carhenge, to help them to keep the attraction maintained until a buyer comes along with the appropriate funding.


What We Need & What You Get

Carhenge is one of Nebraska's most unique attractions. What started as a memorial to the artist's father has turned into the second wackiest tourist attraction in America and a great piece of art! As a backer for this project, you are helping me to purchase Carhenge and keep it alive and kicking for many more years to come. The price to purchase the property is $300,000 which I hope to raise through this campaign and a separate campaign through another site.

Future expansions will allow for lodging, food, and additional artistic attractions along with maintenance and upkeep of Carhenge and it's side attract, the Car Art Reserve. Also planned are some new activities and festivals to boost attendance to this fun, funky attraction! To find out more about Carhenge, please visit the website at http://www.carhenge.com/index.html .

You will receive all sorts of goodies for helping, all with a car or Carhenge theme! Rewards include a Cars 2 Pez dispenser, a video about Carhenge, a tshirt, or even having a sculpture commissioned in your name!


Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell all your family, friends, and even perfect strangers about this fun opportunity to save a great piece of art! There are ways to share below, and feel free to blog about this as well - let me know, and I'll make sure to stop by and advertise it on my blog. :) Even if you can not afford to contribute monetarily, by spreading the word you can help us reach our goal!

story:
I'm a self taught artist looking to make a splash with a an ongoing series of public art installations in my city, then later hopefully through out the northeast TN, southwest VA, and western NC regions.  My idea is to make big cutouts of my cyclops cat design, birds, and fish and to place them around on vacant lots, people's lawns, and other surprise locations throughout Johnson City first and then expand out to other cities and communities in my area.  I want to do this to show people that art isn't confined to galleries, museums, and the homes of rich people.  I want to show people that art can be made by anyone and that it can and must be displayed anywhere. 

 

In order to make my vision come to life, I'll need to buy a lot of foamcore poster board, paints, markers, and a screen printing kit.  I want to use some of the many images I've scanned through the years to decorate the cutouts and that means that I have to get a new printer, a program that will enable me to print stickers, and extra printer ink. I'll also need to buy sign holders to stick the cutouts on.  I'm confident that I can purchase over a hundred foamcore poster boards, a hundred or so sign holders, a new printer, inks, paints, markers, a sitcker printing program, and whatever else I might need to make this long term project a success if I raise $1100. 


In the past many great artists had patrons such as wealthy land owners, wealthy merchants, and the church.  What I need are patrons to make this project a success, but what I'd like is many patrons, for example, one hundred people to give $11 each (or something along those lines).  I'm certain that my broject will have a big impact where I live because no one has ever done anyting like it before to my knowledge, so be a part of art history and donate what you can.  Thanks.

story: I am an Assistant Professor in the Graduate Art Therapy Program at The George Washington University.  My American Indian Art Therapy Program needs your help to sustain this program for the Oglala tribe of Pine Ridge Indian reservation in South Dakota. We have the distinct honor of receiving the North American Association of Summer Sessions (NAASS) Creative and Innovative Award for the Overall Most Outstanding Program (2011). Your contribution will enable my students to provide art therapy services for multiple sites this summer.  We are requesting $5,000 to cover art supplies, honoraria for community partners, and food for attendees at our workshops and community programs during this two week period. We are volunteering our time and covering our personal expenses to make this trip a reality. This program provides a much needed outlet for expression of feeling for many Lakota youth in the community. The impact of this program has led to collaborative projects focusing on the integration of arts and healing with traditional Lakota lifestyle and practices. Unfortunately, this program is not being funded by the University this year and we need your help to make this happen. Make some noise and spread the word by using the Indiegogo share tools! Wopila! (we give thanks)

story:
About Jera Sky

I'm a local artist with the ultimate goal of having my art all around the world!

I've been doing art for 20+ years. My mom first taught me all the years growing up, then I had a super supportive teacher in high school, Ms. Eaves and then I majored in art in college but finished with a media arts degree as the studio art system was never as supportive as my Mom or Ms. Eaves. A few years ago I was doing a lot of baground work on movies and TV, and having a lot of down time I started drawing a lot and decided to do 365 days of art. I made one piece of art each day for a year. 

Since then I've constantly pushed myself in my art, having made a very unsucessful cartoon: PuppyDragon Land as well as so much art that I basically now just have sitting around stored in my apartment.

I'm basically a big kid. I love cokes and candy and chocolate (but only cokes with real sugar!) I feel like my art reflects that. 

Check out my art on www.JeraSky.com 

 

The Free Painting A Day Giveaway

I make too much art to list each piece and attempt to sell it. I'd rather just give it away and someone actually have and enjoy it. So thats when I decided  to give out a piece a day for as long as I could sustain it (March 6th 2012) Within 24 hours I had 40 requests for pieces. I want to be able to fulfill all requests I get, and since I'm basically a broke artist who does a lot of improv on the side, I could use some help with this project!

The $1200 should cover the costs for the indigogo campaign and sustain the project for at the very least 365 days (a full year!) Covering everything from shipping and packaging costs and all art supplies for those 365 pieces. By no means will I actually make any money on this $1200, it will simply allow 365+ people to have my art and keep me from going completely broke on this project. 

Ideally if I raise more than my $1200 goal, I'd like to increase how many paintings I give away a day to 2 or more! 

You don't even have to donate a thing to get on my free art list, but you will have to wait for your piece. 

You can simply email jerascustombuttons@gmail.com with FREE ART REQUEST in the subject line and your address in the body to get on the list, that way I can ship out your painting when you come up on the list. 

Everyday I post the piece I mail out on my site so you can follow as the year goes on at www.JeraSky.com 

 

What We Need & What You Get

No matter what you donate to me, you will get a painting from me of at least 3" x 3" size or greater. The larger the donation, the larger the piece (as shipping for larger pieces cost more)! 

Listed below are all different breakdowns (titled as the presidents on those bills) and what you'll get. Trust me you won't be disappointed so long as you like the style of my art. 

All art will be in my style as seen all over my site (www.JeraSky.com). I'm goofy and quirky and so is my art. Some of it is cuter and some of it is "darker". Definitely specify if this is going to go in a kids room or something of that nature, not that anything of mine is overly mature, but possibly too scary for a child. The more I know about you or whomever the piece is for, the better chance you will get at getting a piece you truly love! 

If you have any questions message me! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell people! The more people that know, the greater chance I will at having my art all around the world! 

Share the promo video I've made - or share the blooper one its funnier and tells you absolutely nothing.

I make too much art to list each piece and attempt to sell it. I'd rather just give it away and someone actually have and enjoy it. So thats when I decided  to give out a piece a day for as long as I could sustain it (March 6th 2012) Within 24 hours I had 40 requests for pieces. I want to be able to fulfill all requests I get, and since I'm basically a broke artist who does a lot of improv on the side, I could use some help with this project!
The $1200 should cover the costs for the indigogo campaign and sustain the project for at the very least 365 days (a full year!) Covering everything from shipping and packaging costs and all art supplies for those 365 pieces. By no means will I actually make any money on this $1200, it will simply allow 365+ people to have my art and keep me from going completely broke on this project. 
Ideally if I raise more than my $1200 goal, I'd like to increase how many paintings I give away a day to 2 or more! 
You don't even have to donate a thing to get on my free art list, but you will have to wait for your piece. 
You can simply email jerascustombuttons@gmail.com with FREE ART REQUEST in the subject line and your address in the body to get on the list, that way I can ship out your painting when you come up on the list. 
Everyday I post the piece I mail out on my site so you can follow as the year goes on at www.JeraSky.com 
 


What We Need & What You Get
No matter what you donate to me, you will get a painting from me of at least 3" x 3" size or greater. The larger the donation, the larger the piece (as shipping for larger pieces cost more)! 
Listed below are all different breakdowns (titled as the presidents on those bills) and what you'll get. Trust me you won't be disappointed so long as you like the style of my art. 
All art will be in my style as seen all over my site (www.JeraSky.com). I'm goofy and quirky and so is my art. Some of it is cuter and some of it is "darker". Definitely specify if this is going to go in a kids room or something of that nature, not that anything of mine is overly mature, but possibly too scary for a child. The more I know about you or whomever the piece is for, the better chance you will get at getting a piece you truly love! 
If you have any questions message me! 


Other Ways You Can Help
Tell people! The more people that know, the greater chance I will at having my art all around the world! 
Share the promo video I've made - or share the blooper one its funnier and tells you absolutely nothing.

story:
OUR STORY

Pepatian has three main events in Spring 2012:

1)   BX-RATED: LA MEZCLATINA RISING  - a dance theater collaboration with artists JESSIE FLORES, NADIA HALLGREN, CARIDAD DE LA LUZ/LA BRUJA, CYNTHIA PANIAGUA.  This project explores issues of first and second generation Latina identity in a coming together of powerful, unapologetic voices that speak to personal journeys and female realities in the tight rope between urban life and ancestry. The artists have two month-long residencies and three informal showings in Spring 2012 (this work will have its final premiere in Spring 2013);

 

2)   BRONX HIP-HOP ACADEMY - acclaimed teaching artists: CRYSTAL CLARITY (Visual Art), ROKAFELLA (Dance), LA BRUJA (Spoken Word), and DJ FRED ONES (Music) provide workshops culminating in a performance opportunity for teens at BronxWorks. This project also includes an Entrepreneurship Seminar led by Business Advisor, Prince Thomas, from the Small Business Development Office at Lehman College;

 

3)  PROJECT LAUNCH: PISO and HUNTS POINT HOMES

NOEMI SEGARRA began working on her mobile project PISO in June 2011 with dancer Marili Pizarro in Puerto Rico.  Spring 2012 marks its first presentations in NYC! 

Also introduced in Spring 2012 is the very beginning of a new collaborative project entitled HUNTS POINT HOMES, with choreographers/dancers: ALICIA DIAZ and MATTHEW THORNTON, MARION RAMIREZ and JUNG WOONG KIM.

These two individual projects are introduced in Spring 2012 at various sites in NYC and the Bronx, including a shared evening at Danspace Project.

 

 

THE IMPACT

These three projects are very important to Pepatian and the 14 participating artists.

We need your help to ensure that these events are all properly funded and supported.

We aim to raise $3500 for Pepatian Spring 2012 events.

Each of the three projects (BX-RATED, BRONX HIP-HOP ACADEMY, Spring 2012 launch of PISO and HUNTS POINT HOMES) will get $1000, and $500 will cover admin and office supplies for Spring 2012. 

 

WHAT YOU GET:

Credit on Pepatian Spring 2012 programs

Credit on Pepatian website 

Opportunity to be introduced to talk with artists after the performances.

Free tickets to Pepatian Spring 2012 performances

Free tickets to Pepatians Fall 2012 fundraiser

Opportunity to meet and talk with the artists over coffee.

 

FUTURE:

BX-RATED is scheduled to have its premiere in Spring 2013, after the two month-long residencies and three informal showings in 2012;

Pepatian plans to bring BRONX HIP-HOP ACADEMY back to BronxWorks next Spring following the success of its Spring 2012 residency;

PROJECT LAUNCH: Noemi Segarra’s mobile PISO project plans to be presented in outdoor sites in the Bronx in 2012-13, and the new interdisciplinary collaboration, HUNTS POINT HOMES, with: Alicia Diaz, Hatuey Ramos Fermin, Jung Woong Kim, Marion Ramirez and Matthew Thornton will develop through a series of workshops and residencies culminating in a final presentation in 2013-2014.

 

WE NEED YOU

We need your help at this critical time to stay on track and support the artists and keep these projects moving forward.     www.pepatian.org

 

!!! THANK YOU GRACIAS THANKS!!!

Thank you, please share this call for support with your friends and supporters (share the ilnk on facebook, twitter, email) - we appreciate your help!

story:
Hi--I'm Diana Heyne, an American professional artist currently residing and traveling in France. I have a passion for art that draws our attention to both the magical qualities of the natural world and the mystery of what lies within the human mind and heart. I have spent many years exploring cultural history, mythology, folklore and natural science to support the conceptual basis of my art while studying widely in the realm of materials and techniques so that I can work with media as varied as sound installation and mask making or drawing and puppetry. I have an extensive exhibition and performance background in the US and Europe and I hold a batchelor of fine arts degree with honors from Virginia Commonwealth University School of The Arts.  An important component of my art is directly engaging others through teaching and my experience includes an adjunct professorship, Waldorf kindergarten and workshops for museums and cultural institutions. I spent five years as an artist with the nationally acclaimed US atelier, Applied Imagination, making and installing "botanical architecture" (miniatures in natural materials) for large exhibitions at the New York Botanical Gardens, the National Botanical Gardens in Washington and other well known arboretums and botanical gardens across the country. Here in France I create art and street theatre and sell my work online via my Etsy shops and website. For more information on my art and travels:

https://www.facebook.com/DianaHeyneArtist

http://www.pandorajane.etsy.com

http://www.dianaheyne.com

http://dianaheyne.blogspot.com

My campaign seeks to raise funds to purchase a dependable used van in order to more successfully transport the objects, tools and materials needed to teach workshops, perform and provide a "home on wheels" when needed. With all of this I would be able to teach and perform more extensively in Europe and the UK than is now possible. Funds would be used to cover van purchase, simple renovation of interior space for living and eventual external transformation to a work of art on wheels. I am particularly fond of the magical caravans and vardos used by traveling carnivals and nomadic folk of the past and would like to create something of this ambiance with the "outer skin" of my transport, albeit using recycled materials and affordable art techniques.

In the enchanted realm workshops that I teach we make miniature furniture, houses and puppet figures in twigs, bark, pods and other found objects. Workshops are open to all ages--a bit out of the ordinary but a very successful sharing of energy and skills. I strive to encourage closer connection to the natural world and its beauty through the use of organic materials and heightened imagination. Storytelling is a natural extension of the process of making. We experience relaxed observation of the world of forest and field and even nature pushing up through concrete in the urban realm, merging with recycled bits to transform cast-offs to artistic treasure. Participants work with found forms to create an enchanting and relaxing miniature realm that provides a place of calm and creative satisfaction. Children are encouraged to spend more time out of doors. All ages can be engaged by the simple magic of shadow figures or marionettes and the timeless beauty of storytelling. We are all enriched by the surprising things that happen when people become still and listen to nature.

I'm asking for your help to bring a program of participatory arts and nature to a greater audience but I'm also offering you gifts in return to show my gratitude. These range from photo cards of my popular natural material miniature caravans through art prints of cut paper shadow puppets, to original art shadow boxes valued at $200. So you can enjoy art as well as support it! For those of you who aren't able to provide financial support you can still help to get the word out by sharing this link on Facebook and other social media as well as among your friends. To everyone who takes the time to read and look I thank you from the bottom of my heart. Please know that even if the campaign here doesn't reach its goal in full, I will continue to pursue support by all possible means and all funds will be used to provide appropriate transportation to teaching and performing venues.

story:
***Please note: my video is silent--your computer is working fine!

 

Hi! I’m Cedra Wood, a visual artist living in New Mexico.

I’m excited and honored to have been invited to join The Arctic Circle 2012, an international residency program that invites artists, scientists, writers, musicians, and educators to the Arctic to conduct investigative work. For nearly three weeks, the other residents and I will sail together on an ice class barkentine tallship, exploring Svalbard, a High Arctic archipelago just ten degrees from the North Pole, observing, creating, and collaborating as we go.

In addition to being a life-changing personal experience, this trip holds untold potential for the enrichment/development of my work. As one element of my painting practice, I insinuate myself into natural environments, sometimes mimicking the tactics of other, better-adapted creatures, yielding imagery that is by turns comical, wistful, discomfiting, and surreal; these performances allow me to address ideas of belonging, isolation, and survival through metaphor. You can imagine how being immersed in such an extreme, unfamiliar environment will inform the images that I create. Another facet of my project will be to maintain a detailed, handwritten travelogue, in keeping with the history of Arctic explorers.

I have a few places to go alone on the journey, before and after the official residency. In order to acquaint myself with the history and current focus of Polar travel, I’ll spend several days at the Scott Polar Research Institute in Cambridge, and attend the British Antarctic Society’s UK Antarctic Science Conference. Following the residency, having returned to Oslo from Svalbard, I’d like to take a ferry all the way up the coast of Norway—from Bergen to Kirkenes—painting and documenting along the way. From there I hope to bus into Russia and attend a conference in Murmansk—Integrated Researches of Spitzbergen Nature—which ideally will provide a useful context for the natural phenomena I will recently have experienced firsthand.

I’ve received a grant from the Harwood Emerging Artist Fund to offset the cost of ice-worthy art supplies, and have scraped up enough on my own to pay for the residency’s fees, plus the flight that will get me from Oslo to Svalbard, but I’m still in serious need of funding for a number of other things, including airfare from the US to the UK, then home to the US from Russia; the myriad other train, boat, bus, and plane rides that will get me from place to place while abroad; vital items of cold-weather gear; an archival handmade book in which to keep my travelogue; and three weeks’ worth of modest meals and hostel fees—plus the less interesting but inevitable miscellaneous expenses that crop up while preparing for such a trip (visas, a new camera battery, travel insurance, electrical adapter, etc).

Previous field-based expeditions in which I’ve participated include the Land Arts of the American West Program, and The Eden Project, a traveling residency based in New South Wales and South Australia. My travel to Australia was supported by a number of generous backers—if you’d like, you can see samples of the sort of thing they received here!

For more information about the voyage, check out www.thearcticcircle.org

For more information about my work, visit www.cedrawood.com

Thank you!
