story:
ABOUT ME

My name is Enrique Velasco, also known as emuse. I am a professional freelance miniature painter from Spain. I have collaborated with many manufacturers and collectors from around the world and have garnered awards and recognition for my work, both domestic and international.

With strong influences of film, comic, illustration, History and 80´s and 90´s popular culture. All these influences are captured in some ideas that attempt to express in my works.

 

 

ABOUT THE CHICAGO CRYSTAL BRUSH AWARDS

The Crystal Brush Awards are meant to celebrate the fascinating and fantastic hobby of miniature painting. These awards are created and organized by CoolMiniOrNot.com.

With a large grand prize, and beautiful trophies, CMON hope that with the support of the miniature painting community this will be the event for miniatures enthusiasts everywhere!

Internet voting will be conducted at CoolMiniOrNot.com and CrystalBrush.com and will comprise 50% of the final score of each entry. The other 50% will comprise of a panel of judges selected from industry professionals and AdeptiCon staff.

The third Crystal Brush Awards will be held April 21 2013 at AdeptiCon 2013 in Chicago.

 

ABOUT THIS CAMPAIGN 

The Crystal Brush Awards are a fantastic opportunity for anyone who is professionally involved in the world of miniature painting. Unfortunately, the trip to Chicago from Spain carries an economic effort hardly acceptable for me. Air tickets and stay cost came close to $1300.

For this reason I am asking for your help to support me and my adventure in this year´s Awards, and why not, try to win any of the grand prizes kindly provided by CoolMiniOrNot and the Crystal Brush sponsors.

In return, I offer you the opportunity to get some rewards that I am sure will be very interesting, most of them focus on learning about miniature painting.

I can´t yet reveal nothing about my two projects in competition, but I can say something: Will be awesome!!. One will be a diorama based in the zombie world with several 70 Mm. figures, and the other will have two 90 Mm. Orc figures, based on the Warhammer 40k. universe.

 

PERKS FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTION

 

CONTRIBUTION LEVEL A

You will receive one Crystal Brush project no.1 PDF step by step.

PDF features:

- Over 25 pages. I´m sure it will far exceed!

- Tons of “work in progress” photographs.

- Extracts of my painting journal. Thoughts, difficulties and conclusions about the process.

- High detailed explanations of each step.

- All texts will be translated into English by a native english speaker.

- PDF will be sent to your verified email adress.

- Estimated delivery: June 2013

 

In this ultra-detailed PDF step by step you will be able to learn among other things:

- How to paint dead and human skin.

- Weathering effects on vehicles. Products and techniques.

- Blood effects.

- How to built a scenic base with several figures and other elements.

- How to use pigments.


 

CONTRIBUTION LEVEL B

You will receive one Crystal Brush Project no.1 PDF step by step + one Crystal Brush Project no.2 PDF step by step.

PDF features:

- Over 25 pages. I´m sure it will far exceed!

- Tons of “work in progress” photographs.

- Extracts of my painting journal. Thoughts, difficulties and conclusions about the process.

- High detailed explanations of each step.

- All texts will be translated into English by a native english speaker.

- PDF will be sent to your verified email adress.

- Estimated delivery: June 2013

 

In this ultra-detailed PDF step by step you will be able to learn among other things:

- How to paint Orc skin.

- Weathering effects on armours and weapons. Products and techniques.

- How to paint leather.

- How to paint true metallic metals.


 

CONTRIBUTION LEVEL C

You will receive one Crystal Brush Project no.1 PDF step by step + one Crystal Brush Project no.2 PDF step by step + one DVD video tutorial.

In this DVD video tutorial you can learn my favorite tricks and techniques in over two hours of video.

DVD features:

- Weathering effects.

- How to paint faces and skin.

- How to paint non metallic metals.

- How to use an airbrush in miniatures.

- Speed painting techniques.

- How to paint textures.

- ...and more!

FREE SHIPPING! Item will be shipped to your verified shipping adress. I ship Worldwide. Estimated delivery: July 2013

Subtitled in English by a native english speaker.

 

 CONTRIBUTION LEVEL D (ONLY FOR SPANISH PEOPLE)

You will receive one Crystal Brush Project no.1 PDF step by step + one Crystal Brush Project no.2 PDF step by step + One DVD video tutorial + 16 hours of private tutoring in my studio in Madrid.

I never give private lessons or painting courses so don´t miss this opportunity!!!

- We will paint one figure from beginning to end.

- During the process you will be able to learn about color theory, painting techniques and effects, how to paint faces and skin, weathering, airbrushing, building bases, terrain (snow, pigments, water effects..), and more!!

- The 16 hours may be distributed to the student preference. For example, in one or two weekends, during the week, mornings, afternoons...no problem about that point! Private tutoring will start from May 2013.

- You only need your brushes and one figure of my election.

- I reserve the right to group two or three students (no more) if they are agreed and if their private tutoring hours coincide.

- Contact me for further information.

 

CONTRIBUTION LEVEL E:

You will receive one Crystal Brush Project no.1 PDF step by step + one Crystal Brush Project no.2 PDF step by step + One DVD video tutorial + One pro painted Space Marine.

Details:

- One plastic Space Marine pro-painted by emuse. You can see an example in the gallery

- You will have the chance to choose your favorite Space Marine chapter.

- The miniature will be painted with non metallic metals.

- Includes a wooden plinth and gaming base.

- No conversions allowed.

FREE SHIPPING! Item will be shipped to your verified shipping adress. I ship Worldwide. Estimated delivery: July 2013

 

 CONTRIBUTION LEVEL F

 

You will receive one Crystal Brush Project no.1 PDF step by step + one Crystal Brush Project no.2 PDF step by step + One DVD video tutorial + One pro painted Space Marine + One pro painted Space Marine Librarian.


ONLY TWO AVAILABLE!!!

Details:

- One discontinued Space Hulk Librarian pro-painted by emuse.

- The Space Marine Librarian of the first contributor will be submitted to the next Spanish Golden Demon. So, maybe you will have an awarded miniature!!

- The miniature will be painted with Non metallic metals and some freehands.

- Includes a wooden plinth and gaming base.

- No conversions allowed.

FREE SHIPPING! Item will be shipped to your verified shipping adress. I ship Worldwide. Estimated delivery: August 2013

 

 

STRETCH GOALS!!!

 

All the contributors at LEVEL C and above will receive one Golden Demon project PDF step by step. The main character of this awesome diorama will be a Warhammer Giant.

PDF features:

- Over 25 pages.

- Tons of “work in progress” photographs.

- Extracts of my painting journal. Thoughts, difficulties and conclusions about the process.

- High detailed explanations of each step.

- All texts will be translated into English by a native english speaker.

- PDF will be sent to your verified email adress.

- Estimated delivery: August 2013

 

In this ultra-detailed PDF step by step you will be able to learn among other things:

- How to paint human skin, using airbrush and brushes.

- How to built a scenic base. Composition and how to tell a story.

- How to paint using OSL.


 

All the contributors at LEVEL C and above will receive a physical copy of the three PDF tutorials. You will have about 90 pages with tons of work in progress photographs, detailed explanations, tips and advices.

- Each tutorial will be printed in A4 size as magazine with saddle stitch binding.

- The shipping costs for LEVEL C were free, but now, if I want to ship the printed stuff in perfect conditions, I find myself obliged to charge the following shipping costs (LEVEL C only):

- European Union: $4 – Total perk cost: $54
- Rest of the World: $6 – Total perk cost: $56

Rest of the perks have no changes about the shipping terms.

- If you don´t want to pay the shipping costs, I will send the pdf tutorials by e-mail and the DVD by mail, as planned from the beginning.

- If you have chosen LEVEL A or B and want to upgrade to LEVEL C or above, you can change it at any time. Choose the new one and I will refund your first option when campaign ends.

- The printed tutorials will ship from September 2013, and you will have the possibility to choose if you want the PDF tutorials in the estimated delivery dates or would you rather wait for the physical format.

 

All the contributors at LEVEL C and above will receive a printed portfolio with my best paint jobs. 

- The portfolio will be printed in A5 size as magazine with saddle stitch binding and will have 20 pages.

- My two Crystal Brush projects, the Skull bus, Nemesis Dreadknight, Ogrum Ironheart, Yarry, Lysander, Astorath....and more!

- The shipping costs for LEVEL C were free, but now, if I want to ship all the printed stuff in perfect conditions, I find myself obliged to charge the following shipping costs (LEVEL C only):

- European Union: $4 – Total perk cost: $54
- Rest of the World: $6 – Total perk cost: $56

Rest of the perks have no changes about the shipping terms.

- If you don´t want to pay the shipping costs, I will send the pdf tutorials by e-mail and the DVD by mail, as planned from the beginning.

- If you have chosen LEVEL A or B and want to upgrade to LEVEL C or above, you can change it at any time. Choose the new one and I will refund your first option when campaign ends.

- The printed portfolio will ship from September 2013 with the other printed stuff.

 

If I reach $4000 all the contributors at LEVEL C and above will receive a printed portfolio with my best paint jobs. 

- The portfolio now will be printed in A5 size as magazine with saddle stitch binding and will have 20 pages.

- My two Crystal Brush projects, the Skull bus, Nemesis Dreadknight, Ogrum Ironheart, Yarry, Lysander, Astorath....and more!

- The shipping costs for LEVEL C were free, but now, if I want to ship all the printed stuff in perfect conditions, I find myself obliged to charge the following shipping costs (LEVEL C only):

- European Union: $4 – Total perk cost: $54
- Rest of the World: $6 – Total perk cost: $56

Rest of the perks have no changes about the shipping terms.

- If you don´t want to pay the shipping costs, I will send the pdf tutorials by e-mail and the DVD by mail, as planned from the beginning.

- If you have chosen LEVEL A or B and want to upgrade to LEVEL C or above, you can change it at any time. Choose the new one and I will refund your first option when campaign ends.

- The printed portfolio will ship from September 2013 with the other printed stuff.

 

THANKS IN ADVANCE!!
story_txt:
ABOUT ME
My name is Enrique Velasco, also known as emuse. I am a professional freelance miniature painter from Spain. I have collaborated with many manufacturers and collectors from around the world and have garnered awards and recognition for my work, both domestic and international.
With strong influences of film, comic, illustration, History and 80´s and 90´s popular culture. All these influences are captured in some ideas that attempt to express in my works.
 

 
ABOUT THE CHICAGO CRYSTAL BRUSH AWARDS
The Crystal Brush Awards are meant to celebrate the fascinating and fantastic hobby of miniature painting. These awards are created and organized by CoolMiniOrNot.com.
With a large grand prize, and beautiful trophies, CMON hope that with the support of the miniature painting community this will be the event for miniatures enthusiasts everywhere!
Internet voting will be conducted at CoolMiniOrNot.com and CrystalBrush.com and will comprise 50% of the final score of each entry. The other 50% will comprise of a panel of judges selected from industry professionals and AdeptiCon staff.
The third Crystal Brush Awards will be held April 21 2013 at AdeptiCon 2013 in Chicago.

 

ABOUT THIS CAMPAIGN 
The Crystal Brush Awards are a fantastic opportunity for anyone who is professionally involved in the world of miniature painting. Unfortunately, the trip to Chicago from Spain carries an economic effort hardly acceptable for me. Air tickets and stay cost came close to $1300.
For this reason I am asking for your help to support me and my adventure in this year´s Awards, and why not, try to win any of the grand prizes kindly provided by CoolMiniOrNot and the Crystal Brush sponsors.
In return, I offer you the opportunity to get some rewards that I am sure will be very interesting, most of them focus on learning about miniature painting.
I can´t yet reveal nothing about my two projects in competition, but I can say something: Will be awesome!!. One will be a diorama based in the zombie world with several 70 Mm. figures, and the other will have two 90 Mm. Orc figures, based on the Warhammer 40k. universe.
 
PERKS FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTION
 
CONTRIBUTION LEVEL A

You will receive one Crystal Brush project no.1 PDF step by step.
PDF features:
- Over 25 pages. I´m sure it will far exceed!
- Tons of “work in progress” photographs.
- Extracts of my painting journal. Thoughts, difficulties and conclusions about the process.
- High detailed explanations of each step.
- All texts will be translated into English by a native english speaker.
- PDF will be sent to your verified email adress.
- Estimated delivery: June 2013
 
In this ultra-detailed PDF step by step you will be able to learn among other things:
- How to paint dead and human skin.
- Weathering effects on vehicles. Products and techniques.
- Blood effects.
- How to built a scenic base with several figures and other elements.
- How to use pigments.

 
CONTRIBUTION LEVEL B

You will receive one Crystal Brush Project no.1 PDF step by step + one Crystal Brush Project no.2 PDF step by step.
PDF features:
- Over 25 pages. I´m sure it will far exceed!
- Tons of “work in progress” photographs.
- Extracts of my painting journal. Thoughts, difficulties and conclusions about the process.
- High detailed explanations of each step.
- All texts will be translated into English by a native english speaker.
- PDF will be sent to your verified email adress.
- Estimated delivery: June 2013
 
In this ultra-detailed PDF step by step you will be able to learn among other things:
- How to paint Orc skin.
- Weathering effects on armours and weapons. Products and techniques.
- How to paint leather.
- How to paint true metallic metals.

 
CONTRIBUTION LEVEL C

You will receive one Crystal Brush Project no.1 PDF step by step + one Crystal Brush Project no.2 PDF step by step + one DVD video tutorial.
In this DVD video tutorial you can learn my favorite tricks and techniques in over two hours of video. 
DVD features:
- Weathering effects.
- How to paint faces and skin.
- How to paint non metallic metals.
- How to use an airbrush in miniatures.
- Speed painting techniques.
- How to paint textures.
- ...and more!
FREE SHIPPING! Item will be shipped to your verified shipping adress. I ship Worldwide. Estimated delivery: July 2013
Subtitled in English by a native english speaker.
 
 CONTRIBUTION LEVEL D (ONLY FOR SPANISH PEOPLE)

You will receive one Crystal Brush Project no.1 PDF step by step + one Crystal Brush Project no.2 PDF step by step + One DVD video tutorial + 16 hours of private tutoring in my studio in Madrid.
I never give private lessons or painting courses so don´t miss this opportunity!!! 
- We will paint one figure from beginning to end. 
- During the process you will be able to learn about color theory, painting techniques and effects, how to paint faces and skin, weathering, airbrushing, building bases, terrain (snow, pigments, water effects..), and more!! 
- The 16 hours may be distributed to the student preference. For example, in one or two weekends, during the week, mornings, afternoons...no problem about that point! Private tutoring will start from May 2013.
- You only need your brushes and one figure of my election. 
- I reserve the right to group two or three students (no more) if they are agreed and if their private tutoring hours coincide.
- Contact me for further information.
 
CONTRIBUTION LEVEL E:

You will receive one Crystal Brush Project no.1 PDF step by step + one Crystal Brush Project no.2 PDF step by step + One DVD video tutorial + One pro painted Space Marine.
Details:
- One plastic Space Marine pro-painted by emuse. You can see an example in the gallery
- You will have the chance to choose your favorite Space Marine chapter.
- The miniature will be painted with non metallic metals.
- Includes a wooden plinth and gaming base.
- No conversions allowed.
FREE SHIPPING! Item will be shipped to your verified shipping adress. I ship Worldwide. Estimated delivery: July 2013
 
 CONTRIBUTION LEVEL F
 
You will receive one Crystal Brush Project no.1 PDF step by step + one Crystal Brush Project no.2 PDF step by step + One DVD video tutorial + One pro painted Space Marine + One pro painted Space Marine Librarian.
ONLY TWO AVAILABLE!!!
Details:
- One discontinued Space Hulk Librarian pro-painted by emuse.
- The Space Marine Librarian of the first contributor will be submitted to the next Spanish Golden Demon. So, maybe you will have an awarded miniature!!
- The miniature will be painted with Non metallic metals and some freehands.
- Includes a wooden plinth and gaming base.
- No conversions allowed.
FREE SHIPPING! Item will be shipped to your verified shipping adress. I ship Worldwide. Estimated delivery: August 2013
 
 
STRETCH GOALS!!!
 

All the contributors at LEVEL C and above will receive one Golden Demon project PDF step by step. The main character of this awesome diorama will be a Warhammer Giant.
PDF features:
- Over 25 pages.
- Tons of “work in progress” photographs.
- Extracts of my painting journal. Thoughts, difficulties and conclusions about the process.
- High detailed explanations of each step.
- All texts will be translated into English by a native english speaker.
- PDF will be sent to your verified email adress.
- Estimated delivery: August 2013
 
In this ultra-detailed PDF step by step you will be able to learn among other things:
- How to paint human skin, using airbrush and brushes.
- How to built a scenic base. Composition and how to tell a story.
- How to paint using OSL.

 

All the contributors at LEVEL C and above will receive a physical copy of the three PDF tutorials. You will have about 90 pages with tons of work in progress photographs, detailed explanations, tips and advices. - Each tutorial will be printed in A4 size as magazine with saddle stitch binding.- The shipping costs for LEVEL C were free, but now, if I want to ship the printed stuff in perfect conditions, I find myself obliged to charge the following shipping costs (LEVEL C only):- European Union: $4 – Total perk cost: $54- Rest of the World: $6 – Total perk cost: $56Rest of the perks have no changes about the shipping terms.- If you don´t want to pay the shipping costs, I will send the pdf tutorials by e-mail and the DVD by mail, as planned from the beginning.- If you have chosen LEVEL A or B and want to upgrade to LEVEL C or above, you can change it at any time. Choose the new one and I will refund your first option when campaign ends.- The printed tutorials will ship from September 2013, and you will have the possibility to choose if you want the PDF tutorials in the estimated delivery dates or would you rather wait for the physical format.
 

All the contributors at LEVEL C and above will receive a printed portfolio with my best paint jobs. 
- The portfolio will be printed in A5 size as magazine with saddle stitch binding and will have 20 pages.
- My two Crystal Brush projects, the Skull bus, Nemesis Dreadknight, Ogrum Ironheart, Yarry, Lysander, Astorath....and more!- The shipping costs for LEVEL C were free, but now, if I want to ship all the printed stuff in perfect conditions, I find myself obliged to charge the following shipping costs (LEVEL C only):- European Union: $4 – Total perk cost: $54- Rest of the World: $6 – Total perk cost: $56Rest of the perks have no changes about the shipping terms.- If you don´t want to pay the shipping costs, I will send the pdf tutorials by e-mail and the DVD by mail, as planned from the beginning.- If you have chosen LEVEL A or B and want to upgrade to LEVEL C or above, you can change it at any time. Choose the new one and I will refund your first option when campaign ends.- The printed portfolio will ship from September 2013 with the other printed stuff.
 

If I reach $4000 all the contributors at LEVEL C and above will receive a printed portfolio with my best paint jobs. 
- The portfolio now will be printed in A5 size as magazine with saddle stitch binding and will have 20 pages.
- My two Crystal Brush projects, the Skull bus, Nemesis Dreadknight, Ogrum Ironheart, Yarry, Lysander, Astorath....and more!- The shipping costs for LEVEL C were free, but now, if I want to ship all the printed stuff in perfect conditions, I find myself obliged to charge the following shipping costs (LEVEL C only):- European Union: $4 – Total perk cost: $54- Rest of the World: $6 – Total perk cost: $56Rest of the perks have no changes about the shipping terms.- If you don´t want to pay the shipping costs, I will send the pdf tutorials by e-mail and the DVD by mail, as planned from the beginning.- If you have chosen LEVEL A or B and want to upgrade to LEVEL C or above, you can change it at any time. story:
I have dedicated my career to creating concepts, and artwork for purposes of Fine and Commercial artwork. Having worked as an artist assistant, production assistant, illustrator, and freelancer, I am ready to take the next step in my career and open my own studio. 

Religion Mr Kind & Generous, is my ambition. A direct translation of my name from Farsi into English. Religion (Dean) Mister (Seyed) Kind and Generous (Raoofi) seeks to be a place where myself and other creative professionals can bring ideas to life. By building a studio which provides artwork for sale to the public with a complete dedication to visual and creative excellence. To build and help build admirable careers for artist of diverse skill sets, myself included. As well as to self-generate commercial art products for collectors and consumers with discerning tastes and standards.

My goal is to create a "brand name " art studio. To build a name which is recognize across disciplines and for high quality creative production. I would like our early focus to be a Creative Publication as Religion Mr Kind And Generous Magazine, Fine Art screen printed posters, oil paintings, original collage work, water color paintings and drawings, and Commercial Artwork illustrations, t-shirts, stickers, posters, and various merchandise. 

Overtime I would like to provide residencies for artist, hire artist for commissioned work to expand the Religion Mr Kind and Generous name. Work with bands, film makers, fashion designers and expand the possibilities of our creative output.  Push the limits to our creativity and creative ventures. 

Right now, I need funds to help get me off the ground. Money to go to studio fees, supplies, equiptment, marketing, and the development of an online presence. 

Any contribution of any amount will be appreciated and helpful! For those with limited means, such as myself, spreading the word and sharing this campaign with your friends or family would be equally appreciated! 

Thank you Sincerely, 

Dean Seyed "Kind" Raoofi

Religion Mr Kind And Generous

story:
NEW PERKS

Now it's halftime we compiled a new complete board for you. We can offer it for a lower price. But don't bother, the mounted parts are also good quality wheels and trucks.

                                     :::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
For the Gridstyle we now offer you another shirt - DAGRID Shirt. Supersoft white organic cotton shirt with our Gridlogo 


THE GRIDBOARD

Hey everybody! This is the Gridboard. It is an entirely innovative cruiser deck, made of 100 % carbon-fiber – a super lightweight high-tech material that is mainly used in the aviation and automotive sectors, which makes the Gridboard lighter than common cruisers. The grid makes the unique, outstanding design. By the way, the Gridboard has been awarded for its innovative material use - the MATERIALICA product silver award! 
The gridboard is also nominated for the German Design Award 2016. Keep your fingers crossed for us.



We are fully committed to realizing the project Gridboard because we believe  in this brand new cruiser deck with all our designers' passion.

We already made several prototypes in our workshop, tested and confirmed by handpicked longboarders of the local scene.
Currently we are about to go into mass production, therefore we are already cooperating with a manufacturer who is now preparing the pre production.
With your support you help us financing the pilot series.



AS SEEN ON


YOUR SUPPORT

With our budget we were able to finance all the costs for constuction, pre-modelling, carbon and all the needed material beside, testing and professional fotoshoot.
For mass production we need another 20 000 Euros. 
The money will be distributed to the production itself
  • tooling
  • materials
  • development
  • assembly
  • further designs
 


PERKS

Of course you can purchase the Gridboard deck at an offer price of € 250. If you prefer a completly mounted longboard we can offer you a 
  1. Freestyle Grid, including Bear Trucks and finest Orangatang Stimulus wheels, 70MM, Duro 86a, at a complete price of € 389 
  2. Cruising Grid, including Bear Trucks and big Orangatang Kegel wheels, 80MM, Duro 83a, at a complete price of € 399
We also created some essential products for the longboarder, a nice Gridshirt and WOOHOO a 3D data set of our Grid wallhook for your Gridboard. You get the data and so you can print the hook out in the 3D printing shop nearby.

 



If we don't reach our campaign funding  goal, the funds will go toward producing anyway, because every Dollar counts.
All supporters will receive their promised products, however it may not be possible to continue production after delivering the first run. With your help, we can realize the market launch.
 


TIME SCHEDULE

TEAM

FUNDS AND RISKS

It is all manageable. To be honest, there is no risk. We've done most of the heavy lifting: design,R&D, prototyping, testing. Now that we're ready for mass production we need you supporting our fund. 

We think we removed all the final obstacles. If there might occur any problem with the material we'd immediatelly stop production and go on with analysing and solving the problem and then of course resume production to realize this cool board for you.

 

ORDERING INFORMATION

PLEASE NOTE THAT ONLY PAYPAL PAYMENT IS AVAILABLE.

3D Data of Wallhook

After campaign ends, we'll send you the 3D Dat for your Grid wallhook. Then you can print it at your favorite 3D printing service and mount it at home. Hang up your Grid and keep your home tidy.

T-Shirt Sizes

If your perk includes a t-shirt, we will send out a survey after the campaign ends for you to select your size option.

 

SHIPPING

Shipping within Germany costs € 9,90. In all other countries will cost a little extra fee. We intend to ship to all possible countries. We will work to get the lowest-cost to your destination. 


      OTHER WAYS TO HELP US

      If you have to save your money but like our product, please tell your friends and network. Maybe there are friends of you who want to invest, or maybe someone needs an idea for a cool birthday present... there are so many cases we don't even think of. :)

story:
Timeless Motion in brief.

Timeless Motion is a gallery exhibition featuring cinematic installations by seven artists (Paul Clipson, Keith Evans, Kerry Laitala, Jeanne Liotta, Kathleen Quillian, Scott Stark and Mark Wilson) that reveals the science and magic behind cinema. Using photography, collage, drawing, film, sculptural installation and projected light, the exhibition shows how moving image art is created and how the human response to visual phenomena drives the illusion of movement. The exhibition was organized as part of SOMArts Gallery's 2015-16 curatorial residency program and will be on view February 18—March 23, 2016 at SOMArts Gallery in San Francisco. All funds donated to this campaign will be processed through our fiscal sponsor Artists' Television Access.

Our vision is big. We need your help to make it happen.

As a one-time exhibition, we generally fall outside the scope of most institutional funders. But our vision is big and we have a lot things we want to do with this project--including workshops, a panel discussion and 3 expanded cinema programs--to further engage interested community members in exploring the history and techniques involved in experimental and moving image art.  

Our goal is to raise $7500 through this crowd-sourced fundraising campaign. The money will be used to directly support the creation of work, both in the gallery exhibition and related events. We have a ton of great gifts: DVDs, prints, photographs, collages and more, all made by the exhibiting artists as a way to thank you for your support of our work and vision. 

More about us and the exhibition.

All of the artists in this exhibition have long and involved histories of exhibiting and participating in the experimental film community. This exhibition is a way for us to further explore themes and elements in our respective practices in a gallery context, a new way of thinking and working for many of us. Through Timeless Motion we intend to bridge two distinct exhibition contexts, the black box of the theater and the white box of the gallery. 

The exhibition will consist of cinematic installations and artworks created with the basic elements of moving image art.  The components of moving image phenomena will be laid out in their most fundamental forms. From sequential still images to flickering archival imagery, to scintillating light and shadow, the audience will engage with the illusion of cinema and understand how the human response to visual phenomena creates the magical perception of movement.

Kerry Laitala’s para-cinematic devices reveal the mechanics of cinema as larger-than-life kinetic sculptures. Kathleen Quillian’s work in animation relies on the composition and construction of a series of still images to create the illusion of motion. Paul Clipson’s film installation reconfigures the experience of the moving image through an immersive, boundless sea of sound, light and image. Mark Wilson uses drawing and printmaking to zero in on the details of moving image work. Scott Stark explores the spectacle of light and movement in a cinematic installation made from industrial and organic material. Keith Evans paracinematic ecologies integrate A/V media and unusual sculptural elements to construct an integrated, organic, microcosmic universe. Jeanne Liotta's installation illustrates the complexity of the spacetime continuum. 

Complementing the Timeless Motion exhibition are a series of events and workshops including three expanded cinema programs of live film and music collaborations, a panel discussion celebrating the history of underground cinema in the Bay Area with film artists, scholars and curators who have been key participants and witnesses to the movement and two workshops that will introduce participants to resources and techniques integral to the creative process of moving image art, including cut-out animation and hand exposed camera-less filmmaking (or cinegrams).

As long-time members of the Bay Area experimental film community, we have extensive experience working together in various capacities, including organizing screenings, workshops and exhibitions both with and for each other. We have served in administrative capacities as staff and board members at many of the Bay Area’s most notable institutions dedicated to experimental film and video including the San Francisco Art Institute, SFMoMA, San Francisco Cinematheque, Canyon Cinema, Oddball Cinema, the Prelinger Archives, Artists’ Television Access and Shapeshifters Cinema. In between running our own organizations, we also create and exhibit our own work in screenings and festivals around the world including SF International Film Festival, International Film Festival Rotterdam and the Whitney Biennial, to name a few. We know what it takes to make a great exhibition and we are pooling together all of our know-how to make the Timeless Motion exhibition one to remember.

Thank You!

We greatly appreciate any amount you can contribute to help us reach our goal. You can also help us by spreading the word about this campaign to your friends and community. Follow us on Facebook to keep up with all our goings-on: https://www.facebook.com/timelessmotionexhibit/ or join our mailing list, which you can find on our website: http://www.timelessmotion.org 

In the meantime, here are images of some of the thank you gifts we are offering....

mweep mweep by Mark Wilson (2008). Self-published 32-page experiment in the sequential medium (available for $15 donation)

Chromatic Cocktails DVD -- 9 Chromadepth (3D) moving image works by Kerry Laitala (available for $30 donation)


Dueling Projectors  by Kerry Laitala (2013), 9in. X 12in., letterpress, printed on a Vandercook press onto fiber-based paper and signed by the artist. (available for $40 donation)


Pendulum Precession No. 7 (2015) print by Mark Wilson (available for $40 donation)

Wrack Light in Augury (2006) DVD compilation of 7 videos by Keith Evans (available for $30 donation)


The Realist  (2013) by Scott Stark on Blu-ray (available for $75 donation)


City Blights (2015) by Kerry Laitala. Limited edition, archival, inkjet print, 10 in. x 15 in. (available for $85 donation)


Loie Fuller Tribute (2015) by Kerry Laitala, 13 in. x 10 in., limited edition, archival inkjet print. (available for $100 donation)

suntitled (2014) by Keith Evans. Limited edition monoprint (#4 of 11), 7mm still and decalcomania, 4 in. x 4 in. (available for $100 donation)



90-minute film screening at Canyon Cinema (available for $250 donation)


Cylindric Impression: Le Musée de la Cinémathèque française, No. 6 (2015) by Mark Wilson. Limited edition, archival, inkjet print, 16 in. x 32 in. (available for $300 donation)


Bright Mirror (2014) by Paul Clipson. Framed film collage print, 20.25 in. x 25.25 in. (available for $300 donation)

Pendulum Precession No. 6 (2015) by Mark Wilson. Ink on paper, 8 in. x 8 in. (available for $400 donation)

SAFE (1982/2015) by Scott Stark. Vertical triptych C-print, 8 in. x 27 in. (available for $450 donation)

Ode to Madame Blavatsky (2013) by Kerry Laitala. Limited edition, unmounted, archival, inkjet print, 18 in. x 22 in. (available for $400 donation)

Ode to Audrey Munson (2013) by Kerry Laitala. Limited Edition, archival, unmounted, inkjet print, 35 in. x 40 in. (available for $600 donation)

All funds donated to this campaign will be processed through our fiscal sponsor Artists' Television Access.  Our vision is big. We need your help to make it happen.
 As a one-time exhibition, we generally fall outside the scope of most institutional funders. But our vision is big and we have a lot things we want to do with this project--including workshops, a panel discussion and 3 expanded cinema programs--to further engage interested community members in exploring the history and techniques involved in experimental and moving image art.  
Our goal is to raise $7500 through this crowd-sourced fundraising campaign. The money will be used to directly support the creation of work, both in the gallery exhibition and related events. We have a ton of great gifts: DVDs, prints, photographs, collages and more, all made by the exhibiting artists as a way to thank you for your support of our work and vision.    More about us and the exhibition.
 All of the artists in this exhibition have long and involved histories of exhibiting and participating in the experimental film community. This exhibition is a way for us to further explore themes and elements in our respective practices in a gallery context, a new way of thinking and working for many of us. Through Timeless Motion we intend to bridge two distinct exhibition contexts, the black box of the theater and the white box of the gallery.  
The exhibition will consist of cinematic installations and artworks created with the basic elements of moving image art.  The components of moving image phenomena will be laid out in their most fundamental forms. From sequential still images to flickering archival imagery, to scintillating light and shadow, the audience will engage with the illusion of cinema and understand how the human response to visual phenomena creates the magical perception of movement. 
Kerry Laitala’s para-cinematic devices reveal the mechanics of cinema as larger-than-life kinetic sculptures. Kathleen Quillian’s work in animation relies on the composition and construction of a series of still images to create the illusion of motion. Paul Clipson’s film installation reconfigures the experience of the moving image through an immersive, boundless sea of sound, light and image. Mark Wilson uses drawing and printmaking to zero in on the details of moving image work. Scott Stark explores the spectacle of light and movement in a cinematic installation made from industrial and organic material. Keith Evans paracinematic ecologies integrate A/V media and unusual sculptural elements to construct an integrated, organic, microcosmic universe. Jeanne Liotta's installation illustrates the complexity of the spacetime continuum. 

Complementing the Timeless Motion exhibition are a series of events and workshops including three expanded cinema programs of live film and music collaborations, a panel discussion celebrating the history of underground cinema in the Bay Area with film artists, scholars and curators who have been key participants and witnesses to the movement and two workshops that will introduce participants to resources and techniques integral to the creative process of moving image art, including cut-out animation and hand exposed camera-less filmmaking (or cinegrams).
As long-time members of the Bay Area experimental film community, we have extensive experience working together in various capacities, including organizing screenings, workshops and exhibitions both with and for each other. We have served in administrative capacities as staff and board members at many of the Bay Area’s most notable institutions dedicated to experimental film and video including the San Francisco Art Institute, SFMoMA, San Francisco Cinematheque, Canyon Cinema, Oddball Cinema, the Prelinger Archives, Artists’ Television Access and Shapeshifters Cinema. In between running our own organizations, we also create and exhibit our own work in screenings and festivals around the world including SF International Film Festival, International Film Festival Rotterdam and the Whitney Biennial, to name a few. We know what it takes to make a great exhibition and we are pooling together all of our know-how to make the Timeless Motion exhibition one to remember.

 


Thank You!
We greatly appreciate any amount you can contribute to help us reach our
 goal. You can also help us by spreading the word about this campaign to
 your friends and community. Follow us on Facebook to keep up with all 
our goings-on: https://www.facebook.com/timelessmotionexhibit/ or join our mailing list, which you can find on our website: http://www.timelessmotion.org  In the meantime, here are images of some of the thank you gifts we are offering....



mweep mweep by Mark Wilson (2008). Self-published 32-page experiment in the sequential medium (available for $15 donation)




Chromatic Cocktails DVD -- 9 Chromadepth (3D) moving image works by Kerry Laitala (available for $30 donation)





Dueling Projectors  by Kerry Laitala (2013), 9in. X
 12in., letterpress, printed on a Vandercook press onto fiber-based 
paper and signed by the artist. (available for $40 donation)



Pendulum Precession No. 7 (2015) print by Mark Wilson (available for $40 donation)




Wrack Light in Augury (2006) DVD compilation of 7 videos by Keith Evans (available for $30 donation)



The Realist  (2013) by Scott Stark on Blu-ray (available for $75 donation)

City Blights (2015) by Kerry Laitala. Limited edition, archival, inkjet print, 10 in. x 15 in. (available for $85 donation)

Loie Fuller Tribute (2015) by Kerry Laitala, 13 in. x 10 in., limited edition, archival inkjet print. (available for $100 donation)





suntitled (2014) by Keith Evans. Limited edition monoprint (#4 of 11), 7mm still and decalcomania, 4 in. x 4 in. (available for $100 donation)

90-minute film screening at Canyon Cinema (available for $250 donation)



Cylindric Impression: Le Musée de la Cinémathèque française, No. 6 (2015) by Mark Wilson. Limited edition, archival, inkjet print, 16 in. x 32 in. (available for $300 donation)
Bright Mirror (2014) by Paul Clipson. Framed film collage print, 20.25 in. x 25.25 in. (available for $300 donation)





Pendulum Precession No. 6 (2015) by Mark Wilson. Ink on paper, 8 in. x 8 in. (available for $400 donation)





SAFE (1982/2015) by Scott Stark. Vertical triptych C-print, 8 in. x 27 in. (available for $450 donation)




Ode to Madame Blavatsky (2013) by Kerry Laitala. Limited edition, unmounted, archival, inkjet print, 18 in. x 22 in. (available for $400 donation)




Ode to Audrey Munson (2013) by Kerry Laitala. Limited Edition, archival, unmounted, inkjet print, 35 in. x 40 in. (available for $600 donation)

story:
LET US MELT IN UNISON

Join Tariq Luthun and  Hanif Willis-Abdurraqib as they host a workshop on what ice cream goes best with your poetry. Delve into the dairy-laden troughs of pedagogy with two people who have spent the past few years of their lives seeing the lonely, delicious end of a milkshake more frequently than they have their own fathers.


FEAST WITH THE FAM

tl;dr: we want to feed you ice cream at this workshop, but we don't have the funds to do so. It will be locally provided, conscientious ice cream-- we've done our research on where we want to get it from [we don't need $500, IndieGoGo is making us ask for that much. But ya'know, the more money the more ice cream the more merrier].

LET US FEED YOU OUR PROPERLY-CHURNED SOULS

The collegiate experience is all about exploration, taking on challenges, and breaking through to create something that the world needs. Given that we'll be at an event with some of the most creative young minds, we wanted to feed the soul in more than one way. In short: the plan is to revolutionize the art of pleasure and passion by joining the culinary and literary arts through ice cream and poetry.


WHAT WE NEED

  • We need money for ice cream to serve a couple hundred people.
  • In exchange for your donation, Tariq will be providing once-in-a-lifetime ice cream themed poetry perk opportunity.
  • We're just trying to reach $300, anything extra would help us get more ice cream. After everyone has been fed, anything left over will be used to reimburse other costs associated [covering the cost of perks, catering, etc].


GET FROSTY WITH US.

story:
Every 28 hours, a Black person in the United States is shot by police. This violence touches our communities nearly once a day. 108 days after Mike Brown was shot, the system failed his community. Across the nation, we have risen in support. We are passionate about justice, though we know the road will be hard.

Since August of 2014, more and more media attention has been focused on injustice done to the Black community by police and government systems. More people have joined the fight for justice. Organizers from NY have been to Ferguson. Organizers from Ferguson have protested in Baltimore. Organizers from Oakland and LA have travelled to Palestine. Organizers from Chicago have travelled to the UN. More people have turned out, in more ways, and a network of activists has built and grown.

However, not all of us can be in the streets, and not all of us have funds or resources to donate. One thing that we do have is our voice. This book is our effort to provide support from afar. We are putting out an anthology of poetry, essay, and art, featuring the work of people of color about or in support of protesters in Ferguson and other Black and brown communities. The collection is titled After Ferguson: In Solidarity, and features work reflecting on the current moment. The anthology includes 2 essays, 3 pieces of art, and 31 poems from 26 creators of color.

Who's behind this?
Tessara Dudley, writer and Founder of Mourning Glory Publishing
Mariah Leewright, performing artist and writer

Tessara: The anthology is really my baby. I got the idea for this anthology after travelling from Portland, OR, to Ferguson, MO, and then returning home to organize locally. I participated in Poets for Ferguson, a 24-hour cypher broadcast live over the internet and including poets from all over. A month later, I was disabled. Suddenly, I found myself unable to keep marching and working for change. I spent weeks suffering from brain fog, pain, and fatigue. But I was determined to keep helping somehow. In one of the organizing groups I joined, we were throwing around ideas on how to raise more funds for protesters, and someone mentioned Poets for Ferguson. We thought of local readings, and some sort of print publication. While the idea of local events never got off the ground, this anthology is the result of that conversation.

Mariah: My first encounter with Ferguson and the murder of Mike Brown came from Tumblr. Brown's murder become the catalyst for the current Black uprisings; although the murder of Black lives by the police-state has been occurring for decades. Black Lives Matter activists both virally and on the ground, captured all first hand accounts, when every other news source had been censored or didn't care. Then the scroll of names appeared; "#every28hours in the USA, a Black person is murdered by Police" (Operation Ghetto Storm, MXGM, 2013). I was done. Shortly after the media swarm, Tessara started AFIS and asked me to join the project. My activism is my writing; I move in solidarity with Ferguson through this book.

What are the funds for?
After printing costs and a tiny percentage to support the press, funds raised will be donated to organizations that support protesters and work to heal Black American communities, and to the families of victims and survivors of police violence.

Organizations we're considering supporting include the Organization for Black Struggle, Million Hoodies Movement for Justice, Young, Gifted, and Black, Critical Resistance, Black Workers for Justice, National Black Justice Coalition, The Louisiana Justice Institute, Children's Defense Fund, Black Women's Health Imperative, PolicyLink, Black Youth Project 100, and Dream Defenders. This list will grow and change.

Please share our campaign on Facebook and Twitter, and encourage your friends to support us!

story:
About Us

We are a group of friends and artists in Santa Cruz, CA. Last summer we began renting a space on Meder St and we’ve spent the last several months building it out for production and are almost ready to realize our dream with an independent fully functioning printshop focusing on relief, letterpress and silkscreen printing.

To learn more about our artists, please visit our website:

www.littlegiantcollective.com

 

Let's get this press running!

We were graciously given an ATF Little Giant Letterpress and we need funds to get it running. We would like to hire an expert to come out and help us service it, and with left over donations we will buy type, ink and other supplies. 

 

The Impact

The Little Giant Collective is built of extremely dedicated and proactive artists. The space, while still in development, has already been a hub for a number of community screenprinting events and art instruction. We aim to better our community through creative expression and your contributions make that possible. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word for us! Come visit the space and screen print your own T-shirt!

Follow us on Instagram - little.giant.collective

story:
Hello, i'm fundraising for SkatePal, I need money to buy materials to build a skatepark in Palestine.


My name is Joshua Perkin, I work as a freelance writer and artist in Barcelona. 
  • At the end of August this year i'm going to spend two months in Asria El Shamalyia, near Nablus. I'm going with a small team of volunteers to build a skatepark , with a registered charity called skatePal.
  • Due to the political situation in Palestine, areas such as sport and art are often underfunded and neglected, and this non-for-profit charity will bring something with no ulterior motives other than fun to the town. 
  • No focus on sexes, no focus on ages, no focus on religious or political beliefs. Just something that is centred around personal progression to be enjoyed by anyone. 
What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise a total of £18,000.00 for the skatepark alone, so every penny is going to help. For each contribution, you will receive a piece of my handmade art.  

Where the money will go:

1. Construction materials: lumber, concrete, gravel, water facilities

2. Construction equipment: power tools, digger, buckets, shovels, 

3. Skateboarding equipment: elbow pads, knee pads,helmets, skate shoes, skateboard trucks, skateboard decks.

4. Transportation costs. 

What you can chose to receive:

£8

- A hand made Tote bag, made from quality materials with a custom printed design. 

£18

- A hand made Tote bag

- An exclusive print of an original painting.

£25

- A hand made Tote bag

- An exclusive print of an original painting

- A one off original hand painted tile

£100

-  A one off original 40cm/30cm mixed media painting

£200

-  A commissioned 70cm/50cm painting – choose your own concept

The Impact

The difference that you will make to the children of Palestine will be huge... somewhere to play, somewhere to feel equal, somewhere to be free.

Risks & Challenges

In terms of the ongoing conflict in Gaza...
SkatePAL has been running successfully for over three years and has kept the participants safe through last years' conflict. The guide and director, Charlie frequently visits the OPT and has travelled extensively across Israel and Palestine, has met with local authorities to ensure as safe an environment as possible.

This is a non-for-profit charity, that means that myself and everyone else involved is taking a lot of time out of their working lives to go and work for a cause in which we collectively believe. This is why we need your help. 

Other Ways You Can Help

SPEAD THE WORD! 






Hola, estoy recogiendo dinero para SkatePal, el dinero que necesito, es para comprar materiales para construir un skatepark en Palestina.


Mi nombre es Joshua Perkin, trabajo como un escritor y artista freelance en Barcelona.

  • En el final de agosto de este año pasare dos meses en Asria El Shamalyia, cerca a Nablus, Iré con un pequeño equipo de voluntarios para construir un skatepark con una organización llamada SkatePal.
  • Debido a la situación política en Palestina, áreas como el deporte o el arte, no están financiadas lo suficiente. por lo tanto, este proyecto sin ánimo de lucro, traerá algo que no tendrá ningún otro beneficio mas que recreación a la ciudad.
  • No importa el género, ni la edad, tampoco las creencias políticas. Lo único que importa es el progreso personal de cada habitante para que la comunidad pueda disfrutarlo.

Lo que necesitamos 

Necesitamos recoger un total de £18,000.00 para la construcción de la skatepark, por lo tanto, cada euro será de ayuda. 

Donde irá el dinero:

Materiales de construcción

Materiales para los niños

Transportación.

Tu eliges si recibes:

£8

- Un Tote-bag hecho a mano, con materiales de calidad y diseño personalizado. 

£18

- Un Tote-bag hecho a mano

- Una impresión exclusiva de una pintura original

£25

- Un Tote-bag hecho a mano

- Una impresión exclusiva de una pintura original

- Una baldosa pintada a mano

£100

- Un lienzo original de 40cm/30cm

£200

- Un lienzo personalizado; Tú eliges el concepto

El Impacto

La diferencia que ayudarás a generar en los niños de Palestina será enorme. Un lugar donde jugar, es un lugar donde se sientan libres.

Riesgos y Desafíos

En términos del conflicto actual en Gaza...

SkatePal ha organizando satisfactoriamente por un tiempo de 3 años y ha mantenido a salvo a los voluntarios del proyecto en los últimos años víctimas del conflicto. El guía y el director, Charlie, frecuentemente visita la OPT y ha viajado a través de Israel y Palestina, asegurándose junto con las autoridades locales de que  sea un contexto seguro entre lo posible.

Es un proyecto sin animo de lucro que significa que los demás voluntarios involucrados y yo, nos tomaremos un tiempo de nuestras vidas para viajar y trabajar en este proyecto en el cual creemos. Este es el porqué necesitamos de tu ayuda.


COMPARTE !

COMPARTE !

story:
“Been here for ages, but still can’t speak Dutch!”

This is one of the most frequently discussed topics among foreigners living in The Netherlands. Especially if you live in a city like Amsterdam, not speaking Dutch is not much of a problem in everyday life. Almost everything can be done in English.  So, actually there are many people who stay in Holland for a long time without speaking Dutch.

「オランダにもう何年も住んでいる。でもオランダ語ができない！」

というのは日本人に限らず、オランダに長く在住している他の外国人からもよく耳にします。特にアムステルダムなどの都市部に住んでいると、オランダ語が分からなくてもあまり支障を感じることなく普段の生活を送れてしまい、気づいたら全くオランダ語を習得しないまま長期間滞在してしまった、というのは実はよくあることなのです。


To tell you the truth, we are some of those people.  It's not like we don't know any words, but we are definitely not proud of our level of Dutch, considering how long we have lived here. We even plan to stay longer.  

何を隠そう、自分たちもまさにそのうちの一人。全くとは言わないものの、何年も住んでいて、超基本の挨拶程度しかできない。


We started to ask ourselves “Isn’t it about time we do something to change it……?”

It might take long to be able to speak Dutch fluently. But if we understand what people say and manage to tell simple things, that will help us make a positive change in our daily life and get closer to Dutch people. To finally get off our asses and learn, we thought about making something that can trigger us to learn the language. That’s when we came up with the idea to make Dutch-Japanese flash cards.

さすがにちょっとマズイのではと、、、

だんだんとある種の焦りのようなものを覚えてきました。

流暢に喋れなくとも、聞き取りができるようになったり、簡単なことをオランダ語で伝えられるようになるだけで、もっとオランダ人と仲が深まったり、日常生活にも良い変化があるはずだ。オランダ語を勉強しよう！と何年も考え続けてきた自分たちの重い腰を上げる、ちょっと楽しいきっかけを作りたい。そして、単語帳というキーワードにたどり着きました。


As a teenager, we used to have those flashcards on a ring to memorize English words. We always kept them in our pocket and flipped through them, mumbling the words in a classroom and on public transport before an exam. We got inspired to make our Dutch-Japanese flashcards in this format, because it is one of the iconic objects of our adolescence. 

自分たちが中学生や高校生の頃、英単語の勉強に使っていた、リング式単語帳。ポケットに忍ばせ持ち歩き、ぺらぺらめくりぶつぶつ独り言を言うように勉強していた、今ではちょっと懐かしい文房具。ある意味自分たちの青春のひと時を象徴するものをモチーフとして、日蘭単語帳を作ることにしました。


Design and contents

One side of the card is an illustration and the other side shows the word corresponding to the illustration, written both in Dutch and Japanese. There are also example sentences.

単語帳の内容と構成

単語帳の構成は片面がイラスト、もう片面にはそのイラストに準ずる単語（名詞）が日語蘭語両方で発音の仕方と共に表記され、またその単語を使用した例文も添えられています。

*It will be printed in colors.

There are 58 nouns in total. They are mostly things and situations you would encounter frequently in your daily life. The example sentences also show some cultural differences in lifestyle and communication, between the Netherlands and Japan. 

単語は日常生活でよく目にするもの、覚えておくと便利なものなどを基準に総数５８の単語を選びました。例文は、両国の文化、生活様式、言葉に対するアプローチの違いなどが感じられるようになっています。


Printing

We have decided to use Riso printing technique. Riso printing gives a hand-made look to the prints. The slightly rough texture reminds us of the nostalgic school newspapers we used to receive in elementary school. It is also a budget-friendly printing methode. Depending on the budget we get, but we are planning to produce 100-200 copies.

印刷

風合のある仕上がりとなるリソグラフ印刷を使用します。小学生の頃の学級新聞を思い出させる少し荒い印刷による懐かしさと、低コストという利点があります。印刷部数は予算次第で上下しますが、100~200部製作する予定です。


*Riso printing example, 2016 calendar made by studio long hill

Supervising

We’ve asked Karin Kuwahara from So Communications (Amsterdam based company for intermediation and translation) to supervise the content and translation.  

翻訳・監修

アムステルダムを拠点とし、翻訳やコーディネート業務をされているSo Communications の桑原果林さんに、オランダ語の単語、監修をしてもらいます。

Last but not least...

This project started from an attemp to create a new leaning tool for Dutch/Japanese.  But we also believe that it will be an interesting publication as you can also learn about cultural differences between two countries. 

Thank you for reading through! We hope you are interested in this project and in supporting us to realize it! 

最後に

このプロジェクトは、言葉の勉強という切り口からスタートしたものですが、出来上がるものは勉強はもちろんのこと、風俗や生活様式の違いなどが感じられる作りになっており、”読み物”としても面白みのあるものに仕上がることと信じています。

このプロジェクトをベストな形で実現するためにぜひご支援の方ご検討頂けると幸いです。

最後まで読んでいただきありがとうございました！


And,,,, we are

studio long hill

Formed by Akiko (graphic designer from Nagano, JP) and Masaki (artist from Okayama, JP) and based in Amsterdam since 2015.

The studio mainly creates products and autonomous works based on the members’ very personal interests. 

https://www.instagram.com/studiolonghill/

スタジオロングヒル

２０１５年に長野県出身の若林亜希子と岡山県出身の香本正樹によりアムステルダムにて結成される。

個人的な興味を元にしたグッヅ、作品の制作を中心に活動。


Special thanks to Eloi (voice)
story_txt:
“Been here for ages, but still can’t speak Dutch!”
This is one of the most frequently discussed topics among foreigners living in The Netherlands. Especially if you live in a city like Amsterdam, not speaking Dutch is not much of a problem in everyday life. Almost everything can be done in English.  So, actually there are many people who stay in Holland for a long time without speaking Dutch.
「オランダにもう何年も住んでいる。でもオランダ語ができない！」
というのは日本人に限らず、オランダに長く在住している他の外国人からもよく耳にします。特にアムステルダムなどの都市部に住んでいると、オランダ語が分からなくてもあまり支障を感じることなく普段の生活を送れてしまい、気づいたら全くオランダ語を習得しないまま長期間滞在してしまった、というのは実はよくあることなのです。
To tell you the truth, we are some of those people.  It's not like we don't know any words, but we are definitely not proud of our level of Dutch, considering how long we have lived here. We even plan to stay longer.  
何を隠そう、自分たちもまさにそのうちの一人。全くとは言わないものの、何年も住んでいて、超基本の挨拶程度しかできない。

We started to ask ourselves “Isn’t it about time we do something to change it……?”


It might take long to be able to speak Dutch fluently. But if we understand what people say and manage to tell simple things, that will help us make a positive change in our daily life and get closer to Dutch people. To finally get off our asses and learn, we thought about making something that can trigger us to learn the language. That’s when we came up with the idea to make Dutch-Japanese flash cards.


さすがにちょっとマズイのではと、、、

*It will be printed in colors.

story:
Our Story:

We are a group of five women (Sarah, Paddi, Jessi, Shelley and Eleanor) who came together when we realized that we have all dreamed of seeing a creativity-focused studio that is open to the public. We dreamed of a space where members of the community (like you) can come gather, create art and support one another in a safe, welcoming and sustainable space. This space can be the catalyst for greater change in our community, in the social fabric and the physical fabric. 

This community studio is for everyone, regardless of artistic ability or background, and each person’s unique contribution is appreciated and needed. Together with the community, we envision a vibrant and inspiring grassroots studio space that will help members along their creative path. We have found in our own lives that creative self-expression and art making helps and heals by giving a feeling of possibility, hope and empowerment. 

We see magpies as collectors of potential. They see discarded items as gems, building their nest sculptures by finding the shiny bits of meaning in them. We see ourselves as magpies, looking for meaning in the every day, and taking those discarded items to upcycle them into something new, beautiful and functional. Magpies are known to be one of the most intelligent species of animal, and are even able to learn to use tools. Perhaps they would make crafts given the chance! By focusing on upcycling, we help to divert waste from landfills, and turn junk into beauty.

Where You Come In:

Grassroots funding is our current focus, and is also where you come in. We have been looking for funding to open a studio for you to join us and create! So far, we have been hosting free, monthly pop-ups, including nature art, assemblage from discarded materials, fabric collage, painted fabric circle murals and flower printmaking. In the works for the coming months, we have chopstick mobiles, upcycled creations, collage, silhouettes, and an embroidered community map. We welcome your feedback, and please let us know what you would like to see in the future! The funding we have received thus far has gone to pay for supplies for our workshops. We have received a Neighbourhood Small Grant, a Community Partners Grant, and a grant from East Feast through Britannia Community Centre.

As a new not-for-profit group, the funding we are seeking is difficult to access. We also realize that our supporters and community are our greatest resource. Some of you have been asking how you can help, and now we can answer you. We are starting this grassroots fundraising campaign, with the goal of raising enough money for our first 3 months rent in our studio space. This approach makes sense, because rather than relying on big funders, we can get a little (or a lot, we will also be thrilled with a lot!) help from a large number of people in order to have sustainable and diversified funding. We will also be holding a benefit concert as a culminating celebration of this campaign, so stay tuned!

We are asking for:

$1500/month rent

$300/month utilities and expenses

$750/month honorariums and workshop facilitators

for 3 months =$7650

You will get:

-A space to feel at home, meet your neighbours and explore your own creativity

-A hand-embroidered leaf honouring you ($25) a surprise craft kit mailed to you ($50) and a FREE workshop of your choice ($100) 

-A sense of joy!

The Impact

We believe that we can be a place for families and individuals in the community to build self-confidence, relationships, and to come and work together as equals. The space will become a safe and trustworthy community hub and can be a remedy for the loneliness and isolation felt by many members of our community, as evidenced in this Vancouver Foundation report: http://www.straight.com/news/vancouver-study-city-loneliness-and-unfriendliness. It is important to us that we work together as a true community, inter-generationally, and with people from different backgrounds and experiences. Creative art and craft is the perfect way to share and learn from people we might not necessarily meet otherwise, and transcends language. By working alongside your neighbours, the community and every day interactions will be enriched.

This start-up fund will help us to get an initial nest egg, until we open (planned for October 2013). We will become self sustaining by selling studio memberships, operating a storefront shop, gallery, small cafe, and generating revenue from special workshops and studio rentals. We will be documenting our activities to share with you, and with bigger funders. We see this start-up fund as the catalyst for our future grant success! We want to make this space as affordable as possible, so that there are no barriers to creating art. 

Other ways our feathered friends can help:

Please share our campaign in any way you can, and come to our events! Check here to learn about them:

https://www.facebook.com/CommunityArtSpace

and

www.magpiesnest.ca

Come by our studio (this fall), suggest a workshop, drop us a line, or give us a lead on repurposed supplies (or great old junk!)

story:
Art Bus for Children - Mobile Art Museum 

The IAM Art Bus was created as an educational tool to expose art to disadvantaged children who do not normally have the opportunity to view and create art in a museum setting. Since art seems to have taken a back seat in public schools we decided that we would take matters into our own hands and bring the art to the children.

The IAM Art Bus is going to be an educational mobile art museum that hosts art exhibitions and brings art teachers and art creators to educate the children and the public on art history, art creation and the importance of art in the community. We will be making stops just about anywhere where they will allow us to park: Art Walks, Schools, Community Streets, Art Festivals, Farmer's Markets, Private Parties.

Outside of the IAM Art Bus as it looks now with a rendering of the Future IAM Art Bus. Attached is the awning covering the students and teacher from the sun. **Note - Not to scale :)

The IAM Art Bus is run by Artist and Art Supporters who genuinely care about the arts. Visit our website: http://www.IAMArtBus.org 

What We Need & What You Get

    We Need the Following:
    Art Supplies
    More Tables and Chairs
    To Paint the Bus
    Install Gallery Walls Inside the Bus
    Install Gallery Lighting
    To Buy a Generator
    Purchase and Install a Sink for Cleaning Art Supplies and Children's Messy Hands
    Fuel for the Bus
    To Buy an Awning to Protect Children from the Elements
    What you get for helping

    That depends on how much you are willing to spend, but we feel like we have some very awesome gifts and we want everyone to get something in return.

    Everyone that sends us money will be recognized on our donor page at IAMArtBus.org. We also have various offerings where we will drive the IAM Art Bus to you for your own private art exhibit, or just to drop off a T-shirt and give you a private tour of the bus. 

    If you are generous enough to donate $10,000 or more then we will place your large logo on the side of our bus for all the traffic in LA/OC to see. We will keep this on our bus for the duration of 1 year, plus a logo and link to you or your organization on the main page of our website.

    We will gladly accept any amount and we thank everyone involved who is trying to help us realize our dream of creating a mobile art museum. If you are in the LA/OC area and you would like to become a team member of the IAM Art Bus then feel free to visit us at: http://www.IAMArtBus.org and get in contact with us.

The Impact

We want to make an impact in the lives of children across the LA/OC area by introducing them to the arts by driving our art museum to them.

  • The IAM Art Bus gives children a chance to create and learn about art history and art culture.
  • Art is a simple way to improve a child’s self-esteem.
  • The IAM Art Bus gives disadvantaged children something to do and is a great outlet to express themselves creatively.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word! Please share on your social media site or e-mail list.
  • Volunteer ... We are always looking for people who want to make an impact on someones lives through the arts.

Inside Rendering of the future IAM Art Bus

Goodies - T-shirts

Goodie - Painting Aprons

Goodies - Art Tables - Paper Roll and Chalkboard Top

story:
ATTENTION SUPPORTERS!!!
The + More WoCA in 2014 Campaign is participating campaign in Indiegogo's #GivingTuesday on Tuesday, December 3rd, 2013. Here's how it works: 
For every $20 raised through our campaign on Tuesday, December 3rd only, Indiegogo will match $1! So please support us on #GivingTuesday as we promote +More WoCA in 2014! Thanks in advance for your support!

Short Summary

Since WoCA Projects opened in February 2013, we have had a very successful run of exhibitions and programming. Our mission was to highlight the contemporary art by women artists of color and artists of diverse backgrounds through exhibitions and community arts programming. Our initial goal was to have at least 4 exhibitions this year, and we accomplished that and then some while nearly 2 months shy of our 1 year anniversary! Here are some key accomplishments that we've made within our first year:

  • featured over emerging and established 30 artists through both solo, group, and juried exhibitions.
  • featured a total of approximately 10 exhibitions (solo, group, and juried) with accompanying opening receptions and event programming.
  • partnered with local youth arts academy to feature over 100+ student works.
  • started a monthly "Afternoon Teas @ WoCA" event series, featuring women leaders in the arts.
  • advocated and promoted the works of featured artists to area collectors, curators, and institutions.
  • created positive visibility and exposure for our featured artists and local arts community!

+ MORE WoCA in 2014 

We have big plans for 2014 and as we enter our second year of exhibitions and programming we are ready to kick things up a notch! The + More Campaign is all about vision casting and helping us to continue our mission to highlight contemporary art by women artists of color and diverse artists of all backgrounds. We have more exhibitions and programming that we'd like to offer and more artists, creative entrepreneurs, arts leaders, and arts educators both locally and nationally that we'd like to bring in to support our local arts community. Here is what your contribution will do:

  • Our goal is to raise $15,000, which will cover our operational and programming costs for the year. This amount covers the base level costs of our exhibition space, marketing/promotion, exhibition expenses, opening receptions, and programming events. And remember, the more we raise the more we will be able to do!
  • As a thank you for supporting our campaign we have some amazing perks available, such as, postcard/email blast announcements, a WoCA notebook, tickets to our Afternoon Teas @ WoCA event, or having your name/organization on our contributors wall during exhibitions, and much more!
  • Our campaign is flexible, so all monies that are contributed will go to our project. Even if we don't raise our entire goal (eventhough we really hope we do!), every dollar raised will be used towards operational and programming costs. Not raising our goal just makes it that much harder to fund all of the cool exhibitions and programs we have planned for 2014.
  • Your contribution is tax-deductible! WoCA Projects is a fiscally sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization, and therefore your contribution is tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law. Note: Your Tax-deductible contribution is minus the value of any perks you receive by participating in this campaign (i.e., For $25 contribution: Perk received: WoCA Notebook, value is $8; Tax-deductible amount: $17).

For a contribution of $25 you will receive a big thank you and a WoCA notebook!

For a contribution of $100 you will receive a WoCA notebook + be listed as a WoCA Champion on our exhibition sponsors wall and on our website.

For a contribution of $250 you will receive a WoCA notebook + be listed as a WoCA Major Exhibition Sponsor on our exhibition sponsors wall and on our website + 2 tickets to attend one of our monthly Afternoon Teas @ WoCA events. Afternoon Teas @ WoCA are every 2nd Saturday of the month ( except January 2014).

For a contribution of $1000 you will receive a WoCA notebook + be listed as a Major Exhibition Sponsor on our exhibition sponsors wall and on our website + 2 tickets to attend one of our monthly Afternoon Teas @ WoCA events + host a private meeting/reception in our space for approximately 40 people  + have the change to sit on our advisor committee and give advice and input on programming and community outreach for the space.

Why Your Contribution Matters?

Your contribution makes a difference! Let us tell you why:

  • Your contribution allows us to create exhibition opportunities for artists! With your help we are able to expose the art world to emerging, mid-career, and established artists to our local arts community. 
  • Your contribution is going towards a quality arts program. Within a short period of time, our exhibitions and programs have become highly regarded within our local community. Your contribution will be a part of an effort that is doing great things not just for artists but for the local community and young student artists.
  • We need you! Your contribution matters because it takes people like you to make great things happen. WoCA would not exist without the help of supporters, so without you we can not continue to do our work in the community.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are not able to contribute to our campaign there are still so many ways you can help our effort:

  • Spread the word about our campaign through social media! Use the share features to spread the word about our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and email.
  • Join our + More Campaign fundraising team and help us raise our goal! We have cool perks available for team members. Email us at: info@wocaprojects.com if you are interested in joining the team!
  • Volunteer to help with exhibitions and programs. We can always use a hand hanging artwork or setting up events.
  • There are so many other ways to help its almost too much to list...simply send us a line (info@wocaprojects.com) if you would like to help!
story_txt:
ATTENTION SUPPORTERS!!!The + More WoCA in 2014 Campaign is participating campaign in Indiegogo's #GivingTuesday on Tuesday, December 3rd, 2013. Here's how it works: For every $20 raised through our campaign on Tuesday, December 3rd only, Indiegogo will match $1! So please support us on #GivingTuesday as we promote +More WoCA in 2014! Thanks in advance for your support!Short SummarySince WoCA Projects opened in February 2013, we have had a very successful run of exhibitions and programming. Our mission was to highlight the contemporary art by women artists of color and artists of diverse backgrounds through exhibitions and community arts programming. Our initial goal was to have at least 4 exhibitions this year, and we accomplished that and then some while nearly 2 months shy of our 1 year anniversary! Here are some key accomplishments that we've made within our first year:
featured over emerging and established 30 artists through both solo, group, and juried exhibitions.
featured a total of approximately 10 exhibitions (solo, group, and juried) with accompanying opening receptions and event programming.
partnered with local youth arts academy to feature over 100+ student works.
started a monthly "Afternoon Teas @ WoCA" event series, featuring women leaders in the arts.
advocated and promoted the works of featured artists to area collectors, curators, and institutions.
created positive visibility and exposure for our featured artists and local arts community!
+ MORE WoCA in 2014 We have big plans for 2014 and as we enter our second year of exhibitions and programming we are ready to kick things up a notch! The + More Campaign is all about vision casting and helping us to continue our mission to highlight contemporary art by women artists of color and diverse artists of all backgrounds. We have more exhibitions and programming that we'd like to offer and more artists, creative entrepreneurs, arts leaders, and arts educators both locally and nationally that we'd like to bring in to support our local arts community. Here is what your contribution will do:

Our goal is to raise $15,000, which will cover our operational and programming costs for the year.
