story:
Hello Indiegogo World!

I'm Samuel Scharf, an 8 year resident and artist of Washington, D.C.  I've recently graduated from American University with my MFA in sculpture.  Also, I'm a co-founder the artspace Delicious Spectacle in our neighborhood of Columbia Heights, D.C.  In June of 2013 I will be exhibiting my first solo show at CulturalDC's Flashpoint Gallery in chinatown.  I work as an arthandler/contractor to support my art practice, usually I would never be able to ask for funds, it's just not in my nature.  That now being said, I NEED YOUR HELP ;) 

This campaign is to fund transportation of a work title Autocratic Democracy from my studio in D.C. to Narrows Center for the Arts in Fall River, MA.  The exhibition is entitled PETROLEUM PARADOX: FOR BETTER OR FOR WORSE?  Initially the work was included in an exhibition catalog and was fully realized by the hard work of the Woman Caucus for Arts  and Narrows Center for the Arts into the exhibition from APR 06, 2013 - MAY 18, 2013 Reception: APR 14 at 1 PM!

With your help I can make sure the work, rather heavy and unshippable in any other way, gets to the exhibition safely.  As well, Katherine Sifers whom is a fulltime professor and also in the exhibition will have a print go up on the ride with me.  I will drive up March 30th to drop off the work and drive back that Sunday the 31st.  As well, the funds will help with the deinstallation and picking up of the work after the May 18th.  Over the years I have accured intense ammounts of debt for my artwork and currently am working to find new ways to fund the travel of my artworks.  You will make that possible and fully realize the life of this piece.  I have been honorned to be in the show and strive to live my life without money making decision for me, especially for life of my artwork.  This is my first go around with indiegogo and I'm excited to have your support!  Thank You!

The Cost

Two full day rental 3/30-3/31: $229.00

gas: 1tank up, 1tank back, 1tank full on return ($60 each): $180

Tolls from D.C. to Fall River, MA ($30 each way): $60

Cheap Hotel room: $80 total

Grand Total for trip 1 installation:

$520.00

The work of D.C. artists Samuel Scharf and Katherine Sifers gets to the exhibition in Mass safe and sound with your support.  A bonus of over funding will be the trip up to the opening on the 14th for the opening, ie ($200 rental that weekend).  We will post images and when I attend the opening, I've made a facebook page for this process and will aggresively update with images of the trip, costs and the final exhibition shots...

The Impact

I never ask for help, my friends will attest to that, sometimes to my demise.  This project is important for my future in realizing that to continue on my path as a large scale installation artist, I will have to have help.  The impact of this donation is not only mentally helping me ask when needed but to extend as an example that making /showing art is a community based event.  This work will reach its destination because of your contribution, D.C. will be represented in a major art exhibition with legit artists whom live near by.  Unfortunately, my sculpture includes buckets of cement, the oil is a 1/8 layer (inside scoop :) BUT fortunately I have dear friends to help me see this through.  With your help, my art does not have limits and can be seen outside of its financial boarders and regionality.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute with money, please contribute with word of mouth and promotional support.  Feel free to email me @ samscharfextra@gmail.com!

!Please use the share tabs provided via Indiegogo and share via FB and Twitter!

story:
Why Should I Fund Deez's Birthday Extravaganza?

Deez is not only an awesome person who strives his hardest to provide joy and happiness to everyone he possibly can, he is also extremely selfless and giving.  Here are some examples of some of the philanthropic activities Deez has contributed to society:

  • He has donated to charities.
  • He has volunteered at Animal Shelters.
  • He has done Americorps work and staffed several teen-focused substance abuse prevention projects.

Long story short, Deez is a nice guy who is waiting for karma to come back around and deserves to have a positively memorable birthday!

What Does Deez Need & What Do I Get?

Here's how it's going down.  All the money that is donated towards this project is dedicated to my birthday celebration, whether I meet the goal or not.  The total goal is what I need for:

  • Air fare to and lodging in Cincinnati: nothing fancy, flying coach and Holiday Inn.
  • The VIP package for the SuicideGirls Blackheart Burlesque show.
  • Cab fare and very basic food necessities.
But Deez, what happens if you don't hit your goal by the deadline (a week before Deez's b-day)?  Let me tell you!  If I do not hit that goal all funds will go towards:

  • The VIP Package for the SuicideGirls Blackheart Burlesque show within closest driving distance.
  • Food, gas and lodging for the event.
  • Extra special treats for donors if I receive more than I need!
Okay, Deez, I know what you get out of this: an awesome fucking birthday.  What do I, as a donor, get out of making a donation to this cause?  It's a good thing you asked!  Anyone who donates towards this cause will get a free pass to a special passworded bath show that I will do from my hotel room after the Burlesque Show.  Other awesome donation perks are offered by donation price.

How Will This Impact Deez's Life?

At risk of sounding like a pity-party, let me explain why this birthday extravaganza would deeply enrich Deez's life:

  • Deez has never seen a Burlesque show in his life and is very eager to experience this first-hand for the first time.
  • Deez works from home, lives alone in the middle of nowhere and is starving for real-life social interaction.
  • Deez's family hasn't really celebrated birthdays in about 10 years; if he doesn't go to the show he will either be on cam or at home alone.
  • Deez has never had a truly, positively memorable birthday experience in all of the almost 27 years of his life.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute monetarily, that doesn't necessarily mean you can't help good ol' Deez out.  Here are some other ways to help Deez:

  • Spread the word about Deez's Burlesque B-Day to people that you think could and would contribute monetarily.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word through Twitter, Tumblr, etc.

story:
PROJECT

The Book of Beings is a collection of poems and illustrations that tell a story of Cohesive Cohabitation, Sustainable Living and Conservation

From the Art Book, Book of Beings, grew a grassroots native plant restoration project that I hope spreads and seeds itself around the world. It is a sustainable, inspiring, and empowering effort to make a simple yet bold action to preserve woodlands, restore native habitats, and adopt sustainable agricultural practices. 

The Book of Beings Seed Project is about connecting No GMO, Chemical Free, Heirloom seeds with those who want to grow them. Any way to spread native seeds to their homelands is the right way and no effort is too small.  

 The movement is to link seed sponsors with farms, gardens, youth and conservation groups as well as any individual who cares to make a change.

ALL DONATIONS will be used for further fund raising efforts with a focus on Sustainable Agriculture and Woodland Preservation as well as educating and inspiring our future Stewards of the Earth. 

Thank you for your time and interest and in advance for any contributions , big or small .

Maria Carufe

is

Luna Soffio


FUNDING

Funding is for awareness and action for Sustainable Agriculture and Woodland Preservation.

story:
We Need Your Help!

We are a small art/animation studio (Jazza Studios) and also a YouTube channel, (Draw With Jazza). For any of you that know Jazza you all understand the type of guy he is, incredibly genuine, self depreciating, hopeful, positive and full of creativity (he didn't write this, by the way, Mrs Jazza did). He hopes that through the channel he communicates his message 'Art is an Adventure Playground for Everyone' and if you were to ask him he would 100% say that all he wants is to encourage and support others in their art. 

It is hard to keep a small art setup going, keep delivering free content and compete with large studios, production companies and networks, with their money and equipment. We need help to stay current and deliver ambitious content - We need a better space to film in. Because we are small and with the matching small financial resources (but we try and think big), we are looking at our Garden Shed, only at the moment it has holes in and it is a rusty wreck. We need to plug the holes and to turn it in to a great studio space, for all of us! Thank you so much for reading and for checking out our 'perks'! Any help you give is so much appreciated and will keep us delivering free stuff, online.

For more information regarding the details of the perks, please refer to the information page we set up which explains what each perk includes, in much greater and very specific detail.

 

What We Need: The Studio
What You Get: Sweet Perks and Epic Content!

We do not need anything flash, just a safe, dry space to make stuff, for you! We hope to have a dry (non leaky and non Floody) safe (properly reinforced and wired) medium size room with a lino floor (For art challenges, to wipe off paint), and a toilet (for Jazza Poo's, so he can stay in there longer, but he won't film the poos... I hope).

 

The Shed Transformation Plan:

 

 

The shed is currently in very poor condition. Jazza tried to build himself a studio room in it but it has already flooded twice (see video) and frankly, isn't safe by a long shot. The roof has holes in it and is falling off, the gutters have the bottoms rusted out, and the surrounding concrete runs water directly into the shed! Jazza tried to waterproof his room, which only meant the water ran in and didn't leave (it sat in the room like a bowl). The electrics are not properly done (run on a cable over from the house) so to be safe they need to be put in a proper underground conduit. You will possibly have seen that Jazza picks up the tools when he can to try and get things done as cheaply as possible for the channel, but this scope of work is beyond him and we have to get some professional help.

We looked in to renting space for Jazza to make video content, but that would cost approximately $20,000 per year, ongoing - and that's not taking into account the additional costs for internet, electricity etc. so that is not possible for us. Instead the best way we can see to get a filming spot would be to fix the shed and we hoped that would be economical. The quotes came in a little higher than expected, but still at least we could sustain it as it is cheaper than renting year after year.

 

The Costs: 

 *Please Note: Costs shown are in Australian Dollars (AUD), however the total has been converted to USD for the campaign goal, as most of our audience reside in the US.

Shed Repairs: drainage, roof, rotted wood, internal plastering $15,583.00

Tin walls replaced with cladding: $8,337.00

Electricity repairs to make safe: $1,500.00

Toilet installation estimate: $1,900.00

Flooring- vinyl planks: $1,650.00

Campaign Fee's (IndieGoGo + Paypal and credit card fees) 10%:  $2,897.00 

TOTAL $31,867 AUD

We are only fundraising for the basic repairs to make it safe and dry. We have saved enough money to cover the fixtures, fittings, painting, and necessary equipment to make the room into a studio - our costs come to $18,983.99, so we are most definitely contributing ourselves too! If we do not reach our goal we will aim to remortgage our home to raise the gap in funds. If by some miracle we exceed our funding goal, the excess will go into helping us cover these expenses.

 

What your support of Draw With Jazza Means to Us: 

It is hard for independent video producers to keep up with large studios. They have the equipment, and they have the money and they command high prices for what they do. It is especially hard if you are a small family from a country town in Australia, with the big local power station closing down unemployment is high and funds are low. We know we can't create a professional level studio, but we believe (with hard work) we can get damn close - in our garden shed - and keep delivering you free content, even improving on the quality and variety.

Your support will strengthen a community with which people from all over the world participate and discover passion and excitement - a community that is positive, supportive, fun and educational. Subscribers have contacted us from the middle of war zones, or with depression, with serious illness and with bullying, and have expressed that they found something here that is worthwhile and has helped them overcome or deal with the difficulties they face. These are people Jazza has reached out to (digitally) from a country town in Australia, without even realising he has managed to help people and this has touched him deeply on many occasions. We believe strongly that art, education, and a welcoming community are for everyone. 

To keep sustainable and keep providing content for free, we have to keep up with worldwide changes in technology and innovation - your support will help us keep making a difference and keep Draw With Jazza going, and growing!

 

Risks & Challenges:

We know there will be challenges along the way, but we have a good and very reasonable builder on board. We got many quotes and did our research. We are confident that with his help and Jazza's mad handyman skills, we will be OK! You may see the return of 'HANDYMAN JAZZA!' that some of you might have seen in the vlogs. We are not afraid of hard work- Here's proof!

https://youtu.be/BApD8IS1zJY

https://youtu.be/QTDPy75BPj0

https://youtu.be/P7dmv0_ZNPE

Jazza already has so many ideas for things he can produce in a repaired and larger space! These include larger scale paintings on canvas and rolls of paper, life size sculpture and modelling projects, and something he is very excited to explore - Mixed Reality - where he can green-screen composite himself INTO Virtual Reality art programs and make VR art in the most engaging and exciting way possible!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to contribute but don't have the money for a perk, even a few dollars is a help - it will buy us some sand paper or something! You can also share this fundraiser on your social pages, with friends or classes, to get the word out in support of our small indie outfit! 

Make sure to keep watching the channel, the vlog, like, share, leave a positive comment to help us along the way! Follow the journey, join our 'paint party' etc. We love, appreciate and thank all of you. You make it all possible.

 

The Perks:

We've thought and planned, long and hard, to create a set of perks we believe will be valuable and special to our donors. These include Signed Prints (which we have never done, and don't have plans on doing in the future), Video Calls with Jazza one on one (or with your class/club) to learn, talk or shoot the breeze, Video Collaboration with Jazza where he will work with you to create original content on his channel and thank you for your support - and yes, he is even, for the first time ever, selling his Original Artworks - he is extremely sentimental about and attached to his artwork, but he is willing to do it because a) he knows they will go to loving homes, and b) our goals and dreams for the future of the channel mean so much to him.

You can see a list of the available artworks/prints below - he set up a web page with all of the artworks displayed individually, and we have also set up a separate web page with all of the details of the perks and how they will be divvied out and distributed.
story_txt:
We Need Your Help!
We are a small art/animation studio (Jazza Studios) and also a YouTube channel, (Draw With Jazza). For any of you that know Jazza you all understand the type of guy he is, incredibly genuine, self depreciating, hopeful, positive and full of creativity (he didn't write this, by the way, Mrs Jazza did). He hopes that through the channel he communicates his message 'Art is an Adventure Playground for Everyone' and if you were to ask him he would 100% say that all he wants is to encourage and support others in their art. 
It is hard to keep a small art setup going, keep delivering free content and compete with large studios, production companies and networks, with their money and equipment. We need help to stay current and deliver ambitious content - We need a better space to film in. Because we are small and with the matching small financial resources (but we try and think big), we are looking at our Garden Shed, only at the moment it has holes in and it is a rusty wreck. We need to plug the holes and to turn it in to a great studio space, for all of us! Thank you so much for reading and for checking out our 'perks'! Any help you give is so much appreciated and will keep us delivering free stuff, online.
For more information regarding the details of the perks, please refer to the information page we set up which explains what each perk includes, in much greater and very specific detail.
 

What We Need: The StudioWhat You Get: Sweet Perks and Epic Content!

We do not need anything flash, just a safe, dry space to make stuff, for you! We hope to have a dry (non leaky and non Floody) safe (properly reinforced and wired) medium size room with a lino floor (For art challenges, to wipe off paint), and a toilet (for Jazza Poo's, so he can stay in there longer, but he won't film the poos... I hope).
 
The Shed Transformation Plan:  
The shed is currently in very poor condition. Jazza tried to build himself a studio room in it but it has already flooded twice (see video) and frankly, isn't safe by a long shot. The roof has holes in it and is falling off, the gutters have the bottoms rusted out, and the surrounding concrete runs water directly into the shed! Jazza tried to waterproof his room, which only meant the water ran in and didn't leave (it sat in the room like a bowl). The electrics are not properly done (run on a cable over from the house) so to be safe they need to be put in a proper underground conduit. You will possibly have seen that Jazza picks up the tools when he can to try and get things done as cheaply as possible for the channel, but this scope of work is beyond him and we have to get some professional help.

We looked in to renting space for Jazza to make video content, but that would cost approximately $20,000 per year, ongoing - and that's not taking into account the additional costs for internet, electricity etc. so that is not possible for us. Instead the best way we can see to get a filming spot would be to fix the shed and we hoped that would be economical. The quotes came in a little higher than expected, but still at least we could sustain it as it is cheaper than renting year after year.
 
The Costs: 
 *Please Note: Costs shown are in Australian Dollars (AUD), however the total has been converted to USD for the campaign goal, as most of our audience reside in the US.
Shed Repairs: drainage, roof, rotted wood, internal plastering $15,583.00
Tin walls replaced with cladding: $8,337.00
Electricity repairs to make safe: $1,500.00
Toilet installation estimate: $1,900.00
Flooring- vinyl planks: $1,650.00
Campaign Fee's (IndieGoGo + Paypal and credit card fees) 10%:  $2,897.00 
TOTAL $31,867 AUD
We are only fundraising for the basic repairs to make it safe and dry. We have saved enough money to cover the fixtures, fittings, painting, and necessary equipment to make the room into a studio - our costs come to $18,983.99, so we are most definitely contributing ourselves too! If we do not reach our goal we will aim to remortgage our home to raise the gap in funds. If by some miracle we exceed our funding goal, the excess will go into helping us cover these expenses.
 

What your support of Draw With Jazza Means to Us: 
It is hard for independent video producers to keep up with large studios. They have the equipment, and they have the money and they command high prices for what they do. It is especially hard if you are a small family from a country town in Australia, with the big local power station closing down unemployment is high and funds are low. We know we can't create a professional level studio, but we believe (with hard work) we can get damn close - in our garden shed - and keep delivering you free content, even improving on the quality and variety.
Your support will strengthen a community with which people from all over the world participate and discover passion and excitement - a community that is positive, supportive, fun and educational. Subscribers have contacted us from the middle of war zones, or with depression, with serious illness and with bullying, and have expressed that they found something here that is worthwhile and has helped them overcome or deal with the difficulties they face. These are people Jazza has reached out to (digitally) from a country town in Australia, without even realising he has managed to help people and this has touched him deeply on many occasions. We believe strongly that art, education, and a welcoming community are for everyone. 
To keep sustainable and keep providing content for free, we have to keep up with worldwide changes in technology and innovation - your support will help us keep making a difference and keep Draw With Jazza going, and growing!
 

Risks & Challenges:
We know there will be challenges along the way, but we have a good and very reasonable builder on board. We got many quotes and did our research. We are confident that with his help and Jazza's mad handyman skills, we will be OK! You may see the return of 'HANDYMAN JAZZA!' that some of you might have seen in the vlogs. We are not afraid of hard work- Here's proof!
https://youtu.be/BApD8IS1zJY
https://youtu.be/QTDPy75BPj0
https://youtu.be/P7dmv0_ZNPE
Jazza already has so many ideas for things he can produce in a repaired and larger space! These include larger scale paintings on canvas and rolls of paper, life size sculpture and modelling projects, and something he is very excited to explore - Mixed Reality - where he can green-screen composite himself INTO Virtual Reality art programs and make VR art in the most engaging and exciting way possible!
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you want to contribute but don't have the money for a perk, even a few dollars is a help - it will buy us some sand paper or something! You can also share this fundraiser on your social pages, with friends or classes, to get the word out in support of our small indie outfit! 
Make sure to keep watching the channel, the vlog, like, share, leave a positive comment to help us along the way! Follow the journey, join our 'paint party' etc. We love, appreciate and thank all of you. You make it all possible.
 
The Perks:
We've thought and planned, long and hard, to create a set of perks we believe will be valuable and special to our donors. These include Signed Prints (which we have never done, and don't have plans on doing in the future), Video Calls with Jazza one on one (or with your class/club) to learn, talk or shoot the breeze, Video Collaboration with Jazza where he will work with you to create original content on his channel and thank you for your support - and yes, he is even, for the first time ever, selling his Original Artworks - he is extremely sentimental about and attached to his artwork, but he is willing to do it because a) he knows they will go to loving homes, and b) our goals and dreams for the future of the channel mean so much to him.
You can see a list of the available artworks/prints below - he set up a web page with all of the artworks displayed individually, and we have also set up a separate web page with all of the details of the perks and how they will be divvied out and distributed.

story:
Hull52 is a collaborative playing card art project showcasing the diversity of the Hull creative landscape. An assortment of 52 different styles and mediums all produced by 52 local artistic talent.

The previous deck stood as a testament to the diversity of styles, mediums and creativity of the city's artists. We now aim to enable to 2020 designs to reach the same heights as its predecessor. 

This edition, we’ve pushed an even bigger effort to push the artists we’re associated with, be it by social media features, or full artist interviews, our efforts….
 

With this artistic project we have decided to donate 100% of profits towards Hull’s creative community, both visual artists and Hull’s struggling music industry following Covid. 

 

It's been amazing to of been part of a project that has been taken on board by so many. We're grateful to our printing and paper partners for getting the costs so low, and the only thing that stands in the way between now and us all holding a finished deck in our hands is your willingness to back the project. 

 

View the entire deck below 

 

 

We now seek funding for the deck to become a finalised physical product and have come to Indegogo in hopes that the same community ambition that designed the deck can go forth into its printing.

What We Need & What You Get

Just deciding to purchase your deck via this campaign will help beyond belief. As soon as we reach our goal your deck will be produced and sent to your door, but we have bigger rewards. Ad cards to be filled

 

Thanks for reading about the project, we really hope we have you on board. Even a simple share can make all the difference to a campaign like this. 

 

Thank you

Adam, Jessy, and the Hull52

story:
OMG PROJECT SUMMARY

VICTORIA VESNA has been commissioned to be one of the keynote artists for this year’s Glow Art event in Santa Monica, California, which takes place on 28 September 2013. Together with her wonderful team, she is developing the Octopus Mandala Glow project for the famous Pacific Wheel— the only solar-powered wheel in the world!

"This work is particularly important for me as it has the potential of connecting public art, social networks and ready-made aesthetics in significant ways. OMG is a celebration of the end of the dominion of the machine, which invites people to occupy their ferris wheels around the world and record themselves at the top of the wheel chanting OM. The recorded voices will comprise a global chorus.
This collective chorus of voices will be played on the beach and streamed online. OMG in Santa Monica is only the premiere project with a goal of launching a series of projects with ferris wheels as mandalas around the world.
OMG is an attempt to create a collective mandala utilizing the ferris wheel.  It a ready made machine inspired in part by Duchamp’s bicycle wheel, and part by the Octopus and the NanoMandala project that I worked on together with a nanoscientist and tibetan monks. That sand mandala (chakrasamvara) created by the tibetan monks was thrown back into the ocean at the same Santa Monica beach!
The magic number of this project is eight— 8 spokes of a buddhist wheel, 8-bit LED system of the Pacific Wheel, octogonal gondolas, 8 legs of the octopus, and 8 of us in the core team."YOUR HELP will not only make this global project possible, but will also have you directly participating in the launch of an idea into fruition. You will be helping us create a worldwide interactive experience, complete with handmade ceremonial objects, and an artist book documenting the process.

 GLOW art event in Santa Monica, California on 28 September 2013 will attract about 200,000 people on site, and many more online. People are invited to participate with their videos/voices from wheels they occupy solo or in groups all over the world!

➤ FOR MORE INFO, VISIT HTTP://OCTOPUSMANDALA.COM

 WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

The keynote artist commission is already half spent in developing the prototypes, graphic designs, testing lighting sequences and launching the website. The team that came together is incredibly talented and they have been working for minimum funds and maximum enthusiasm. Your help will make this unique public art event happen in a most magnificent way— extending out to the online community, creating octopus ceremonial suits and hats that are works of art projecting onto the ocean! 

This project has been in development since September 2012, and the inspiring process has been well documented. Extensive research has been made about the history of ferris wheels in parallel to discovering more and more about mandalas in buddhism and western mysticism, along with the amazing scientific findings about the octopus from evolutionary biologists and neuroscientists.

Your contributions will not only help us achieve a spectacular event— you will also receive a token of our appreciation, which in turn will give you a glimpse into the depths of OMG, or even give you a once in a lifetime chance to be an integral part of the performance event! The Artist's Notebook (one of the premiums we are offering), now in development, will provide our benefactors with a glimpse into the technological aspects of the interactive works we are creating, sharing every detail of what is involved in our process.


We may have enough to do the bare minimum, but ONLY YOU can make these happen:

• Sponsor Tibetan Monks to chant on the wheel.

• Sponsor other artists to participate from remote wheels around the globe.

• Develop an app for Iphone and Android.

• Design and print an artist book that describes the process and shares research on the mandalas, octopuses and other art / science aspects of this piece.

• Rent a high resolution projector for the event and project people inside the wheel onto the ocean.

• Buy audio equipment to record and distribute the voices around the beach during the event (to be uploaded to the website thereafter).

• Buy wireless equipment for the gondolas to communicate with the people on the wheel and stream live on the web.

• Design, silk-screen, print and distribute the t-shirts and posters.

• Give honorarium to the team that is working for minimal funds and maximum enthusiasm.

 

THE IMPACT

Public Art Events such as Octopus Mandala Glow (OMG) are a way of sharing and celebrating our humanity, building a global community and having fun and experiencing joy together.

The GLOW Festival is a public art event and OMG is one of the featured exhibits. We hope to use OMG as a prototype of a fun public art event and we are making plans to utilize Ferris Wheels all over the planet as a cohesive and symbolic theme of celebrating of the end of the dominion of the machine.

OCCUPY YOUR LOCAL FERRIS WHEEL and spread joy on the planet!

Victoria Vesna has a track record of proven success both in her artistic creations, and as the Director of the UCLA ArtSci Center + Laboratory. Her producing partner, Ray Zimmerman, is a 30 year veteran of the Hollywood film industry, and is a passionate believer in OMG. Read more our dedicated team of talented artists, scientists and young professionals on our website: http://octopusmandala.com

Victoria, Ray, and our passionate team ask you to HELP US MAXIMIZE our OMG event at the Glow Festival this year and launch a new take on the OCCUPY movement— one aimed at a joyful celebration of humanity!

 

WHAT IF WE DON'T REACH THE GOAL?

We will send a message to everyone who helped out with the exact accounting of what we have and where it will be spent.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

GET THE WORD OUT. If you are not able to contribute financially, please help us get the word out to at least 8 people about our OMG campaign. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

OCCUPY YOUR FERRIS WHEEL. We aspire to make Octopus Mandala Glow a global event, and with your help this can definitely happen! Take the initiative to gather your friends, family, social networks— and create an energetic community to occupy your own local ferris wheel. If you're interested in making this happen, we will send you a kit with a guide and some tools to help you occupy your wheel.

For more details, visit http://octopusmandala.com/mandala-map. OMG!

story:
Limited run of Kalashnikov I.D. Card patches

We screwed up when we shipped out the 600+ AK47 I.D.cards and ran out of the 1,000 patches we ordered for the last few decks that went out.. 

SO, we need to re-order more to replace those. And since it is not cheap to buy a small quantity, we will do a limited run of patches for all those who missed out or want to participate in the AK47 projects again !!

  • A limited number of the same patches as the AK47 I.D. Cards will be made
  • Only 100 of the new unique patch will be made


Just 15 days - All or Nothing

This will be a quick campaign, (Just 15 days) please share it with anyone who might be interested 

This campaign is going to be an "All or Nothing" since there is no way to buy a smaller increment of patches than the minimum orders we have set up

We can always order more, so if these patches are in demand, there will be enough made to ensure plenty for all 

The Patches

We will do 2 designs this time around:

  • a limited run for those who missed out of the original AK Card patches
  • a new design with the colors swapped out (reversed)


Perks

Each perk will ship for FREE (in the U.S.A.)
with low cost international shipping options

  • The New AK Deck Patch w/ Sticker
  • The 'Original' AK Deck patch  w/ Sticker
  • Just the Stickers (both of em)
  • Both AK Deck Patches w/ Stickers
  • Two of each AK Deck patches w/ Stickers
  • Both AK Deck Patches & Set of 3 'Spam Can' Patches w/ Stickers
  • Both AK Deck Patches & AK47 I.D. Deck
** You CAN grab more than one perk if you would like !!! **

Risks & Challenges

With over a dozen successful campaigns, we look forward to another 

  • This one will be "All or Nothing" so no one is at risk 
  • Since this is a re-order of an existing design, we are as certain as can be the patches will look as good as the 1st run

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Please share on Facebook
  • Please share on Instagram
  • Please share on the You Tubes 

Thank you all for your continued support of our projects

story:
Once Upon a Dyke

Tales from Inside (and Outside) the Closet

By Erin Hensley

 

After the success of Erin Hensley's freshman memoir "Naked in the Closet" she released there was so much left unsaid about her life. In her sophomore writing Once Upon a Dyke: Tales from Inside (and Outside) the Closet, Hensley comes back with a voice unlike her debut. This book encompasses more tales from her life such as nudist colonies, wooden legs, and even spider friends. Each memory that she shares with the reader is told in a fairy tale fashion including the moral to the story.

Hensley dives deeper into her past and has collected the most unique, heartwarming, and sometimes heartbreaking tales that have sculpted her into who she is today.

This is a modern fairy tale based on real life told by a woman who is still a child at heart. Hensley delivers a collection unlike anything else. She discusses her "pride", she talks about Mickey Mouse, her stutter, and so much more in these pages that she has decided to share with the world.

In addition to laying her life out in black and white, Hensley has included illustrations in this book.

story:
WHO ARE WE?

We are SPICY: a creative collective led by women of color and queer/trans people of color working at the intersection of art, activism, and publishing. Launched in February 2018, we've published over 60 articles, held over a dozen events, and most importantly we’ve disrupted the white-dominated media landscape.

We’re approaching our one-year anniversary, and we’re currently in the process of creating our first print zine. It will include essays, op-eds, and art that deconstructs the colonialist ideals that we've been taught. We hope that this project will confront what it means to “unlearn,” and prepare us for the possibility of “reimagining”.

WHY DO WE NEED FUNDING?

Everything that we do is a labor of love. We’re entirely self-funded, and many of our events and publishing costs come out of our own pockets. The money we raise will help us print our first zine (and future ones!), plan upcoming events, and maintain the platform we've built for our community.

WHAT IS OUR IMPACT?

In the past year, our work has transformed into an entire community-based effort. We would be nothing without all the relationships we've built with like-minded creatives, and we want to continue providing a platform for people to connect, grow, and learn from each other.

We've provided an online platform for WoC and QTPoC to connect, share, and publish their work. We believe in healing through storytelling - and holding space for that transformative work, and those moments of growth and reflection, are the reason why we continue doing what we do.

We also believe that it's important to hold spaces in real life for our community to have fun, while making sure our events are all safe and inclusive environments (#POCTOTHEFRONT). We hosted panels, an open mic, a clothing swap, and a bunch of parties in 2018, and this year we want to do even more. With your help, we can.

WHAT IF WE DON'T RECEIVE FUNDING?

Without funding, we won't be able to:

  • Continue documenting our stories online. Some of us lack connection to our own ancestry and this work of archiving our voices is extremely necessary and close to our hearts. SPICY isn't only for us, but for generations to come.
  • Create the IRL experiences our community deserves. This year we held open mics, panels, parties, markets, clothing swaps and more - but this year we want to do EVEN MORE.
  • Fund our print publications. We’ve always archived our work online, but we want to be able to share physical copies of our art and hearts with you all, and by you all. This has always been our goal, and with your support and creativity we can continue making it a reality.

HEAR IT FOR YOURSELF:

"SPICY has provided a platform in which I can create, experiment and grow as an artist. For example I was able to flesh out a concept that I’d been thinking about for a long time and SPICY helped create a space for me to do that comfortably and for a community that could actually relate to my work. I’d love to be able to continue to do this." - Nikki "Snikka" Freyermuth, Photographer/Visual Content Producer

"When I came to our first meeting back in 2017, I had a vague idea of how I wanted to share my art and create with others. I never could have anticipated SPICY becoming the space that it is today. The idea of being an artist is something that can feel incredibly nebulous and intimidating for many—including myself. But SPICY has become a space to explore how artistry can manifest in each of us, and how we can connect to each other and our communities at large through it." - Ally Zhao, Visual Content Producer

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

If you can't donate, it doesn't mean you can't help. You can:

  • Get the word out about SPICY's fundraiser!
  • Follow us on social media!
  • Visit our website, and sign up for our newsletter!
  • Submit your creative work to our online zine!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:
If you can't donate, it doesn't mean you can't help. You can:

Follow us on social media!
Visit our website, and sign up for our newsletter!

Submit your creative work to our online zine!

story:
WHAT WE ARE DOING

Activism and non-profit arts programs!  We are raising funds to bring arts programs to the local children and community with direct access to industry leaders.

We are a husband and wife team, Chris G. Robinson and myself (Abra Chouinard), and we purchased the local theater in my hometown to open it up for the children and community.  I am a director/producer of independent films and Chris is an art director in the gaming industry.  We met in art school in Seattle 15 years ago and have been making art and working in the industry every since.  This campaign is about getting funds to purchase a digital projection system and retractable screen which will allow us to bring arts to the local community.  A digital projection system will allow access to movies and other digital content as the closest movie theater is 80 miles round trip.  Most local families can’t afford to make this journey.  A retractable movie screen will allow access to the original stage that has been blocked by a static movie screen since the mid 1930's to be opened up and used for plays, performances and more.  This campaign is important because it will give the children and community access to arts programs and industry professionals.  Chris has extensive plans to teach art classes for the kids and help them develop and perform original plays which we will broadcast live worldwide.  I have detailed plans to teach film classes, digital media and online broadcasting classes.  In addition to these plans, we are already actively providing service to the community by donating popcorn to the senior center and hosting the annual free holiday movie for local children and families.  We are building a court-yard garden on our back lot to grow food to donate to the local food bank.  To help our schools, a portion of each movie ticket sold will be donated to the art classrooms.  Your contributions will help the local children and community by making it possible to access movies, create plays, film and broadcasting and learn side-by-side with industry professionals.  Your immediate support will have a lasting impact on our incredible and deserving community!  This means so much and we want to thank you for taking the time to review this campaign!  

History of Town:  Bonners Ferry Idaho was founded in the late 1800's and located minutes from Canada and Montana, built along the Kootenai River, was a town supported by logging and mining and now a new revival with the arts community, brewing company and the Rex Theater!

History of Theater:  The Rex Theater is the only theater in the county to date.  It replaced the wild west style Amazon Theater in 1923 and stands as the only theater since people started homesteading the land in the 1800’s. The popcorn machine is an original vintage C. Cretors & Co. and still works beautifully.  People say it is some of the best popcorn they have ever tasted!

CONTRIBUTIONS

We need to raise $123,000 in funds which is the purchase price of the digital projection system and retractable screen.  We want to be very transparent and will be posting the purchase receipts for all of our backers to see.

Funds will be earmarked for the digital projection system and retractable screen even if we do not reach our full funding goal.  Hopefully we will meet our goal and in the event we go over our funding goal, we will use the funds for: the new roof, new furnace, green room, arts classrooms, carpet, supplies, and much much more! And we will post all of the purchase receipts for our backers to see along with progress updates and photos! 

PERKS

We have some really amazing perks!  We are also INCLUDING with every PERK, an invite to the RED CARPET GRAND OPENING EVENT & PARTY!  We will announce the event information on our Facebook page (Rex Theater of Bonners Ferry) after we have completed the installation of the digital system. (Travel not included.)  Everyone will receive credit on the "Wall of Fame" on the Rex Theater website and Facebook page.

OTHER WAYS TO SUPPORT

If you are not able to contribute monetarily, there are many other ways you can help support!  Getting the word around, helping us make some noise and bring awareness to our campaign and being a brand ambassador for the arts for local children and communities.  IndieGoGo has some great ‘share tools’ and remember to Like Us on Facebook (Rex Theater of Bonners Ferry)!


*TICKETS - Tickets can be redeemed for movies, plays, bands and other community events held at the Rex Theater.  Tickets can also be redeemed for online broadcasts of plays, performances and other events.

story:
A Unique and Exciting 100 Day Creative Challenge


Watch as 37,000 vintage beads transform into 100 limited edition bracelets.

 

Inspired by the healing process of intense daily creative work, this project is far more than making beautiful bracelets, it is about creating beauty and healing. It is about finding serenity and hope in the process of creation. And for the women who ultimately wear them it is not just about fashion or adornment, but an acknowledgement of the value of one-of-a-kind art pieces.

 

I have been saving beads for nearly 15 years for a project of this magnitude. This limited edition series of wearable art bracelets is the culmination of my design in this format and I will not continue to make these for my galleries. Each bracelet is being documented for a retrospective book of my designs.

 

How You Can Help


Although I have most of the supplies on hand, I asking for your support to be able to obtain the bracelet blanks, beads and over 12,000 headpins that will be used to finish this project. I have a great lead on these supplies, but they must be purchased in bulk quantity. This 100 day challenge, created in partnership with your sponsorship and pre-sale of the bracelets, can become your amazing creative journey too!

 

Goodies and a Big Thank You!

Of course I have all manner of goodies as a thank you for sponsorship, including the opportunity to buy wearable art bracelets at a deeply discounted price. The prices currently shown in my Etsy store are the wholesale prices meant for sponsors of my project, and that price will change when the project is completed.

 

If my funding goal is not reached I will continue to make the bracelets until I have exhausted all my supplies and complete all sponsorship requirements for those who's pledges were received. All perks will be shipped at completion of project with the exception of the bracelet purchase perks, which can be shipped out immediately if paid by Paypal. In time for the PERFECT Christmas gift!

 

The Artist

My name is Laura Lampe, and after 25 years of successful jewelry and product design I have started a new creative chapter in my life. My work has been featured in more than 5,000 museum shops and gift galleries internationally, including the Women's Museum of Art in Washington D.C., the Seattle Art Museum, and Frida Kahlo's Blue House Museum. I find it is time for me to focus on one of a kind jewelry and paintings and this project is the natural outgrowth of that desire.

 

Building things with my hands was passed to me by from my Grandmother. Some of my earliest memories involve watching her make small objects to be used as charms and talisman for people with problems in life. She fostered early on in me to always keep creating, that this was a magical ability.

 

As I work I find myself putting a lot of positive energy and good wishes into each bracelet, for the fun and happiness of the wearer. I want to give my supporters the chance to own a truly remarkable never to be replicated art piece recycled from the amazing beauty of vintage cut crystal, lampworked, and all manner of colored beads. Each bracelet is, in a way my daily prayer and nothing is more powerful and life-sustaining than devotion.

 

Pass It Along - Inspire Someone

Everyone reading this knows at least one woman who would DIE to own a piece of wearable limited edition art. You can help this project achieve its ultimate success of 100 days and 100 bracelets by getting the word out to your friends and family or anyone who would enjoy reading about the daily creative effort and inspiration it takes to make them. Daily Bracelets can be found at:

http://100bracelets100days.wordpress.com/

 

Thanks for your interest and support of my project!

story:
Our Story

We are Caravan. We are a collective of artists, designers and architects aiming to set up a new and exciting travelling gallery, based in Edinburgh, Scotland. 


We want to take innovative art, design and architecture to every corner of Scotland, England, Ireland, Wales and beyond! We also want to establish world-wide connections and tour the best possible art and design work.


The caravan needs a new refit and respray to turn it into a new lovely gallery, that's where you can really help...


The Impact

Caravan will enable the founding members to live out their dream and create jobs and opportunities for artists and designers all over Scotland, and - to be perfectly honest - live much happier lives. The money raised will go towards making a sustainable gallery and working space for some of the best creative talent Britain has to offer. 


What We Need & What You Get

All the money we raise via IndieGoGo - whether or not we reach the target - will go towards refitting and respraying the caravan. We have all put money into the pot, but it is just not enough as a full respray will cost a considerable amount. 

To thank all the kind people who donate to our worthy cause, we have worked out what we think is a very appealing list of perks. Taken from English money slang, we have created five levels of amazing perks and presents! We hope you find them enticing!



Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our story with everyone. We really can't do it without your help. So, if you like our idea and would like to see it happen, please pass this on to everyone you know.

story:
2000 Pounds of Iron

In July of 2007 I started my first small print shop in Walla Walla, WA. I had 110 square feet, a Kelsey Excelsior 5x8 tabletop press, and ten cases of type. Since then, my collection has grown and my needs have expanded. I acquired a C&P 14x22, a double type cabinet, and 24 cases of type from a closing print shop and began plans to expand my business.

All this went on hold while I attended graduate school from 2009-2011, but now I'm out of school and ready to start printing again. Currently, my equipment is stored in Walla Walla, waiting to be brought out and used. I'm looking to move it to Seattle and open my press. I'm still working on the press name, so feel free to make suggestions. I'll release some as updates as the campaign progresses.

In March of this year I teamed up with another printer to begin looking for space. On March 30th, we found it! We're getting ready to sign a lease on 450 square feet in the "Center of the Universe" the Fremont neighborhood of Seattle.

My long term goal is to print a line of greeting cards; work with local poets, authors, and illustrators on fine press books; create custom stationary; and do small runs of custom lables for the many wineries and breweries in the state.

What We Need & What You Get

Right now I'm looking to raise $2200 to cover moving expenses (hauling a cast iron press across the mountains isn't cheap), a Boxcar Base for printing from plates (http://www.boxcarpress.com/boxcar-base/index.html), paper, and to offset the cost of rent while I work on getting clients. More specifically:

$300 for moving expenses

$300 for the Boxcar Base (with shipping)

$150 for paper

$300 for new rollers

$300 to put windows in the door

The balance will help with setting up the space, putting in an extra light and shelving, and general expenses. Anything over the goal will go towards ongoing operating expenses and supplies and will be greatly appreciated.

What you'll get:

$5 - A personal thank you email and a shout out on Twitter

$10 - Specially designed letterpress printed thank you card or calendar card

$25 -Thank you card and letterpress printed calendar card or five pack of greeting cards

$25 - Thank you card, calendar card, and five pack of greeting cards

$75 - Thank you card, calendar card, and hand bound paperback journal

$100 - The $75 level plus a five-pack of greeting cards

$200 - All of the above plus 20% off of up to $200 of custom work, stationary, or journals

$500 - all of the above plus a hand bound, wood covered journal 50% off up to $200 of custom work, stationary, or journals

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, if you love hand-made goods and fine paper products, please spread the word about my campaign, send an encouraging note, or, if you're in the Seattle area, drop by and say hi while we set up.

story:
Hi, my name is Steve Wanna. I'm a visual and sound artist living in Washington DC. Walking is my main mode of transportation, but I also like to walk because it gives me time to observe the infinitely rich phenomenal world we live in.  We each see the world in particular ways, colored by our own habits and stories, perceptions and obsessions. I work in a variety of mediums (photography, paint, sound, sculpture) and employ different materials in ways that mimic, capture, or are inspired by some of the natural processes I see while going about the day.

I'm here to ask for your support for my first solo exhibit. I've been lucky enough to have an opportunity to present some of my recent works at the doris-mae gallery in Washington DC. The exhibit, A Slight Suggestion, is presented by Catalyst Projects and will open April 12.

It's a multimedia show featuring works that are inspired by my encounters with the world of shadows that surround us, a world that we often miss. Shadows of tree leaves on sunny, windy days animating sidewalks, and ordinary objects casting intricate silhouettes on various surfaces are all part of a lively theatre that’s constantly appearing and disappearing around us. This fleeting world is sometimes as wild as the wildest dancing, more poignant and arresting than sunsets and poetry--and it is all hidden in plain view.

I'm asking for your contribution to help cover some of the costs involved with this project, which will include photo printing and mounting, the porcelain and electronic components required for making the illuminated-porcelain sculptures and other materials for the site-specific installations. I hope you can contribute. Thank you!

Steve
story_txt: Hi, my name is Steve Wanna. I'm a visual and sound artist living in Washington DC. Walking is my main mode of transportation, but I also like to walk because it gives me time to observe the infinitely rich phenomenal world we live in.  We each see the world in particular ways, colored by our own habits and stories, perceptions and obsessions. I work in a variety of mediums (photography, paint, sound, sculpture) and employ different materials in ways that mimic, capture, or are inspired by some of the natural processes I see while going about the day.I'm here to ask for your support for my first solo exhibit. I've been lucky enough to have an opportunity to present some of my recent works at the doris-mae gallery in Washington DC. The exhibit, A Slight Suggestion, is presented by Catalyst Projects and will open April 12.It's a multimedia show featuring works that are inspired by my encounters with the world of shadows that surround us, a world that we often miss. Shadows of tree leaves on sunny, windy days animating sidewalks, and ordinary objects casting intricate silhouettes on various surfaces are all part of a lively theatre that’s constantly appearing and disappearing around us. This fleeting world is sometimes as wild as the wildest dancing, more poignant and arresting than sunsets and poetry--and it is all hidden in plain view.I'm asking for your contribution to help cover some of the costs involved with this project, which will include photo printing and mounting, the porcelain and electronic components required for making the illuminated-porcelain sculptures and other materials for the site-specific installations. I hope you can contribute. Thank you!Steve

story:
Contexte

Le contexte politique et économique auquel fait actuellement face la Ville de Montréal n’est pas des plus reluisants: allégations de corruption, exode des familles en banlieue, pertes d’emplois majeures sur l’île, infrastructures de transport déficientes… pour ne nommer que ces exemples. Les critiques envers la métropole fusent de toutes parts, générant malheureusement un climat cynique récurrent dans notre quotidien. Mais le tableau est-il aussi sombre dans toutes les sphères d’activités de notre ville? Ne soyons pas si pessimistes.

Un exemple positif et concret est celui du design urbain de Montréal qui est en pleine effervescence depuis l’obtention du titre « Ville Unesco de design » en 2006. Montréal n’est peut-être pas encore une capitale mondiale de l’architecture, certes, mais on ne peut négliger les efforts consentis ces dernières années pour améliorer le sort de la métropole. Certains observateurs préfèrent voir le verre à moitié vide et critiquer le manque de vision de nos élus; personnellement, je perçois un verre à moitié plein qui ne demande qu’à être rempli. Les bons coups se multiplient sans cesse et doivent servir d’exemple pour le Montréal du futur.

C’est pourquoi ma carrière en journalisme a pris un tournant majeur en 2012 en me spécialisant en design urbain et en architecture. Que ce soit sur les ondes de CIBL, de la Première Chaîne de Radio-Canada ou encore à l’écrit dans le Journal Métro, l’architecture de qualité et le design urbain responsable restent au cœur de mes priorités.

Très peu de mes collègues couvrent actuellement ces secteurs d’activités, alors que le visage de Montréal évoluera rapidement ces prochaines années avec des chantiers majeurs comme l’échangeur Turcot, le nouveau pont Champlain, ou encore, le redéveloppement de quartier comme celui de Griffintown. Bref, on doit discuter plus activement de ces enjeux dans les médias pour éveiller chez le citoyen un regard plus critique vis-à-vis le développement de sa propre ville.

Mon projet

Comment puis-je donc pousser encore plus loin mes efforts pour améliorer notre paysage urbain? En allant couvrir la prochaine édition du World Architecture Festival cet automne à Singapour. 

L’événement accueillera de nombreux architectes-conférenciers du monde entier qui viendront partager leur vision et leur expertise sur diverses thématiques : la valeur économique et culturelle de l’architecture, le design urbain responsable, le rôle des architectes face aux changements climatiques, la densification des milieux urbains… Des thématiques qui nous touchent directement en sol québécois.

Mon but? Aller recueillir de nouvelles idées pour inspirer, voire influencer, notre développement urbain en les partageant via les tribunes médiatiques qui me sont offertes sur une base hebdomadaire. Cette expérience unique au World Architecture Festival me permettrait également d’aller peaufiner mes acquis en assistant aux nombreuses conférences sur le site, et m’offrirait du même coup une chance inespérée de me bâtir un réseau de contacts international.

L’architecture et le design urbain ont tant d’impacts sur notre économie, la santé publique, le tourisme et notre qualité de vie qu’on doit y développer une plus grande sensibilité ces prochaines années. 

Comment l'argent sera-t-il utilisé?

Le coût total pour « Direction Singapour » est estimé à 2 500$.  

Ce voyage professionnel sera financé grâce à cette campagne de sociofinancement, mes économies personnelles, une subvention gouvernementale du ministère des relations internationales et par mes clients (Journal Métro, Radio-Canada et Baron Mag). Mes démarches sont également supportées par Mission Design, Design Montréal et Kollectif.

Voici un résumé de la distribution budgétaire:

Transport :

Billets d’avion : 1500$

Taxi & transport collectif : 100$

Logement :

Auberge de jeunesse (7 nuits - 40$/nuit): 280$ 

Nourriture :

8 jours/30$ par jour : 240$

Assurances :

Croix Bleue : 130$

Matériel journalistique:

Ex : carte de presse & cartes d’affaire : 150$

Autres dépenses:

100$

Où mes chroniques seront-elles publiées/diffusées?

CIBL, Journal Métro, Radio-Canada, Baron Mag et mon blogue Dicietdailleurs.ca

story:
Queremos recuperar una tradición olvidada en el tiempo: El teatro de sombras basado en la mitología griega con instrumentos y música del siglo XVIII.

Conseguiremos llevar a cabo nuestro proyecto en el mismo sitio donde hace doscientos cincuenta años se realizó por última vez.

Necesitamos un proyector Epson EB G6250W - Proyector LCD - 6500 lúmenes - 1280 x 800 - pantalla ancha - HD - LAN

Conseguiremos sacar adelante un proyecto que ha sido premiado en la I Edición de los Premios GEMA, y en el que llevamos trabajando más de dos años. 

Proyectaremos (con ayuda de una cámara) el pequeño retablo barroco de sombras en una tela de lino mucho más grande sin perder definición y detalle, pudiendo llegar al público de un teatro más allá de la segunda fila del patio de butacas.

Si no conseguimos recaudar lo necesario para comprar el proyector destinaremos el dinero a los gastos de creación de los títeres, el teatrino y la pantalla. 


¡Ayúdanos a difundirlo! Muchas gracias

www.delirivm.com

story:
What is art4teens?

art4teens is a program in which up to 15 participants will engage in hands-on ceramic arts experiences over six months with local artist mentors and Gallery arts educators. With your help we will provide a special opportunity for a group of teens, who might not normally have access to such an in-depth creative arts program. The participants will be identified and nominated by community health, education and social service organizations. art4teens will empower these teens. The experience will allow for free expression of ideas through their art with fellow participants and ultimately with the community. Through the accessible arts programming and resources we will help create a positive path as our teens move forward in their lives.

art4teens will be celebrated with a public exhibition at the Gallery that invites the community to meet the artists and see their creative expressions. We can all learn from the teen artists and conversations about their ideas and their art will stimulate and inspire attendees and participants alike.

Why We Need YOUR Help

It is so easy for teens to think that their community doesn’t care for them…they often feel they are alone and detached. Our staff and Gallery supporters believe art4teens sends a strong message that we do care about their feelings, about who they are, about their thoughts and the means to express them. Please join us in support of art4teens. Every dollar helps to support this worthwhile program. Why not get your business, club, class or team together and make a group donation! The project is a way for all of us to give back to the community and show that we believe in young people.

    

"We must provide access to creative outlets for teens...offer hands-on experiences that allow ideas and emotions to come out in something physical "

Murray Gamble, community leader and arts advocate


Be A Part Of art4teens And See The Impact On Teen Participants Who Will:

  • Develop pride within themselves and within their communities through public display of their work.
  • Build confidence through engaging in activities where they can express their identity.
  • Develop communication skills by sharing ideas with others.
  • Grow skills and team work by working with others and by participating in arts activities that require cooperation, collaboration and team work.
  • Develop an understanding of new ceramic processes by working long term with local professional artists

Expression is the key takeaway from this program. By supporting art4teens you are giving the participants a chance to develop skills that will be carried through their everyday lives. Not only will you make a difference now, but also for their future.

Any funds that are received from this campaign will go directly to art4teens and the further development of this community program. We will issue tax receipts for the maximum allowable amount.


About Our Artist Mentors

The Clay & Glass is an ideal environment for such a program as we have the expertise in-house through our accomplished staff: Nadine Badran, Manager of Public Programs and Sheila McMath, Curator. We also have selected three artist mentors: Natalie Prevost-Mero, Chris Hierlihy, Jaclyn Ryan. They are prepared to mentor and teach the teens within their respective areas of expertise (wheel work, hand building, image transfer and glazing). They are especially receptive to the ideas and needs of participants and are sensitive to the specific challenges faced by teens.

The Clay & Glass... A Creative Space

As a contemporary art gallery we host dynamic exhibitions featuring the work of Canadian and international artists with a focus on ceramic, glass and enamel art works. We attract over 4,000 youth through our programs that include Play with Clay, camps, after-school programs, and school field trips. We also offer customized programs for youth at risk and those with special needs.

The Gallery itself is a stunning open architectural space. It houses many outstanding artworks that will inspire the teens. Through viewing other accomplished artists' works and meeting many arts practitioners they will grow their knowledge of ceramics and contemporary art. That could be a springboard to further study and this bodes well for the long-term emotional and social growth of the teen participants who, with your help, will become more active, productive, creative, arts-conscious and engaged community members.


Project Costs and Where Your Money Will Go

A project of this size is valued at $21,000 and we look to you, our community, to help support the following specific needs of this six-month program:

Art Supplies (clay, glaze, materials) $2500
Food (feed the group for 24 sessions over six months) $1800
Marketing/Promotion of exhibition and reception $700

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge is being able to offer the full program to this group of teens if funding goals are not met. We appreciate any and all funding, but will have to revisit the length and/or structure of the program if all funding is not received. Please be generous in your support of art4teens!

Other Ways You Can Help

We invite you to share this campaign with all your friends, family and colleagues even if you are unable to make a donation. We can make a difference in the lives of these teens. Any time devoted to volunteering at the Gallery is appreciated. We have a committed volunteer group and would love to have your help! Please visit our website at www.theclayandglass.ca and contact William Hlowatzki for any volunteer inquiries at reception@canadianclayandglass.ca!

If there is any other way you believe you can support art4teens please contact us and we can discuss your ideas. Donations of food, art supplies, printing etc. will help offset costs. Thank you for your support!

story:
This is a photography guide book on Korea, taking you off the beaten path inside cities like Jeonju, Cheongju, Busan, Suncheon, Yeosu, Seoul and more. Directions on how to get there, addresses and general maps will be included in English and Korean text. You may use it as a travel guide but be aware that getting lost is part of the journey. If you are an enthusiast for all things Korean, this will be something special for your future trip to Korea! 


* * * DETAILS * * *

Campaign funds will be used towards costs for publication design, translation, printing, packaging and postage.

Our main stretched goal will be to hold an official book launch and book introduction talk in Singapore where we can share more about our experiences.

More photographs are available to view via the Updates tab above


* * * About KIDCUCUMBERINC. 아이오이 * * *
KIDCUCUMBERINC. 아이오이 is a contemporary art studio whose genre of work is concerned with the human psyche and its associated themes. Our ever evolving work runs parallel with the progression of our daily lives – we do what we are concerned about. They take the form of objects, installations, books, short fiction, drawings, video, photography. Influences are drawn from a wide range of fields, including but not limited to, architecture, design and the literary arts. 

www.kidcucumber.org

www.facebook.com/kidcucumber
