story:
What are we creating?

We are a collection of motivated and creative people who like to make beautiful things, turn dreams into reality and strive to make creations that get people to think "how the $*!(@& did they do that?!"

Kinetikami is the large revolving origami portal aiming to do that. It will glow or revolve inside the Pyramid, bringing brilliance to the dreams at Borderland.

The portal is marked by certain numbers. There are 49 rings, each one of them having a diameter of 42cm, and the fold has a radius of 42cm. Straightened out, the portal measures about 7m. The colors animations run at 49 frames per second. We are using about 7000 rivets, 4000LEDs, 225 plastic sheets, and 16 ultrasonic sensors. And a partridge in a pear tree.

Design and Prototypes

Much has evolved in the past few months of designing and testing. We've made a scale prototype and the first segment of the final installation. While building has begun we will continue to test materials, structure, electronics and electrical parts to ensure this moves your dreams as brightly and safely as possible.


Team:

We have an obsessively dedicated team of architects, engineers, designers and techies. We are a collection of motivated and creative people who like to make beautiful things who choose to spend their weekends making something cool. We hope you'll enjoy the portal.

Annie-Locke Scherer

(miss)Chief Architect and project lead. She worked on Floreplay, programmable folds, fiber-optic dress. Anything spatial and amazing. 

Simion Iulian Belea 

Artist-engineer and project lead. He did Wonderflower and Wavelamp last year. Skilled with LEDs, sensors, controllers, electronics, programming.

Ping Yee

Code Wizard and Interaction Designer. Creator of the OpenPixelControl protocol. Light and Interaction design on Truth is Beauty, Serpent Twins and Light Orchestra.

What can you get

Sticker:

Light Wall Lamp

Portal Prototype:

What We Need

Borderland has offered us a grant of 25000 DKK to make it happen. While this is enough to get it off the ground, we need $700 more to make it happen. We have 225 plastic sheets (60kg of plastic!) and over 4,000 interactive LEDs. to make this dream a reality. All grant money is used on material costs and transport for this installation, including LED strips, rivets, nuts, electronics, plywood, wires and much more. Even if we don't reach this goal any amount is welcome, to offset the costs of us covering it personally.

Risks & Challenges

We've been involved in projects of similar complexity. In the past years we had electrical problems and we solved them with better designs this year, making sure it's safely hidden from sight or reach and that there would be no short-circuits.

The two biggest risks are that some components might arrive with only a little time to be tested before Borderland. In this case we are prepared to guarantee a standing arch. The second risk is that we might not have enough helping hands to put the big origami fold together. For this we are preparing a series of origami folding parties at our workshop in Stockholm.

Other Ways You Can Help

Join us at one Origami Folding party and help with assembly and folding.
story_txt:
What are we creating?
We are a collection of motivated and creative people who like to make beautiful things, turn dreams into reality and strive to make creations that get people to think "how the $*!(@& did they do that?!"
Kinetikami is the large revolving origami portal aiming to do that. It will glow or revolve inside the Pyramid, bringing brilliance to the dreams at Borderland.
The portal is marked by certain numbers. There are 49 rings, each one of them having a diameter of 42cm, and the fold has a radius of 42cm. Straightened out, the portal measures about 7m. The colors animations run at 49 frames per second. We are using about 7000 rivets, 4000LEDs, 225 plastic sheets, and 16 ultrasonic sensors. And a partridge in a pear tree.
Design and Prototypes
Much has evolved in the past few months of designing and testing. We've made a scale prototype and the first segment of the final installation. While building has begun we will continue to test materials, structure, electronics and electrical parts to ensure this moves your dreams as brightly and safely as possible.




Team:
We have an obsessively dedicated team of architects, engineers, designers and techies. We are a collection of motivated and creative people who like to make beautiful things who choose to spend their weekends making something cool. We hope you'll enjoy the portal.
Annie-Locke Scherer
(miss)Chief Architect and project lead. She worked on Floreplay, programmable folds, fiber-optic dress. Anything spatial and amazing. 

Simion Iulian Belea 
Artist-engineer and project lead. He did Wonderflower and Wavelamp last year. Skilled with LEDs, sensors, controllers, electronics, programming.

Ping Yee
Code Wizard and Interaction Designer. Creator of the OpenPixelControl protocol. Light and Interaction design on Truth is Beauty, Serpent Twins and Light Orchestra.

What can you get
Sticker:

Light Wall Lamp

Portal Prototype:

What We Need
Borderland has offered us a grant of 25000 DKK to make it happen. While this is enough to get it off the ground, we need $700 more to make it happen. We have 225 plastic sheets (60kg of plastic!) and over 4,000 interactive LEDs. to make this dream a reality. All grant money is used on material costs and transport for this installation, including LED strips, rivets, nuts, electronics, plywood, wires and much more. Even if we don't reach this goal any amount is welcome, to offset the costs of us covering it personally.
Risks & Challenges
We've been involved in projects of similar complexity. In the past years we had electrical problems and we solved them with better designs this year, making sure it's safely hidden from sight or reach and that there would be no short-circuits.
The two biggest risks are that some components might arrive with only a little time to be tested before Borderland. In this case we are prepared to guarantee a standing arch. The second risk is that we might not have enough helping hands to put the big origami fold together. For this we are preparing a series of origami folding parties at our workshop in Stockholm.

Other Ways You Can HelpJoin us at one Origami Folding party and help with assembly and folding.

story:
Introducing Kelsey Cares. After multiple community projects to revitalize the Town of Lake Park through the arts, specifically our renowned mural projects, we are now furthering our efforts through receiving our 501(c)(3) nonprofit status. Founded in 1919, the original Kelsey City (now Lake Park) was a cultural hub and we are continuing Harry Kelsey's vision by cultivating The Lake Park Arts District. Kelsey Cares is Funding art, theater, music, film, and cultural development through community outreach by providing subsidies for productions, events, artists and musicians to carry out their mission.

 

The Back Alley Mural Project  

Thanks to the local community the launch of The Kelsey Theater has been a growing success, and even given birth to what we now call The Lake Park Arts District. That left us wondering, "What else can we do to make Lake Park great?" The answer is to utilize the only real estate we have left in a project that benefits local artists and the community alike.

Where others saw only a blank wall A.J. Brockman and company saw a blank canvas with seemingly endless opportunities. The plan is to turn the back side of the 700 block into a giant mural with contributions from multiple artists. Much like Miami's Wynwood we are taking an otherwise unremarkable alleyway and turning it into a cultural destination. 

So why are we raising money? All of the artists involved are professionals, people who make their living from their art. Many times people get artists to do something like this in exchange for "exposure" and as artists ourselves we feel that is not always fair. They deserve compensation for their contribution. So the money raised will first purchase the materials needed and then every remaining cent will go to paying the artists for their work. 

Won't you join us and make Lake Park beautiful again? 

 

What We Need & What You Get

So, we need to fill this wall with eye-popping color that will make The Lake Park Arts District visible from outer space! Okay, maybe that's a bit unrealistic, but we still want to beautify this town with public art. The extent to which the wall gets painted depends on how much money we raise.

100% of all the funds raised will be going towards supplies, rental equipment, permitting and actually paying these artists because artwork is WORK. Once we reach our initial goal any additional money raised will be put into escrow and applied to the next round of muralists until we are able to paint the entire 700 building (pretty much a city block) every six months. After that, we start again right back at the beginning so there is always fresh imagery to inspire our community.

We are also partnering with local businesses, art stores, construction companies, and the suppliers themselves in order to minimize the amount of money we have to actually spend to make this wall happen. In turn, we are able to put more money into the artist pockets allowing them to continue to share their work and make a living.


Now to the good part… What you get in return for your support! We have a bunch of great perks at all different contribution levels, the majority of which center around "The 4yr Anniversary Block Party" scheduled for May 12, 2018. This will serve as our official wrap party and unveiling of the finished mural. Food trucks, vendors, craft beer, live music, art demonstrations, and much more will be going down as we put the finishing touches on this masterpiece the day of. Not a local? No problem, many of our perks are easily shipped so you can help support this project from anywhere in the world. At the very least, come party with us at this free event and see what's happening at The Lake Park Arts District for yourself!

 

The Artists

Below are all the approved artists involved in our second round of mural–y goodness. All of which have already submitted sketches and artwork to be approved. These are professionals, artists literally making a living from their craft… And for the first time, we even have some international renowned muralists. Who is your favorite?

Craig McInnis – Born in a small town in Connecticut, June 12th 1972. Music and art runs through his family tree. His Mother is an artist and his grandfather and great Uncles were all big band musicians. Cartoon enthusiast. Foodie. Jokester. Halloween FREAK. Craig cherishes his friends and family. He creates art, for him, with hopes that it will stir something in the viewer…there is no other reason. He creates because he must do so to maintain sanity and relative balance. 

 

FABS– I've been in the art field since the late 90's, when I began studying music in the Middle School of the Arts in West Palm Beach, Florida. Later, at Dreyfoos School of the Arts, after singing in the chorus for four years, I decided to change my major to Visual Arts. I graduated in 2004 and went to live in Miami to continue my academic career at New World School of the Arts. During my time there, I was absorbed by street art and wanted to continue traveling and painting. After some time, I settled down in Quito, Ecuador, where my mother is from and where I had spent four years of my childhood. Five years passed and I received my Bachelors degree from Universidad Central del Ecuador (Central University of Ecuador), majoring in Sculpture. During that time I worked in the urban area, including abandoned buildings in various cities of Ecuador. Currently, I alternate between Florida, Mexico, and Ecuador. 

 

Amanda Valdes – As a Miami native, 27, Amanda is a mainstay on the art scene. Her iconic macabre style is instantly recognizable and her impact has spread internationally. Valdes’ art focuses on the female identity, primarily drawing inspiration from the dolls in her head. 

 

Mark "Bulks" – An up-and-coming street artist from Jupiter Florida, his own unique style speaks for itself. A perfect blend of traditional urban train tagging and stylized realism, this kid is the real deal. 

 

EMO – Originally from Union City, New Jersey, Eduardo Mendieta has been living in West Palm Beach, FL for the last 20 years. Starting at a young age he was interested in graffiti and the fine arts. Now at the age of 40 he is showing in various locations throughout South Florida, and being featured in publications such as XS Magazine, City Link Magazine, Palm Beach Times, FreePress Magazine, and Closer Magazine throughout the years of 1997 to 2002. 

 

RIPE – A Florida native that has been artistic his entire life. As a kid, he was always fascinated with "graffiti" and turned that passion into many artistic endeavors. He is now part of many of the infamous South Florida crews he once idolized. 

 

Risks & Challenges

With the success of one of the most-funded campaigns in Indiegogo history in the theater category, so let's just say this is not our first rodeo. We have built an awesome core team of organizers, have city and governmental support, own the building, pulled permits, have artists ready and waiting, not even mother nature can hold us back (we have plenty of rain ponchos for our artists and have even scheduled more than two weeks to create these murals before the big unveiling; even if we are dodging South Florida sun showers). The only thing missing is the money, coffee, and paint thinner to get this mural launched!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to contributions, we really need your help getting the word out. Word of mouth is always the best way for something like this to gain momentum so please take a moment to share this on your Facebook or Twitter. Share this page with your friends and family, tell them why you think it's a great project, and ask for their support.

Together we can make this happen, and feel free to come and check it out for yourself!

story:
My Story

My name is Jason Nolen, and I run the Cats of Madison Instagram account. I'm putting together a Cats of Madison book that will include photos and brief stories about the cats (and people) I've met on my many cat strolls around Madison.

What I Need 

I hope to raise $3000 to cover the costs of designing and printing the book. If I'm lucky enough to raise more than that, the additional money will fund other Cats of Madison projects (most importantly, a 2019 calendar) and the daily maintenance of the Instagram account, which at this point is nearly a full-time job but with a salary of just under $0/hour.

What You Get

There are several levels of donation that come with a variety of great purrks: Cats of Madison buttons and stickers, a personal photo session, a guided cat walk, and a Cats of Madison catnip toy made by my friends at TacoCat Creations!

The Impact of your Contribution

Madison cats! For everyone! In book and social media form! Can't fall asleep? Watch a Cats of Madison story! Bored at work? Go to Cats of Madison and like the latest post! On a first date at Mickey's Tavern and afraid you'll run out of things to talk about? Ask your date if they follow Cats of Madison! (Note: also a great way to find out whether they like cats before you order that second drink.)

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign on you Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram pages! 

Thank you to everyone in the Madison cat-lovers community for all your support!

story:
We are a team of designers from Bath UK, who after seeing the fireball's descent to Earth and learning about the incredible journey of the Chelyabinsk Meteorite, were inspired to share this rare artifact with the world. We wanted a piece of the Chelyabinsk Meteorite to be shared with everyone, and thus, the concept of INFINITY - The Pen From Space was born. 

We set ourselves the challenge of designing a unique Pen centered around showcasing the Meteorite while delivering an exceptionally high-quality writing experience yet at an affordable price. 

After solving the problem of how we would process the Meteorite to the correct form and then combine it in a water clear encapsulation, we went on to review as many Pen body designs, nibs and refills that we could source and finally selected an established,  beautiful, classic, well balanced pen body design, that is compatible with the world's best German engineered nibs and refills, in order to combine an iconic look and feel with a high-quality, contemporary, smooth and consistent writing experience.

INFINITY has been designed in limited numbers and comes as either a Fountain Pen, Rollerball, or Ballpoint Pen. All three have been perfectly weighted and contrast a dark matter resin with a polished metal finish, to produce an exceptional everyday pen.

The Infinity - Ballpoint, Rollerball and Fountain Pen

Moving in excess of 12 miles per second (faster than Mach 60), 62 miles above the glaciated plains of the Russia–Kazakhstan border, a 4.5-billion-year-old relic of the solar system punctured the Earth’s atmosphere and began its fiery descent over the snow-covered Kurgan and Chelyabinsk Oblasts. It was tailed by a pair of smoky, iridescent plumes, and constantly shed debris before abruptly decelerating and exploding in a final half-megaton explosion. The whole explosive journey took just over 15 seconds after over 4 billion years tumbling silently through space. 

The explosion left behind a group of rocky remnants that headed west, passing 25 miles from Chelyabinsk city center. The largest landed 18 miles farther in Lake Chebarkul at the foot of the Ural Mountains, creating a 6-meter wide hole in its ice. The event was the most dramatic near-Earth asteroid airburst since the 1908 Tunguska impact blast in Siberia. It is a unique meteor event in being recorded in such vivid detail.  

It took Russian scientists 5 months to identify the meteorite buried in mud in the depths of the lake. An operation to recover the meteorite began in September 2013 and concluded with the raising of a fragment with an estimated mass of 654 kg.

Meteorites are some of the oldest, rarest and most remarkable objects on our planet. They carry within them messages and materials that have traveled enormous distances from the depths of space and they’re truly some of the most enchanting things we’ll ever get to experience.

After seeing the incredible footage of the Chelyabinsk meteorite entering the earth’s atmosphere, we wanted to ensure that everyone had the opportunity to hold this rare and amazing piece of the universe in the palm of their hand.

Our goal was to combine this historic artifact that had traveled across the Universe from the beginning of time, with something that you could use every day, and thus INFINITY - The Pen From Space was born.

We wanted to Design something that could be used by everyone, every day: whether you are a designer, graphic artist, entrepreneur, writer, scientist, musician, inventor or you simply want a beautiful, iconic product to inspire you. 

INFINITY is based on an iconic design and has been perfectly weighted, whilst it contrasts a dark matter resin with a metal finish to produce an exceptional everyday pen.

INFINITY - Fountain Pen

The fountain pen comes with a high-quality twist refill converter or alternatively you can use standard ink cartridges. We've provided an exceptional medium nib that delivers an excellent writing experience and the fountain pen can be used posted or unposted.  

Showcase the meteorite by posting the pens cap

INFINITY - Rollerball

The Rollerball comes with the German-engineered Schmidt ceramic ball refill used and re-branded by the world's best pen brands. The Rollerball also offers comparability with Mont Blanc, Monteverde, ACME and other ceramic refill suppliers. If preferred, the Schmidt Fineliner and tube roller refills also fit. 

The Rollerball is a true Everyday Pen

INFINITY- Ballpoint

The twist out ballpoint version comes with the amazing Schmidt Easyflow 9500 refill and also accommodates any industry standard compatible insert. Schmidt also offers a zero gravity refill option should any of you fancy taking your INFINITY back into space. 

Twist action Ballpoint always has the Meteorite on show

All pens pass through our production and quality checks before being shipped by Amazon. We provide a simple and fast exchange warranty giving you a peace of mind. 

We wanted to provide the widest range of purchase options as possible while keeping the logistics and costs of handling multiple products as efficient as possible. 

You can get INFINITY as either a Single Pen of any style - Rollerball, Ballpoint or Fountain Pen - or in packs of 2 or 3 for gifting to friends and family. 

The 2 Pack offers full flexibility in Mix & Match format. 

The 3 Packs are a mixed set of 3 giving you one pen of each type.

Everyone pledging will receive a digital wallpaper pack in HD to enable you to immediately show your friends you joined the INFINITY mission. In addition all Kickstarter pledgers will be listed on our website Hall of Fame as founding fathers of the brand.    

Meteorite hunters frequently use a 'magnet test' to verify the iron content of potential meteorites and to distinguish them from plain earth rocks. Meteorites high iron content makes them magnetic, its that simple. Don't forget test yours with a magnet when it arrives!

We source our meteorite from long-standing meteorite traders with years in the industry. Just like the fine art and gold bullion markets they conduct the due diligence and establish provenance to verify the authenticity of meteorite they buy. We are therefore able to provide you a guarantee and a certificate of authenticity which we will deliver as soon as the project closes to all backers.  

We always wanted the Kickstarter INFINITY to be as cost effective for backers as possible. We have worked really hard to find a way minimize packing and fulfillment charges and include these in the price to most of the world whilst also covering all customs charges. We have also made it a priority to pass on all the savings from consolidated shipping costs.

Thanks to the supply chain we have set up very cost-effective ways of delivering INFINITY to you. Below is an explanation for each delivery group:

The United States and Canada (Shipping & Customs included): 
We distribute INFINITY through Amazon in the US as they are accurate, have predictable shipping times and are cost effective. 

European Union (Shipping & Customs included):
This is exactly the same as the US bound shipment, except this one goes to Amazon in England for EU-wide distribution. 

Any country not in the EU nor the US/Canada ($9 shipping):
If you're not in the EU or the US/Canada:  for example South America, Mexico, Eastern Europe, Asia, Australia, New Zealand, etc. It’s only an extra $9 shipping for you guys. We will mark these Pens as "Kickstarter rewards" on the customs forms using the manufacturing cost as the commercial value of the Pen. 

Risks and challenges

Our major challenge, was how could we encapsulate the Meteorite into a balanced working pen that looked great. We knew we had to seal the Meteorite so it wouldn't oxidize and deteriorate over time but we also wanted it to be something you could get close to and hold in the palm of your hand.

We approached the design by focusing on our key priorities; water clear encapsulation, aesthetically pleasing classic design, and a contemporary smooth writing experience at an affordable price.

Having determined that the overall writing experience of Infinity would be a function of its shape, weight and balance of body components, working in unison with the refill. A large part of our effort was used to source experienced part manufacturers who were both happy and capable to make changes to their respective platforms that would allow us to combine the best elements of each part, in order to deliver something that is unique, you can use every day, while also being compatible with the best refills on the planet - Schmidt.

It took months to find, test and filter down to the right platform and make the necessary changes to ensure that it wasn't out of balance, that the meteorite looked great and crucially also that the pen functioned well with the selected refills for everyday use.

The pen body and parts have been adapted from a tried and tested platform so we are happy that there are no major design faults in the main body of the Pen itself. We built the encapsulation prototypes by hand and tried a number of casting techniques before we found one that worked and that was repeatable

The fountain pen comes with a high-quality twist refill converter or alternatively you can use standard ink cartridges. We've provided an exceptional medium nib that delivers an excellent writing experience and the fountain pen can be used posted or unposted.  


Showcase the meteorite by posting the pens cap

INFINITY - Rollerball
The Rollerball comes with the German-engineered Schmidt ceramic ball refill used and re-branded by the world's best pen brands. The Rollerball also offers comparability with Mont Blanc, Monteverde, ACME and other ceramic refill suppliers. If preferred, the Schmidt Fineliner and tube roller refills also fit. 


The Rollerball is a true Everyday Pen

INFINITY- Ballpoint
The twist out ballpoint version comes with the amazing Schmidt Easyflow 9500 refill and also accommodates any industry standard compatible insert. Schmidt also offers a zero gravity refill option should any of you fancy taking your INFINITY back into space. 



Twist action Ballpoint always has the Meteorite on show

All pens pass through our production and quality checks before being shipped by Amazon. We provide a simple and fast exchange warranty giving you a peace of mind. 

Infinity components


We wanted to provide the widest range of purchase options as possible while keeping the logistics and costs of handling multiple products as efficient as possible. 
You can get INFINITY as either a Single Pen of any style - Rollerball, Ballpoint or Fountain Pen - or in packs of 2 or 3 for gifting to friends and family. 
The 2 Pack offers full flexibility in Mix & Match format. 

The 3 Packs are a mixed set of 3 giving you one pen of each type.
Everyone pledging will receive a digital wallpaper pack in HD to enable you to immediately show your friends you joined the INFINITY mission. In addition all Kickstarter pledgers will be listed on our website Hall of Fame as founding fathers of the brand.    


Meteorite hunters frequently use a 'magnet test' to verify the iron content of potential meteorites and to distinguish them from plain earth rocks. Meteorites high iron content makes them magnetic, its that simple. Don't forget test yours with a magnet when it arrives!

Chelyabinsk meteorite contains iron making it magnetic
We source our meteorite from long-standing meteorite traders with years in the industry. Just like the fine art and gold bullion markets they conduct the due diligence and establish provenance to verify the authenticity of meteorite they buy. We are therefore able to provide you a guarantee and a certificate of authenticity which we will deliver as soon as the project closes to all backers.  



We always wanted the Kickstarter INFINITY to be as cost effective for backers as possible. We have worked really hard to find a way minimize packing and fulfillment charges and include these in the price to most of the world whilst also covering all customs charges. We have also made it a priority to pass on all the savings from consolidated shipping costs.
Thanks to the supply chain we have set up very cost-effective ways of delivering INFINITY to you. Below is an explanation for each delivery group:
The United States and Canada (Shipping & Customs included): We distribute INFINITY through Amazon in the US as they are accurate, have predictable shipping times and are cost effective. 
European Union (Shipping & Customs included):This is exactly the same as the US bound shipment, except this one goes to Amazon in England for EU-wide distribution. 
Any country not in the EU nor the US/Canada ($9 shipping):If you're not in the EU or the US/Canada:  for example South America, Mexico, Eastern Europe, Asia, Australia, New Zealand, etc. It’s only an extra $9 shipping for you guys. We will mark these Pens as "Kickstarter rewards" on the customs forms using the manufacturing cost as the commercial value of the Pen. 


Risks and challengesOur major challenge, was how could we encapsulate the Meteorite into a balanced working pen that looked great. We knew we had to seal the Meteorite so it wouldn't oxidize and deteriorate over time but we also wanted it to be something you could get close to and hold in the palm of your hand.We approached the design by focusing on our key priorities; water clear encapsulation, aesthetically pleasing classic design, and a contemporary smooth writing experience at an affordable price.Having determined that the overall writing experience of Infinity would be a function of its shape, weight and balance of body components, working in unison with the refill. A large part of our effort was used to source experienced part manufacturers who were both happy and capable to make changes to their respective platforms that would allow us to combine the best elements of each part, in order to deliver something that is unique, you can use every day, while also being compatible with the best refills on the planet - Schmidt.It took months to find, test and filter down to the right platform and make the necessary changes to ensure that it wasn't out of balance, that the meteorite looked great and crucially also that the pen functioned well with the selected refills for everyday use.The pen body and parts have been adapted from a tried and tested platform so we are happy that there are no major design faults in the main body of the Pen itself. We built the encapsulation prototypes by hand and tried a number of casting techniques before we found one that worked and that was repeatable

story:
This campaign is to help me Wayne Sealey and my business (Natural Fusions) raise funds to replace uninsured power tools and chainsaws that were stolen from my workshop on 2nd Jan 2018.

I moved to Sheffield in April 2017 looking for a fresh start. I finally found a workshop in August. I did loads of work on the place, which hadn’t really been looked after. From September through to December. I spent all my spare time and money working on the repairs, installing a stove, electrics and useful shelving etc. The rest of my time I worked nights to pay for everything. I sacrificed my social time but stayed positive, knowing in January I’d get back to my true passion (working with wood). After a whole year without a workshop I was going to dive straight back in with some of the best and exciting projects I have found to date. I worked my last night shift on 31st December and on 1st January I put in place everything I needed to start working on my first project - an ancient bog oak root I am planning to turn into a beautiful, unique coffee table. After putting my tools out, locking up and going home I had an early night, eager to get started in the morning.

On the afternoon of the 2nd Jan this year I arrived at the workshop to find that I had been robbed of all my tools. They took everything that I have worked for over the past five years. I was devastated. The police couldn’t help me. I went around the whole neighbourhood asking if anyone had seen anything and the residence that were not at home I posted a letter explaining what had happened. I then spent the next week going to the local cash converters and checking gumtree and eBay. This has been very exhausting and quite stressful. I don’t feel I have anywhere else to turn. That is why am asking for your help.

Get by with a little help from my friends

Getting my equipment back to be able to work again would mean the world to me. I’ve worked hard on my dream of earning a living from my wood/art work. Working with wood grounds me and fills me with more positive rewards than any job I have done. It’s great to see people’s reactions when they see what can be made from so called waste wood. I Started again with my wood art last year after a challenging split from a long term relationship. I know that getting robbed won’t stop me from achieving my goals, but It has set me back financially. If I can get some help from you good people, even for just some of the essential tools, it will enable me to get straight back to working on my art so I can pay my way. That will be a blessing and a great help towards my target of working with wood full time.

A brief history of Wayne!

My passion for working with wood started around 2001 when I went to a green fair near my home town in Lancashire. There was a saw miller and a chainsaw carver making benches, bird boxes, Viking chairs all from one/two inch thick boards cut straight off the mill there and then. I got chatting to them. They were under staffed and within an hour I was selling the finished pieces for them to the public. It went so well they asked me to come back the following day. By the end of the weekend I’d sold their entire stock! We got on so well that they offered me a job. I worked as groundsman for a year and then ended up managing their yard. A favourite role at the yard was working with the miller cutting the wood to spec and selling the milled wood to carvers, joiners, cabinet makers, turners - craftsmen of all sorts. I learnt a lot from the older crafts men who regularly visited the yard. One day I was out on a big job - a copper beech whose roots were sadly badly damaged. I noticed straight away that its branches had a multitude of curves, shapes and letters running everywhere and I was really drawn to that. I couldn’t bring myself to feed such beautiful shapes and fusions into the chipper, so I worked a little harder to keep up with the climbers and saved a lot of the branches. I could see archways, L shaped sections, snake like branches and lots of ‘natural fusions’. I decided I could make a natural shaped chair out of all these bits. With a little help from my friend I made my first chair out of the branches and from that moment on I was hooked. Since then I have been salvaging odd shaped branches, stems, root balls, ancient bog oak, hollows, punky, burr and spalted wood. I source from anywhere there is what most people would call waste wood. I look beyond the mud, lumps of fungi and rot and see the natural shapes, usually hidden in the piece.  It could be a chair, sculpture, coffee table, display unit, bed board, bowl – almost anything really. That’s the beauty of wood, if you know what to look for, there is every conceivable shape imaginable! I love seeking it out, saving it from being wasted, and working it to reveal its natural beauty.

Ways You Can Help

Any assistance what so ever is greatly appreciated, I am so thankful for your contributions - even the smallest of donations will help. And if you can’t support me financially, you can still help by sharing this campaign with your friends and family and spreading the word.

Your willingness to share this project and ask for support on my behalf is of incredible value to me and I thank you for that!

 

Love and light

Wayne

For those who are interested, here's a breakdown of all the equipment stolen, so you know exactly where any donations you make will end up. (I'm not necessarily trying to replace everything, just get myself back to a working toolkit so that I can move forward sustainably).....

What was stolen:

  • Stihl MS 261 C-M chainsaw with 18”/45cm bar length (£756.00)
  • Stihl MS 201 TC-M-12 12” top handled chainsaw (£324.00)
  • Stihl 18 inch bar (£39.46)
  • Stihl 16 inch bar (£33.38)
  • Stihl 13 inch bar (£28.15)
  • Makita HR2630 SDS+ 3 Mode Rotary Hammer Drill 110V + Extra Accessories (£124.89)
  • Makita KP312/1 312mm Planer 110v (£1,400)
  • Makita DHS680Z 18V Brushless Circular Saw Li-Ion Body Only (£160.00)
  • Makita Router 3612c 240v 1850w (£91.00)
  • Makita DTD129 lxt lithium lon brushless impact driver and Bag (£189.74)
  • Makita 18v 3.0 Ah Li-ion Battery x3 (£134.97)
  • Makita DHP481Z 18v Li-lon LXT Brushless Cordless Combi Drill (£199.00)
  • Makita 18v cordless Drill DHP 459 SFE (189.99)
  • Makita DC18rc 18v li-ion fast battery charger 7.2-18v (£33.25)
  • Makita GA4530 4 ½” Angle Grinder 240v (£49.99)
  • Makita RT0700 CX4 Router 240v (£109.00)
  • Makita 1100 240v Planer 82mm (£280.00)
  • Bosch Palm Router GKF 600 ¼” 240v incase (175.00)
  • Bosch pex 220 a random orbit sander (£49.99)
  • MMC 220 Wagner Moisture Meter (£406.00)
  • Arbortech Mini Carver Power Tool (£196.99)
  • Arbortech Contour Sander (£65.00)
  • Arbotech Mini Turbo Kit (£106.00)
  • Arbortech Turbo Plane Blade (£120.00)
  • Japanese Pro Ryoba Saw (ice Bar) 240mm (£104.00)
  • Handmade Japanese Ryoba saw for Hardwood (£104.00)
  • Axminister six piece bevel edge chisel set (£92.00)
  • 1.5 Chisel & Point Crowbar (£29.99)

Total £5,490

story:
"Shaded Path" - Tom Costa & Frank Musarra, 2018

----------------------------------------------------------------------

HAUNTED MILL Maxon Mills, Wassaic, New York

Saturday, Oct 27, 2018 - Free Admission

https://www.wassaicproject.org/

 

The shadow is familiar to us all as a literal and symbolic place of obfuscation. Jung uses the shadow to describe the dark side of the human personality, the opposite of the conscious ego, a realm of primal and dark impulses too abhorrent to be acknowledged by our cultivated personas. We all cast a shadow when we stand in the light, and we all have an inner hidden dimension. Some turn away from the shadow, others eagerly ply the peripheries of consciousness to get a glimpse into the heart of darkness.

 

MORE PROJECT SPECIFICS IN THE FAQ

 

About the artists:

Tom Costa is an artist living and working in Peekskill NY Tom Costa has been developing his painting centric practice since receiving an MFA from Cranbrook in 2004. He has exhibited his work widely throughout New York, the nation, and abroad.

http://www.tomcosta.com

Frank Musarra is a Brooklyn-based multimedia artist and technologist. He has consulted on the fabrication of large scale installation pieces that have exhibited in the Museum of Contemporary Art Chicago, The Institute of Contemporary Art Philadelphia, Philadelphia Mural Arts / Monument Lab, and more.

http://heartsofdarknesses.es/

 

Tom and Frank have collaborated on a variety of multimedia projects together over the years: 

https://www.salon94.com/blog/detail/terry-adkin...

https://mcachicago.org/Exhibitions/2015/The-Fre...

http://liveatsheastadium.com/band/a-m-gems/

 

Where did you come up with the amount to raise?

We spent August and September building a 1/5th scale mockup of the installation in a Peekskill, NY studio. After success with our demo unit, we were able to calculate the exact cost of supplies in order to build our 40 foot structure.

 

What will you do with all of the building supplies after the exhibition has ended?

We will be donating all building supplies to be reused by the Poughkeepsie chapter of Habitat for Humanity https://www.habitat.org/local/restore?zip=12592

 

What is the Wassaic Project?

The Wassaic Project is an artist-run arts organization located in Wassaic, New York. Currently it consists of a year-round competitive residency program and summer arts programming which culminate in a large, free summer festival, in its ninth year. The organization makes use of restored historic buildings in the hamlet of Wassaic, including Maxon Mills, a seven-story former wood crib grain elevator, which has been converted into exhibition, office, and studio spaces.

 

What is the Haunted Mill?

Join us this October as more than 14 artists stage a takeover of Maxon Mills! http://www.wassaicproject.org/events/2018-haunt...

story:
Cocktails with a Conscience

Single Mom Defined and Repair the World are co-hosting Cocktails With a Conscience, benefiting nearly a dozen nonprofits serving single mothers and children in the Pittsburgh region. The cocktail party with a purpose will highlight the needs of single moms, who account for 78 percent of households living in poverty in Allegheny County, and bring people together that might be catalyzed to serve based on their experiences and the people that they meet. Guests will have tangible ways to do just that through donation drives, mentor recruitment, and advocacy activities.  

What You'll Get

We’ll provide the appetizers and a cash bar, with each cause paired with a cocktail. For every signature drink sold, the proceeds go directly to the organization! If you donate to our campaign, we'll reserve your ticket to attend this free, but limited space, event! Plus, you'll get a chance to win great prizes, like dinner for four with wine pairings (valued at $1,000!!!) at Superior Motors. Want to be a sponsor or donate a prize? Email heather@motormouthmultimedia.com.

What You'll Give

Bring yourself, a friend and a donation (Tampons for Pittsburgh Period or a black doll for Fro Gang’s toy drive.) You'll also get a chance to support the Women and Girls Foundation by participating in the PA for Paid Leave letter-writing campaign. 

We know how to throw a party, so there will be plenty of entertainment, including a DJ, singer and Single Mom Defined art exhibit. Plus, we'll have a delicious dessert bar by a single mom baker.

Who Will Benefit

Amachi Pittsburgh

Beauty Beyond Brokenness

Fro Gang

Free Store 15104

Free Store Wilkinsburg

Healthy Start Pittsburgh

Jeremiah's Place

Ozzie and Me Scholarship Foundation                                                                                                                     

Pittsburgh Period

Single Mom Defined

The Hollander Project

Women and Girls Foundation

story:
About Me

  • I'm Jamie - preschool teacher and aspiring photographer. 
  • Check out my websites to see my work
  1.  Photography Portfolio 
  2.  Digital Projects
  3.  Instagram

What I Need & What You Can Do To Help Me

    • I am aiming to raise $1000 for the purchase and insurance of a Fujifilm X100T Digital Camera ( specs listed at the bottom for those that are interested)
    • This summer I will be traveling to France and Romania and am really looking forward to working on existing photo projects and creating new ones. A digital camera will be an incredible asset in addition to my usual analog equipment. I have three current projects that are ready for the transition into the digital realm.
    • I want to explore digital photography as I have strictly worked in film for the last ten years. 

  • You will receive a thank you gift no matter the amount you choose to donate!

The Impact

  • As I begin applying to workshops and residency programs it will be important to have a concise and meaningful portfolio to share.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, that is OKAY! You can help in other ways !

  • You can share this page on your Twitter, Instagram, or Facebook!
  • You can email this page to your friends !

Please make a contribution!

- Jamie :D !

( Dirty Scan ^ haha )

Camera Specs :

  • 16.3MP APS-C X-Trans CMOS II Sensor
  • EXR Processor II
  • Fujinon 23mm f/2 Fixed Focal Length Lens
  • Hybrid Optical and Electronic Viewfinder
  • Parallax-Correct Electronic Rangefinder
  • 3.0" 1.04m-Dot LCD Monitor
  • Full HD 1080p Video Recording at 60 fps
  • Intelligent Hybrid AF System
  • ISO 51200, Continuous Shooting to 6 fps
  • Electronic Shutter & Built-In ND Filter

 You will receive a thank you gift no matter the amount you choose to donate!    The Impact  
As I begin applying to workshops and residency programs it will be important to have a concise and meaningful portfolio to share.



    Other Ways You Can Help If you are unable to donate, that is OKAY! You can help in other ways !  You can share this page on your Twitter, Instagram, or Facebook! You can email this page to your friends !   Please make a contribution!- Jamie :D !( Dirty Scan ^ haha )Camera Specs :

16.3MP APS-C X-Trans CMOS II Sensor
EXR Processor II
Fujinon 23mm f/2 Fixed Focal Length Lens
Hybrid Optical and Electronic Viewfinder
Parallax-Correct Electronic Rangefinder
3.0" 1.04m-Dot LCD Monitor
Full HD 1080p Video Recording at 60 fps
Intelligent Hybrid AF System
ISO 51200, Continuous Shooting to 6 fps
Electronic Shutter & Built-In ND Filter

story:
Hi, my name is Jenn and I'm an artist.

I grew up in Philomath, Oregon; spent a lot of time in Portland, Oregon where I got my Bachelors of Fine Art; moved to Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania where I used my BFA working in a community printmaking studio; and am currently living in Philadelphia where I received my Masters of Fine Art in May, 2013. It’s important to note that for every major move in my life art and art making has always been a strong motivating factor. Over the years I’ve been lucky to travel to places like England, Spain, Morocco, Ecuador and Spain, and most recently South Korea. Every time I’ve had the good fortune to travel I have learned, seen, and experienced so much that has all in one way or another greatly affected my artistic practice.

As a multi-media artist -- I make a lot.

I make paintings, drawings, books, prints, installations, and more...

If I can get my hands on it, I’ll use it.

It’s because of all the things I make that I was recently asked to participate in an artist residency at D’Clinic Studios in Lendava, Slovenia for the month of July. I’m very excited to participate in D’Clinic’s programming, experience Slovenian culture, and make new work. Because of my past experiences traveling -- I know this opportunity will make a DIRECT impact upon my career as a working artist. 

As it stands, I am already working towards various gallery or other presentation opportunities in Philadelphia and Washington D.C. to showcase work completed while at D'Clinic Studios.

Unfortunately, costs are high.

I’ve already saved up roughly three thousand dollars since January when offered this amazing opportunity and this will go directly towards living costs while in Slovenia, rent and utilities back in Philadelphia, transportation costs while in Slovenia, food, art supplies, and other incidental costs. Unfortunately, I’m running out of time and airplane tickets are expensive. After a lot of research, looking at various flight carriers and flight paths, $1700 is the average cheapest ticket price flying to Ljubljana, the capital of Slovenia. This is what I’m asking you for help with.

Price breakdown:

After researching several flight carriers and flight paths I've found that Delta Airlines typically offers the cheapest flights to Ljubljana International Airport, leaving from Philadelphia with a transfer in France. The $1700 I'm asking for will cover a roundtrip ticket.

Perks:

I'm offering a variety of pieces that I have completed over the last two years.

I highly suggest the "Exclusive Update Emails." Ever wondered what an artist residency abroad looks like? Want to see what I'm doing when I'm doing it? Curious about Slovenia? I'll be off all social media sites while working at D'Clinic Studios -- with the exception of these weekly emails. Starting one week before I leave and ending one week after I return, this perk will give you an exclusive look at what an artist residency can look like, how my work output will take shape, and all the Slovenian factoids I can fit in! Plus, lots of pictures!

For a little more money, I also suggest the "Artist's Book." As part of my residency at D'Clinic Studios I will be completing a published Artist's Book. This will be a unique look at my time and work output while in Slovenia. I will be receiving 20 copies, 15 of which I offer to you!

International supporters: Please consider donating extra to help offset shipping costs!

**UPDATES** With 62 hours left in my campaign, 111% was hit!

Absolutely none of this could have happened without all the support I've gotten from everyone. Literally every dollar counted towards my goal, no amount of support was too small.

Having said that: there are still perks to be had for your walls and bookshelves! Please consider sharing this campaign via your social networks to get the word out.

For complete transparency: money that is received above and beyond my initial amount will go directly towards travel and art supply costs while in Slovenia as well as transportation of my finished work back to the States. This IS NOT going towards things like paying my rent or utilities in Philadelphia.

Again, thank you so much for everyone's support. Initially I felt a mixture of emotions when deciding if I should do this or not -- mostly embarrassment -- but the kind words and financial support I have received have been truly inspiring.

Thank YOU!

For more information:
D'Clinic Studios
JPascoe.com
